Professor Baum is a fantastic instructor but also an incredibly tough grader. Class is made up entirely of exams, so don't fail any because otherwise, you'll fail the course. He also offers little to no extra credit, so don't forget to prep for exams because they're your only source of redemption.

Dr. Baum is one of the most kind and caring professors I've had at OSU. He does not use lecture slides, which is an adjustment at first, but is very engaging in class. His course was no cakewalk and the material bordered on dull at times, but it wasn't bad if you pay attention and study for exams.

Dr. Baum is one of the best professors at OSU. Truly one of the nicest, most knowledgeable, and helpful professors I've had. Not an easy A but wont make you cry yourself to sleep. Not an overwhelming amount of work but covers a lot of material. He does not use any notes and lecture is completely oral, which is an adjustment but helped me focus.

Baum is one of my favorite professors at OSU because he cares a lot about his students. I learned a lot in this course, and not just surface-level content but a deeper understanding of the Supreme Court. I recommend recording lectures because while they are engaging, they are long, and they are pretty much your only source of class content.

Professor Baum's class isn't "easy" but you will learn a lot. I truly feel lucky to have been able to take 2 classes with him. You won't meet a professor at OSU that's more knowledgeable, kind, and caring. And he's hilarious.

He does not use any kind of slides or another presentation tool in class, he talks at you for 1:20 straight. This class was also graded solely on exams, which is not something I enjoy. I found recording the lectures to be somewhat helpful, but overall was not a fan of him at all. He is also confusing, sometimes going back on what he said before.

Professor Baum was likely the most knowledgable and accessible professor I've had. The class was comprised of 3 papers, all research-based. However, you're given the time and resources to get it done, and he is there every step of the way to help. I wish I had another class with him because he is one of the kindest and smartest professors I've had.

Lawrence Baum might be the best professor I've had at OSU. While the class is totally lecture based, the way he presents the material is so interesting and you can tell how much he knows and loves what he does. I would suggest studying early because if you do the topic guides and know them well, you'll be fine on the exams!

He's such a friendly guy, but I found his class to be difficult, despite never skipping and taking a lot of notes. Only grades are 3 exams, and we needed to know so much specific information for each exam that it was pretty overwhelming. Lectures are no slides, just him talking and writing on the board. Class was tough but you learn A LOT.

I was terrified when I heard about the big final paper (20-25) pages. but trust me, it's not that bad, you do 10 of those pages halfway in the year. He is one of the most knowledgable profs at osu, he really leads the field in SCOTUS things. very kind and more than happy to help with anything. I would recommend this class to anyone.
SHOW UP TO CLASS AND U WILL PASS All lectures are spoken which can be tough. Best professor i've had though, hands down.

A king. Only spoken lectures which is kind of difficult at first but you get used to it. He puts guides for each lecture on Carmen that are basically study guides for the exams. He really wants his students to succeed and is willing to help in whatever way you can. Every poli sci student should have to take him.

He's very auditory and doesn't post his slides online but he's one of the best professors I've ever had. he's very engaging and passionate about the subject. he also is objective when discussing controvercial topics

Professor Baum is by far one of my favorite professors at Ohio State. He makes his lectures incredibly interesting and does his best to be sure students understand his points. He was extremely helpful when I went to his office hours for clarifications and makes it a goal to get to know his students. If you are a poli sci major, take his classes!

Professor Baum is by far one of the best professors I have had the privilege to come across. He is clearly passionate about the material he teaches, respects each students as an individual with valued thoughts, and is very amiable and funny. Definitely attend class and take meticulous notes. This class is totally worth it, learned so much.

Prof. Baum has to be one of the absolutely best professors at Ohio State. I came into the class with a mild interest in civil liberties and just trying to get my PoliSci GE, but it's honestly one of my favorite classes to go to. Exams can be tough, but if they are he'll admit it and scale appropriately. An absolute joy to learn from, & funny too.

He is probably one of the nicest professors at the whole university. He is very caring and will help you with anything. The midterms took a little getting used to but he provides materials to help. Just keep up with the readings and go to class.

One-of-a-kind professor. Makes material accessible, and always more than willing to answer any questions you may have. You NEED to pay attention when you go to lecture, as the exams will sometimes cover material that is only discussed in-class. I'd recommend him to people of all majors, but Professor Baum is a MUST if you're a polisci major.

He was one of my favorite professors I've had at OSU. Be ready to take diligent notes if you want to succeed, but as long as you pay attention you should be fine. The material is interesting and it seems like he genuinely wants all of his students to do well.
Great professor. Genuinely cares about students, tests are all essays but if you take good notes in class you should get an A

Three exams (30%, 35%, 35%) and two opportunities to earn extra credit (up to 5%). Go to class and take detailed notes. Take notes on the cases you read. Study these two sets of notes and an A is easy. The class is difficult because the sheer amount of material covered. Baum is clear, friendly, and interested in his students. A great mentor

One of my favorite professors at Ohio State.  I have based my schedule around what other courses I can take with him.  This was one of my hardest classes ever, but I learned more than I thought I could in one class. If you have the chance, take a class with Professor Baum. There also wasn't a textbook, just online readings.

Lectures are straightforward and so are the exams. Do the readings and take good notes in class and this class should not be any trouble. 3 exams and two chances to earn extra credit as well. Lectures are interesting and he answers questions constantly to help clarify the course.
The best political science professor I have had in my three years at OSU. Would definitely take another course by him.
Tough class. Grading is rigorous. But, the teaching is excellent. If you want to get at least a B, you must read the textbook and follow the study guide.

I loved this class and would take it again in a heartbeat. That being said, the class itself was extremely difficult. All of his lectures are spoken, so be sure to take notes. Do not skip class because you will fail the exam, if you do. He is a tough grader, but he curves his exams. Go to office hours-he is extremely helpful and willing to clarify.

Just to add to what everyone else has said, Professor Baum is awesome. Definitely the best professor I've had here. I took this class because I had previously taken his Civil Liberties class which was great as well. He explains things very well, and always makes time to meet students if you want. Tests should be fine if you take good notes.
Amazing Professor. Very knowledgeable. Kind of difficult exams,but extremely helpful if you need it.

Great professor. Excellent lectures, very clear. Exams are all essay and can be very challenging. Some topics can be confusing and Prof. Baum does a great job to make them clear. However, again, the exams are not easy.

Absolutely fantastic professor. He's one of the nicest professors I've ever had, and really has true expertise of the Supreme Court and all issues surrounding it. There is a fair bit of reading, but if you go to every class the exams are not too difficult.

Professor Baum is honestly awesome. He is funny, witty and extremely passionate about teaching. His class was all spoken lecture, so attendance was mandatory if you wanted a good grade. He also tends to be a hard grader, but if you go to class and take notes, an A is no problem.
Very clear. Three written exams with a clear outline that acts as exam reviews. Highly knowledgeable and very nice guy.

The best professor I've had at OSU.  He is really funny, and is willing take questions and turn them into great class discussions.  I learned a ton in this class.  It's not super easy, but if you take good notes, and just memorize those, you can definitely get an A.  You just need to go to lectures:)

lectures are very organized, and stay on task. Baum is very good at communicating material. Exams are tough, but you will get a lot out of the class if you attend lectures, take notes and do the readings. I hated it at the time, but now I see how much I learned from that class. Definitely recommend it-- if you're willing to work.

Prof. Baum is a really nice guy. POLITSC 519 is the toughest political science class I've taken to date. But I can tell you, after Baum I won't forget a single detail from any of the cases we studied.
Great professor, really knows his stuff.  Tests are hard but if you attend class and TAKE NOTES you will do fine.  I recommend taking him.

PS 521H was my favorite class ever.  The class is based upon a 20-to-25-page paper predicting a Supreme Court decision.  Prof. Baum is extremely helpful in providing background knowledge, theory, and sources to analyze Supreme Court cases.  You will learn a lot in this class.
Professor Baum was very interested in the subject matter and very helpful. Exams weren't too difficult but there were a lot of readings.

Damn, this class was a kick in the butt. Make no mistake, Baum is a hell of teacher but I thought I was gonna fail after I left the final (I didn't) Still, he is perhaps the finest professor here at OSU and one of the foremost scholars in his field in the entire country. Hard class, but a downright amazing teacher who will teach the crap out of you

Dr. Baum is the best professor at Ohio State. His intelligence, knowledge of the subject, and willingness to help students make his class a must take. Be prepared to come to class and do the readings. If you do, you'll be fine.

EXCELLENT PROFESSOR. Just about the nicest man you could meet and painfully intelligent about his subject. The very engaging lectures for this class contain a LOT of information but a vast majority is not required information. If you simply follow his directions and focus on what he says to you can do well in this course with little stress. Take it

Baum is the best teacher in this university. Do not hesitate to take his class- they always fill up very quickly. He's nice to everyone, regardless of how rude they are to him and he will go out of his way to help you. The grades are usually a midterm and a final- and he has his own curve system. Show up to class and take good notes and you'll be o

Dr. Baum is a great, extremely knowledgeable professor who is willing to go the extra mile for his students to make sure they understand the concepts covered in class. 1 20 page paper is most of the grade.

Great teacher!  Can't wait to take another class with him. Always took time to answer questions in class, and very quick to respond via email. Grading system was 2 midterms and a final. Attendance isn't mandatory, but the lecture is so relevant to the test, that you have to attend.  Definitely buy the book, but only read what he says.
Good class very interesting lectures.  Reading is helpful for the tests although I got by without it.  Very nice guy and a fun and interesting class!

Dr. Baum is a nice guy and a great professor. He's clearly very passionate about the subject he teaches. He's difficult however, and this class is taught at a much more difficult level than others I've taken. There is a lot of work involved, and even though he's a hard grader, he's very fair. Overall, a good professor.

I have had him for 519 and 514 and he is by far, the best professor this university has! Make sure you attend lectures and do the readings! He is very helpful in making sure the difficult material is clearly presented!

Professor Baum is one of the highest quality professors I've had thus far. Very impressed with test sheets, providing rationale for answers. He seemed genuinely interested in teaching and helping students. would highly reccomend Dr. Baum

Great professor. Overall this is a research class. We had 2 shorter papers about theory that were designed to give us a foundation for the major term paper (about 20 pages). He is a very hard grader but interesting to talk to and is very helpful.
Very interesting lectures and material.  Makes class interesting and relates cases to real world issues.  Funny.  Great teacher.

Amazing Professor - I learned a ton in his class and always felt like he was available to help if I had any questions. The papers he assigns are difficult, but also very rewerding - as is the entire class
very helpful prof, and obviously very humble about his familiarity with the subject.  very tough grader!
I had a lot of fun in his class! Great for office hours visits

Amazing professor, caring, helpful.  Tests may be a bit difficult, but he sets up your notes in such a way to make it easily done after the first test.  Always willing to help you, with in class of personal problems.  Made my time at OSU wonderful with the mentorship he provided.  Would love to take more classes with him.  If you have the opportunity do take it; you won't regret it.
He is a nice guy and the class actually turned out to be interesting, I know a lot more about politics now!
easy good teacher

Baum is probably the best prof. at OSU.  Although many claim that he is hard, he expects you to actually read and engage with the material, which should be a requirement in upper-level college courses. If you are on the way to law school I definitely reccomend him. He wrote me a nice reccomendation!

One of the best organized lectures i've ever had.  He relates the subjects to real life events well.  He communicates all of the subject matter very clearly and makes it more interesting than it already is.  there was a really big curve, not that you'd need it if you want to lecture, though.

Great professor, loves to teach and knows his stuff.  The class isn't easy- but go to class and study the material and you'll be fine.  And you're not screwed if you do poorly on the first midterm...you just need to get used to his tests.
Very smart, very nice, very helpful.  The best prof I've had.  His class takes a lot of studying, but he's always open to questions and really cares about the students.

He's a great teacher for learning beyond the textbook, but TERRIBLY HARD! He's very willing to help, but it's almost not worth it b/c like someone else said "if you bomb the first test - YOU'RE SCREWED!"  Good guy, but I won't take with him agai
Good teacher, compares the material to everyday things.  Fun guy
Awesome!  One of best at OSU!  You learn a lot and although the grading is not always easy, his comments are very helpful and detailed so you really progress as a student.  Two very big thumbs up!
my hero, too.  i want to be the same kind of teacher he is.

Took 4 courses with him (3 A's & 1 B) and I still consider him the best I had at OSU.  I also consider him my mentor and an outstanding academic counselor.  Many years after graduations he still remembers me!  AWESOME!
my mentor, my hero

Took Women and the Law with.  If you don't do well on the first exam, you're screwed the rest of the course.  He even questioned my desire to be a law student!  HA HA, I'm kicking ass and taking names in law school, and this course was disgustingly hard.

This professor is rude, unapproachable, and grades harshly with unclear instructions. She assigns excessive busywork, reads off slides instead of teaching, and forces participation in 8 AM classes. Important details are hidden in modules, making assignments confusing. She relies on group work instead of real instruction. Avoid this class!

This course was on the lighter side as it consisted mostly of contribution to a final group project. Attendance was mandatory on TopHat and taken everyday, you could miss 2 before being deducted. There were readings before every class along with a quiz. Classes mostly consisted of group discussions and small group discussions.

Macaskill was incredibly interested in the subject, but at times can be boring. The class is surrounding one final essay that you submit paragraphs over the course of the semester, which is graded for primarily submission. The essay was challenging at times, but she grades easily. Overall a decent class if you need polisci credit.

The readings for this class are very interesting and engaging. Has the best interest for all her students and is more than willing to work with you on getting a good grade for the class. She has given out multiple opportunities for extra credit throughout the semester, and is very passionate about her teachings.
Cares about students, always willing to provide help to make sure students understand content. Open to listening to feedback. Would take a class with her in the future.

Goes off topic a lot, you can tell he just likes to hear himself speak. VERY inaccessible outside of class, he is an awful advisor too. Only reason I did not rate a 1 is because the class itself is semi-interesting.

Genuinely one of the best professors Ive had at OSU. His class is super engaging and make you wanna get up at 9am to go to lecture. Exams and quizzes are super straight forward if you attend lecture and do the study guide. Definitley would take another class with him.

Professor Smith shows a passion for his teaching like it's nobody's business. The exams are large and robust; however, he provides every student with the opportunity to bring one cheat sheet. I found that making the cheat sheet itself is a great way to study, to the point where I barely needed to reference it during the exams.

Decent guy but awful lecturer. Spends a ridiculous amount of time on irrelevant, inane details but hurries over the important stuff. Thinks he is more entertaining than he is, essentially no room for discussion because he loves the sound of his own voice. Slides are incredibly disorganized. Extra credit not worth the pain of sitting through class

lectures are long bc he talks a lot but they're interesting and there are not many papers. I took it for honors credit and the only additional requirement was a research paper. hes also veyr fun to talk to and understanding of conflicts or extensions

Genuinely one of the funniest professors I have ever had. He made waking up at 9 AM to go to class easy because he was that great. Content was really interesting. Grade depends on quizzes and 3 exams. Quizzes were easy, exams did take a good amount of studying but they really weren't that bad plus it's possible to not have to take the final.

Charles was amazing. His lectures are engaging, he's funny, and the content is useful for anyone hoping to go to law school or work in the government. The tests took a bit of studying, but none of the exams were overly challenging, and he lets you opt out of the final if you do well enough on the first 2 exams. Can't recommend him enough.
great professor. I took the honors section. Go to class and you'll do great

I took Gun Politics spring of 2023 while I was really struggling with my mental health. I fell extremely behind in this class from not doing any assignments and was failing. I reached out to Prof. Smith and he was so kind and helpful, he was able to meet with me in person that very next day and allowed me to redo EVERY assignment for FULL credit.

I love Professor Smith! He is one of the best professors at Ohio State. I came into this course really hesitant because of his background with gun, but he has made the great for both sides of the argument. He is a really easy grader on papers and gives good feedback. Such a great professor that I am taking his con law class next semester!

Professor Smith is the best political science professor I have had so far at Ohio State. He makes coming to class fun and all of the information that he taught in this class I can recite from memory not from studying just because it was that interesting and not dense to learn. I highly recommend him and this class at least once at Ohio State!
Great professor, great class. He makes it difficult to fail, pay attention to lectures and study a bit. You'll be perfectly fine.

Professor Smith is the best!!! He is one of those professors who will make sure you know the material well while trying not to stress you with exams. I learn so much about the material despite having lots of extra credit!! Just take his class! You wont regret it!!

Really enjoyed Professor Smith, and would take this class again. I took it during the pandemic, so everything was online and open note. If you miss a zoom lecture it was no big deal because he always posted recordings. Quizzes were simple and the midterm and final were online and open note.

This is one of my favorite professors and favorite classes. The material was interesting and he does a really great job of discussing controversial issues. He makes it pretty clear from the beginning he does not want this class to be a point of stress. 2 exams, 4 opinion/reaction essays, 6 quizzes and he drops the lowest. pretty entertaining too!

EASY 4000 level class. Based off of 3 exams and 7 online quizzes. Your lowest quiz score gets converted to extra credit. Exams were very easy, I didn't have to take the final bc my grade was 87+%, and book was "required" but I stopped using it after the first exam because I didn't need it. Ended with 102.5%. Take him! Very funny guy also.

I took two classes with him! He's really funny and makes class enjoyable. It's really hard not to get an A, he gives you so much EC. The shooting range trip was really cool. I also liked the documentaries and guest speakers. Plus he navigates controversial topics really well!

TAKE THIS CLASS! Show up to lecture and you'll ace the quizzes PLUS he'll bump up your grade at the end if he sees you had good attendance. Four short papers and if you turn them in early he'll give you a 100%. Only look at the material he gives you on the review guides and the exams are easy, not to mention there's up to 10pts of EC on the exams.
Annoying and overrated. Take it if you need a GPA boost but not if you wanna learn anything worthwhile
Terribly boring. Charles isn't nearly as interesting or funny as he thinks he is. Information is spread way too thin and honestly the class is pretty useless but it's an easy A.

Had Professor Smith for a second session class and he was absolutely amazing. He was always very informative. Ended up with over a 100% in this class because of the amount of extra credit along with the midterms being easy. Professor Smith is also very accommodating and helpful by responding to emails in a timely manner.

Great Professor. Had him for a Session 2 class and it was a breeze. Had to write a few papers but the exams were easy, you could bring a full sheet of notes, and he made a study guide. He is also a fun and interesting professor. Definitely woulf recommend.

Really good prof, interesting and funny lectures. He tends to get side-tracked a lot and his presentations aren't that helpful, which made the exams somewhat difficult, but I'm pretty sure he grades on a curve. 4 short "reaction" papers helped boost your grade. Lots of guest speakers and videos as well. Show up, pay attention, and you'll pass.

Great professor. Very knowledgable about the subjects he teaches, and his exams are relatively easy as long as you know the material. His lectures are interesting and worth going to even though attendance isn't required. Lots of extra credit as well (even though he claims that he thinks he gave us too much)
Awesome Professor. Interesting class

Professor Charles Smith is definitely one of the best professors I've ever had in my life.  He claims to be a Republican, but you would never guess it based on his lectures. He is very funny and will keep students engaged for the entire class period. Professor Smith is probably one of the most knowledgeable people about politics and government

Professor Smith is awesome. The Gun Politics course was awesome. Professor Smith is a republican, and as a democrat I thought he did very well at lecturing without any political bias on an issue where political bias is often prevalent. Lots of extra credit, hard not to get an A.
Only three exams for Con Law but gives so much bonus that it's impossible to get less than a 100%

You couldn't ask for a better professor! Taking a course with him before you graduate is a must. Professor Smith makes you want to come to class all the time. He is hilarious, lectures are entertaining, and there are also guest speakers and videos! You will learn everything you ever wanted to know about guns and even get to go to the shooting range

One of the best classes I have ever taken at OSU, and definitely one of the best professors. He is funny, engaging, and keeps your interest for the full hour and 20 minutes. No exams, he focuses mainly on a few quizzes and papers, and if you show up more than you don't, you should be able to get an A.

The course was a global view on gun control. there were 2 exams about 4 quizzes online and 1 ten page research paper. He gives a lot of extra credit points through out the term. Attendance was taken and counted to help you if you attended not hurt you if you did not. very interesting He is a nice guy and a great instructor.

Such a cool guy. There are a couple papers and online & open book quizzes but if you do the work an A is pretty easy. He is very helpful during office hours and the class is interesting. I definitely recommend the course!
Interesting lectures by one of the best PoliSci professors I've had at Ohio State. Easy A if you do the readings for each quiz and have him review your paper before turning it in. Take this class.

Do the readings, study each court case and read the power points.  If you do that, there's no way you leave without an A.  Class consists of 3 non-comprehensive exams (85%) and 4 quizzes (15%).  My favorite professor by far.  Highly recommended!!
Very good teacher and helpful as well. He definitely knows his stuff and the class was not very difficult at all. Online quizzes and a few papers. Not graded hard as long as you try.
He was definitely my favorite professor that I had at Ohio State. It was the only class that I actually looked forward to attend.
This guy is a great teacher! He really cares about his students, he is hilarious, and he makes you actually WANT to come to class. I learned a lot, and look forward to taking him again!
He is a great teacher. Hilarious and very good at making material comprehensible. Also had review sessions before each midterm that helped a lot. He is also an amazing advisor.

Mr. Smith is amazing. He's hilarious, crass, and does provide a lot of valuable, relevant info in this careers seminar. To boot, he's a great advisor and will show you how to navigate OSU's disastrous bureaucracy like a pro.

This was my first quarter at Ohio State and after taking this class, I would recommend it to anybody who has an interest in Political Science.  He's really nice and helpful and his lectures are always interesting.  What I liked the most was that the lecture content differed from the textbook.  He's also really funny.  An overall awesome experience.
Awesome professor! Take anything he teaches!
Take 589! It's the easiest A on campus! Class went the full time twice maybe?! The last class was 3 minutes long! Charles is amazing!
Awesome teacher that uses real life to teach. He's humorous and straight to the point. Awesome teacher

If you are looking for an easy class, you found it. If you are hoping to learn something, look elsewhere. Getting a high A is easy, even without reading or going to class. Right wing bias is evident in class, but he grades fairly. There are better instructors to take, but if you need a no effort A, go ahead.
take this class. hes a great professor and made me incredibly interested in politics. the rest of the department is just like him, and thats a big deal.
Great class, great instructor..  a wonder to talk to outside of class
he knows his stuff... which makes it very very interesting class
The Barry Goldwater of Profs (and that's a good thing). Easily the best Prof I have had at Ohio State.  He cares about the subjects he takes on and it shows.
makes you understand what you need to learn about the course
Great guy!  He's really funny and knows his stuff. Mainly useless facts about presidents, but good for trivia and entertainment. I'd totally recommend!

This class was really cool.  I learned a lot and getting an A is not all that difficult.  If you take notes and understand them and do the easy reading, then no problem.  It is hard to mess up in this class, but going to it is almost essential.

Charles "Chuck" Smith is a funny guy with an eye for politics. This class, "the presidency", focuses on all branches of the federal government. His powerpoints are long and boring, and his questions draw mainly from historical trivia, but you will never find an easier 500-level class. Just study the slides and make sure you understand. An A awaits.

This class, as Smith says multiple times, is hard to fail. The lecture notes are on powerpoint on carmen. Everything is easy, but the tests do have an overwhelming amount of trivia or seemingly unnecessary questions, so you do have to study for them. Papers are graded easily though as long as you try.

Very good teacher. Makes it interesting, listens to all opinions, not partisan, uses multiple types of materials to teach. Tests are fair, but include a little too much trivia. Take this class if you are interested in the presidency.
Funny! Had good notes on Power Point slides every day and also mixed videos and internet videos into his classes. A+

Mr. Smith is an excellent and entertaining lecturer.  Grades very fairly and gives unique and interesting assignments.  590.01 was especially interesting about a subject (Guns and Politics) that you won't find taught anywhere else.  501 was also great and had unique and funny trivia and facts about our Presidents.
Great teacher...One of the best teachers at OSU...I've taken several classes of his and have learned a lot...Take his classes!!
590.01 is his worse class by far. Mr. Smith is a great teacher and is always there to help his students. Take any of his class's that you can. Mr. Smith is the man! Finally, a Bush supporter at OSU!
good class
lots of notes but an easy class; very knowledgeable; always willing to answer questions and always in his office; would recommend highly
This was my second quarter with Charles. He's a very helpful and knowledgable course advisor. He is highly reccomended by me.
Easy, intelligent, friendly. If you get a chance, take one of his classes. One of the best instructors EVER! Only gripe is sometimes he gives out way too much information.
Easy Class. Charles is very helpful. I wish there would have been more analytical writing.
Charles is a good professor, just a little cocky, but the tests are extremely easy (all multiple choice) and the essays are graded fairly easily. Take his class, you learn a lot, and it's an easy A.
No Comments
Great guy and awesome teacher. An A is cake as long as you go to class.
Intersting class...courts and civil liberties. great discussion

He's a pretty laid back guy. The class involved a lot of memorization but the tests didn't seem too difficult - just pretty long. The lectures were generally entertaining, but I'm not sure how much stuff I learned is really practical

Somehow I would not put it past Charles to repeatedly vote for himself on this website, ,thus describing his high marks. His lecturs are somewhat entertaining, but I really did not learn alot from him. I was also disturbed by his constant drug referances. His class was easy, but he lacks any sort of professionalism or maturity. Huge ego too.
this guy just plain rocks at everything. great instructor, very knowledgeable, learned a ton!
Easy class. Good professor. Although, deadlines were set up very strangely, and once you figured out how you wanted to approach your final paper, it was useless to go to class.
He was a great teacher.  If you study a little bit you will do fine!
One of the best Poli Sci teachers I have had yet. He really makes learning the topic fun regardless of how boring the content actually is. Awsome teacher!
He is absolutely the funniest teacher at OSU.  You learn so much and he makes learning about politics interesting and fun!

You can tell he enjoys the subject he teaches and it makes all the difference in the world. Nothing is either dry and boring which makes you want to learn because he is so excited about teaching you. I really enjoyed the class.
easy class, well taught.
An amazing teacher.  Totally funny and also so amusing that you want to sit through the whole two hour lecture.  Only class I ever wanted to be at.
No Comments

She reads straight from her paper of notes and jumbles over her words a lot which makes her super confusing because she always contradicts herself. Nice person but not a fan of her teaching style. Also she is a super slow grader. Biggest issue was her just reading her own notes which sometimes did not even relate to the slides.

This class was managable, I recommend going to class the first month or two and then if you feel like you got it it doesn't matter if you stop attending class. This class has lots of papers so just be prepared to write. I didn't go to class the second half of the semester and ended with a 97 you will be fine. But professor Mitzen is awsome.
Her grading criteria were clear and understandable, for her papers I never questioned what I needed to write. You will be fine if you read the lecture notes and attend some major lectures.

Tons of reading but the online material she posts, interaction on Canvas, etc makes the course material easy to digest and navigate. If you read all the essays posted throughout the course, you will find the essay-writing assignments or discussion posts quite easy. Very easy grader too and very easy to approach and get any questions answered.
So nice!!!
Dr Mitzen is an amazing professor. I highly recommend going to her office hours. She really care about us, even though she is a full professor doing research.

Dr. Mitzen is great! I took POLITSC 1300, Global Politics, with her. She has a nice voice and is engaging. She offers Zoom calls for those who cannot attend class in-person, although in-person attendance is expected. She offers extra credit and general she is an easier professor who understands what an intro class should be.

Professor Mitzen is probably one of my favorite professors at OSU so far. She really cares about her students and is great at creating really informative conversations in class. Highly recommend taking a class with her!
Standard upper division IR course except this one comes with frequent reading quizzes that consist of vague questions worth 0.5 pts each for a total of 3/4 pts per quiz.

Professor Mitzen is a really kind Professor and is genuinely passionate about her teachings. I didnt think the homework was too overbearing and the quizzes were pretty easy. Towards the end of the semester some of the classes got a little boring, but the material was presented well.

Professor Mitzen did an excellent job handling the course during the pandemic. It was very easy to learn the material, and her lectures were engaging throughout the semester. This class has a lot of assignments of varied type (essays, quizzes, etc), but no assignment ever felt like it was busywork.

Professor Mitzen is SUCH a genuine and helpful woman. Really knowledgable about global politics and wants to make sure her students don't just do well in the class, but gain a true understanding of the topic. The class had a decent amount of writing assignments, but they were all doable; class takes effort but an A isn't hard to achieve.

Mitzen is a nice person and knowledgable prof but there are just TOO many assignments in this class. Movie responses, papers, short essays, group projects, etc. I feel like with all the stuff she throws at you it's hard to keep your head above water, especially in the midst of a pandemic.

Professor Mitzen is a great professor. Shes obviously very knowledgeable about what she teaches, and shes very kind and understanding. Only complaint is that there are a lot of papers- it seems like theres always something due for this class, especially in the second half.

This is the most boring political science class I have ever taken. Lectures are very boring and she delivers everything as if it's incredibly profound, but it just doesn't make sense. Work level is manageable, papers aren't too bad, and there is a big group project/simulation at the end. Would be bearable if lecture wasn't so boring.

I've never had any professor throw as much work at me in one class. Usually they pick a medium: tests, papers, group projects, movies, quizzes-- No In this class, its all of the above. I am drowning. 6 papers total. have to watch 2 movies. big group simulation. the content is fascinating but i can't keep my head above water with her expectations.

She was alright. She gives you the whole test to review a week before each exam. There's reading quizzes and group work so you kinda need to go to class. My main issue was she didn't use much visual aid; you really need to be a good auditory learner to succeed in class. I liked the movie-viewing hw! She seems pretty passionate about IR.

She did not count any of our exam grades towards our final grade so our final grade literally consisted for two 5 point papers and a 14 point syllabus quiz, so studying for hours for each exam was a WASTE and I ended with a lower grade than I would have had those exams actually COUNTED.. but hey it's good for the people who failed the exams i guess

A great professor, but it's sometimes hard to concentrate because it is all lecture-based and can be boring. Make sure to go to lecture and take notes because there are lecture questions on the exams. Generally gives you what is going to be on tests, which is helpful.

Dr. Mitzen was pretty middle of the road for me. The class was really dry even for someone who loves Political Science, but she's super straightforward about what she wants you to know and what the exams will look like. Don't take this if you aren't interested in PoliSci, but if you are you should find this relatively easy.
Mitzen is a great professor who is passionate about global politics. Buying the book is necessary, although you do not have to read 100% of it--but very helpful to read in preparation for an exam.

GO TO CLASS. It's not hard, but there aren't notes online and they ask questions on exams about things discussed in lecture. There are 3 exams and 2 short papers, no homework. The book is helpful. My only complaint is her lack of visual aids. No powerpoints or notes, just her talking and writing on the board. Don't take if you can't auditory learn.

She is so amazing!! I love this woman. She is so smart and helpful, and is so great to just talk to about life. She is so clear in lectures and very engaging. I used the textbook in this class purely as a study aid for when I had to miss class-- attend lectures and office hours and you will get an A!

Jennifer Mitzen was an amazing professor for the Political Science 1300 course. She gave unbiased lectures and represented all sides of global arguments.  If you are looking for a great teacher who is willing to help you learn then you should consider anything taught by Professor Mitzen.

Really clear lectures with outlines available online. Super important to show up to class and at the very least skim the book. Prepare for the tests using the study guide she gives a week in advance and its pretty hard not to do well.

Tough class, lots of reading, exams questions are answered in essay format using evidence from reading and lectures. Good teacher who explains everything clearly. Office hours available if you need help. Study guides given before exams. Do study guides before exam, go to class, take notes, and you should be fine

It can be pretty easy to get distracted while in lecture, but they are very important for the midterms and tests.  One half of each exam is based on information given in class, so if you miss, make sure you can copy notes.

For a General Education course this class is not worth your time.  If you're a bad test taker the class is definitely not for you considering your whole grade is divided up between 3 exams (2 midterms 1 final 30% each).  Her lectures are boring and not online and grading criteria is harsh for such a low level course, from a 4.0 student avoid her.

Mitzen was super clear on her lectures. Part of the exams are lecture based so you have to go to class to do well on that section. I found the class slightly difficult but the textbook was a lifesaver. Overall she's a good professor and I would take her classes again.

Grade: 2 response papers (5% each), 2 Midterms (30% each), Final (30%) + participation.  Tests are essay based including lecture & book.  Prompts given a week in advance.  The book isn't necessary but very helpful and easy read.  Her lectures are clear (not available online) w/ discussion structure. Help is easily available!
She's a good professor and there for you. Textbook is essential and you should keep up with reading and notes. Gives review sheet of exam a week before and a lot of discussion is down within class.

Great professor! She is very helpful during office hours. An A is possible if you just attend lectures and study the material for the tests.  She gives out a review sheet that covers all the material that could be on the exam.  I really liked her and enjoyed the class. I definitely recommend it.

Loved this class! If you go to the lectures and read the textbook (super easy read) then this class is a cake walk. Mitzen always had a bunch of office hours so if you needed extra help she would go out of her way to help you. The class was also set up in a way that allowed for a lot of interesting class participation which made the lectures fun.
She was pretty good. Seminar class, so lots of discussion. Statecraft simulation was a lot of fun. Basically gives you the exams; go to class and you'll do fine.
easy, go to class, read the book, you'll have no trouble getting an a. very helpful in office hours as well

I really liked Professor Mitzen. This class was mostly discussion based and she did a fantastic job facilitating the discussions. The book was necessary and doing the readings definitely helped provide a strong base for class discussions. There were four papers, three of which were mandatory. Overall an interesting class. I highly recommend it.

If you can keep up with taking notes, it should be easy. She talks very fast but everything on the notes and in the readings will help you on the tests, which have high expectations but weren't too bad. Extremely intelligent and insightful professor, I highly recommend for 145.

Going to class is pointless.Test review sheet released 1 wk in advance and is almost entirely on readings, which are not covered in class.Class notes are useless, confusing and without structure.Easy class to at least get a b in.i put forth almost no effort whatsoever and ended with a b. if you have to take this class, create study groups for test
Excellent teacher... only AM class I've ever had that I didn't fall asleep in... ever. Go to the office hours and review the study guide and you can't go wrong. Take good notes, too.

Dr. Mitzen is one of the best and brightest at OSU.  She knows her area (IR) very well and gives enlightening lectures backed up by relevant readings.  Her expectations for the midterm, quizzes, and final paper are clear, and her grading is very fair.  Do yourself a favor and take one of her classes, she's an up and comer. (very pretty btw!)
Simply amazing professor!  Wonderful lecturer and very helpful!

Nice young professor, the class is tough, but if you copy the notes fast enough and follow the study guide, an A is inevitable.  If taking her and you don't understand something on the study guide (because the study guide is basically the exam), go to her office hours and she will tell you exactly what you need to know.  Recommended.

Probably the best IR teacher I've had. I've learned a lot from her. She picks out excellent readings and likes to relate the subject matter to current events. She's also very fair to voice all perspectives. Tests and essays are moderately difficult and there is TONS of reading, but if you keep up with it, this should not be a problem.
Great teacher.  The class is fun, but you have to take notes very quickly and make sure to pay attention.  The exams are difficult but fair.  She is very helpful in her office hours.
Getting an A is definitely possible, but be prepared to do a whole lot of studying.  She's a tough grader but very helpful in answering questions if you need help/
Great teacher that cares about students.  Use the study guides to prepare for midterms.  Helpful in office hours.

Avoid taking this class with her. She just reads from the paper out loud very quickly, and here you are trying to take notes from that. Not very clear on explaining topics.  Gives study sheet which is helpful for the exams. Easy class but the way she explains makes it hard :)
Cares a lot about students. Takes time to help. Lectures clear, study guides tell you whats on test, but there is a lot to remember.
Enjoyable class, she makes sure to give every view on the issues.  Tests are pretty tough but there are study guides that help a lot.
No Comments

Great class!  The subject matter is very relevant, which makes the class interesting.  Lot's of time for discussion, so it's not all taking notes.  Tests are hard, but study sheets prepare you well.  Just do the work and you'll be fine.
Tophat participation and attendance graded. Only other grader are two exams and a paper.

Incredibly smart and educated professor. Great class. Lots of information in a short amount of time. Very quiet speaker but values opinions and discussion. Not an easy A but you will get a lot out of this class if you put the effort in.

One of the smartest / best professors I have had at OSU. This class will stretch your mind and you will grow as a student. Very discussion based. However, this is not an easy class. Does not round grade. You will have to put in a lot of work. You will be able to use what you learn in her class in other classes. Highly recommended

She is so engaging and wants everyone to do well in class. She is big on participation during discussions but if you talk to her she will include you in the discussions. Easily accessible outside of class. Her class is not an easy A, but probably one of the smartest professors in the Political Science department. Can not recommend her enough!

Dr.Saunders-Hastings is a phenomenal instructor and keeps the class engaged. She provides clear instructions and keeps everything organized. She provides excellent feedback on papers and she gives great advice about research.

Amazing professor, challenging but wildly interesting & enjoyable course. Dr. Saunders-Hastings was very supportive, always accessible outside of class, seems genuinely invested in students' growth. I never felt overlooked even as an undergrad in a graduate course. One of my favorite classes/profs to date!

This was one of my favorite classes. Professor Saunders-Hastings is so smart and our readings and lectures were always very engaging and interesting. It was not too hard either as long as you show up, engage and do the readings. I really enjoyed this class and got a lot out of it.

An absolute queen. She is one of my favorite professors at Ohio State. The class can be hard, but it's doable as long as you stay on top of the readings and show up every day. She encourages you to explore your own ideas in papers and she is one of the smartest people I've ever met. Really knows the ins and outs of political theory. Overall 10/10

She is so nice and helpful. If you have any suggestions, she is always willing to listen and is always looking to improve your learning experience. Definitely do the reading though and definitely participate. She was never judgmental of the ideas you have and always willing to explore them in more depth. Overall I really like her as a professor.

Very difficult but rewarding class. Took this for my minor and it was one of my favorites of the semester. I think it's a testament to a professor about how they handled the COVID-19 situation and ESH made the transition smooth and was very understanding. She is obviously very intelligent but is a tough grader, and the class has a LOT of reading.

This course is very objective, it is almost all based on philosophy. If you don't have an original idea or agree with prof. you may receive a bad grade on papers on tests. She grades off how much effort she thinks you gave. Also, she will tear you apart in your papers even though there are no clear-cut guidelines on what she really wants.

Dr. Saunders-Hastings definitely knows what shes doing; shes clearly knowledgeable on analyzing political arguments. 3440 was extremely reading intensive, but the readings were all valuable and had a clear purpose in the course. Shes super approachable; 10/10 would recommend.

Dr. Saunders-Hastings is extremely knowledgeable on many topics and conceptualizes political theory like none other. The class however, is extremely reading-intensive, and it can be very easy to fall behind in the difficulty and the amount of readings given. Dont take her class if youre looking for an easy grade-booster, youll get the opposite.

Dr. Saunders-Hastings is outstanding. Her class is demanding, but it was the most intellectually engaging class I've taken in college. She is wicked smart, accessible outside of class, and is really caring and gives positive feedback. She is overall incredible and so good at guiding class discussion and analyzing the nuances of political theories.

Do not take this class if you want your grade to be determined by 4 things. 2 of the grades in this class are done by the TA and the other 2 are a midterm and a final. There is no and I mean NO wiggle room if you do poorly on one assignment. All the "answers" in this class are subjective which should lean towards leniency but there is none.

I absolutely loved having Prof. Saunders-Hastings! Shes incredibly intelligent, and she very much knows her way around political theory. Some of the readings were dense, but she was very understanding and approachable about them, and it was quite apparent how thoughtfully she put together the syllabus. I would die for her, honestly. Amazing prof.

Prof Saunders-Hastings is so smart and knowledgable. I learned sooo much from this class and it was super interesting. It's not the easiest class but if you put in a decent amount of effort there's no reason you shouldn't succeed.

Really nice professor and explains the content very well. Easy class if you pay attention and practice the stuff. Good intro to R course, hard to get less than an A unless you dont attempt the homeworks. Final project is not bad if you put in a little effort. Very easy grader and super understandable guy.

This professor had a relatively easy semester in which it was easy to learn R Studio, however the final project, worth 20% of your grade, isn't covered well in class and the final rubric doesn't list all the expectations, but if you really bomb it and have been doing well the rest of the semester, you're sure to land a B.
Bad class just cuz I hate coding. Super Amazing guy, wouldn't want it taught by anyone else. Very understanding and chill

Professor Minozzi has a philosophy around grading that is very beneficial to students. His belief is that students should show good faith effort and improvement in their learning and this should be rewarded with an A. The class had a lot more coding than you would expect from a Political Science class but it was nothing super difficult.

Minozzi in my opinion is one of the most underrated professors I have ever had. He was a great lecturer, beginning of course is kind of theory heavy, however, the class was interesting and he always explained things clearly and in a snarky funny way. Would definitely recommend taking his class. Not especially difficult either!!

Minozzi was definitely the best professor I have ever had. He's very quirky and helps you understand the material in a funny way. As long as he sees you're putting forth an effort, you will pass his class. There are a lot of readings so make sure you do them or you will definitely struggle.

The fans understand his stuff; they have the intellectual capacity to truly appreciate him, to realise that he says something deep about LIFE. As a consequence people who dislike William truly ARE idiots- of course they wouldnt appreciate, for instance, the humour in William existential catchphrase "it's a feature not a bug."

Really engaging, and in a class that's centered around the President, he makes a concious effort to stay as nonpartisan and unbiased as possible. He is extremely engaging, and present his leftures in a way that makes you think. My favorote class I've taken so far, and one of the most fair classes I've taken. 10/10 would reccomend this professor.
He's really involved and is always willing to help outside of class, he never gives you the answer but gives you the info and tools to figure it out for yourself. Really great guy!

I think this professor gets a bad rep. He is a very tough grader and I struggled on the first exam but was able to recover.  If you seek out the help, he's there for you when you do. AMAZING lecutres, corky and funny. Really engages the students. I lowkey love going to this class. Attendance notmandatory but I highly recommend going. no textbook

like most PA classes, he assigns research papers for each class. He does however have quizzes each class over readings. I personally don't recommend taking this class if you want to gain something w/your PS degree. 4 essay exams, tough grader. He does allow you to use a cheat sheet(1 page).  Go to class, otherwise you will not do well on the exams.
Nice enough guy, kinda smarmy. 70% of grade was 15 page minimum paper.

Prof Minozzi is an interesting teacher. I learn new things through our class discussions and research papers we read. Fair expectations and smart guy. We have four non-cumulative exams and one easy quiz every class just to make sure you read the research papers. He's friendly and approachable in his office hour. Has a nice room too. Commendable.
Prof. Minozzi was very knowledgeable and interesting to listen to. He wasn't at all flexible in dealing with (excused) absences though. Overall a good professor to take a class from.
Smart guy, but very unwilling to help in my opinion. If you attend class and do the readings, you should be alright. But don't expect very helpful responses if you email/ask him questions.

He is really intelligent and makes class interesting.  There was a data project about one of several topics relating to the presidency: mine was about the relationship between the state of the economy and the probability for an incumbent to be re-elected.  It is a really fun project, and you should get an A if you take it seriously.

Smart guy, Stanford degree. Knows his stuff, will do all he can to make sure you know it too. Kinda smug, but deservedly so: he's bright. Word of warning: there are daily assignments, and his TA is a bit of a wack job with a stingy rubric. If you do it, you get at least a C, but for those who'd rather get an A on every assignment, it's frustrating.

Not the easiest class, but he does a great job of communicating the subject matter clearly.  A clear sense of impartiality, which is necessary in discussions of presidential politics.  Maybe the best teacher I've had.

Prof. Minozzi was extremely insightful and helpful.  While the class can be contain lots of reading, he went beyond what most professors would in order to explain it.  His exam was fair.  And he's a heck of a nice guy.

This was a great class. Easy grade if you did the reading, came to class, and followed instructions. And if you do those things you actually learn a lot! What more could you ask for. Some say he picks on students, but its just sarcastic humor and he is actually pretty funny.

Minozzi is an OK guy and I think he cares about his students. However, he grades oddly and bases class grade on two things. Apparently he and a group of grad. students graded the midterm and as a result, grades were all over the place. Final included a lot of "gotcha" questions that had no relevance to the big picture. Doubt he gives out many As.

This isn't high school.  For a 500 level class Minozzi's expectations were reasonable.  Participation points are a giveaway.  It's a reward for reading.  When I needed help, I went to office hours.  He went to Stanford and knows his stuff.  If you are intellectually challenged- this isn't your class.
He is the worst professor I have ever had. He speaks down to anyone and does not clarify information at all. If you are considering taking a class with him DON'T.

This prof. should be fired for his ignorance.  He treats students like dirt.  His finaly grade was a ripoff.  He missed at least 3 classes due to illness and punished me severely for missing class also even though I had an excuse.  He is jerk.  And I hope he gets fired and never teaches again!

Clearly knows his stuff, but class is structured more on abstract theories than the role of presidency.  Highly recommend reading as he randomly calls on people for participation.  Exams were tough, but had a very generous curve at the end.  likes to play devil's advocate when questions are asked, but overall he means well.

Worst teacher I have had at OSU.  Proof, the highest grade on midterm was an 82.  He is sarcastic, talks down to people, and he is rude.  If you want to learn about the way the presidency works, this isn't the class.  All you'll learn about is how to draw things on a line.  He also told us who he supports in for Pres.  Not necessary.

Prof Davis was a really responsive instructor. I took this class online so he was really hands-off, but as long as you complete work on time and stay up to date on the Carmen page/announcements, you'll do well.

Professor Davis is a kind professor. Each week, you are assigned a chapter from the textbook, and he provides videos lectures to help you with discussion posts and quizzes. He does a group project instead of any exams. The project was interesting, but difficult for an online class. However, as long as you communicate with him, you will do well.

Took 2110, but it wasn't listed. Course was cake. For some reason, midterm and final means were low, so just make sure you read over the requirements for them. Only bad part abt the class was the group project, which was honestly a waste of time and there were almost no guidelines for. But almost everyone got 100, so it wasn't that bad.

One of my favorite classes and professors. The class was small and became pretty close over the course of the semester. Dr. Cranmer is a expert in his field and teaches the class well. He's always available and willing to help in any manner. The class was challenging but the projects were useful including intelligence estimates. Take the class.

The class was a lot of work, but it was also a great learning experience. Skyler used a mixture of discussion style lectures and academic games to keep the day to day interesting. Skyler is very knowledgeable and clearly cares about the topic.

Great professor. Skyler is highly respected in his field, and his intelligence shines through in class. Classes were split between reading discussions and war games. Papers and projects arent an easy A, but Skyler is always willing to give feedback and offer help before due dates.
Definitely a difficult class, but worth it. You learn a lot and the class is very collaborative. Skyler is very knowledgable. It's intimidating at first but you get used to it.
Good guy, he's very analytical and knowledgable. Don't have anything negative to say about his work at all although sometimes the lectures were a bit dry. 100% suggest taking his class.
This was a great class and a genuine, reasonable professor. I highly recommend.

class is not mandatory and all slides are posted. majority of grade however is 2 tests and a paper. Tests are very easy as he posts the exact questions that would be used on the test, he just chooses 7 from the 25-30 given. Overall easy if you take a look at the material and know it well enough

Great Professor. Good job introducing statistical concepts to a student demographic that doesn't generally have stats background. Lectures are easy to follow, and gives great examples that make things easy to understand. Very accessible and helpful outside of class.

Dr.Pierskalla was a phenomenal professor and person. He is willing to help students succeed in his class and in the future. He keeps the class engaged during the lecture which made class worth it. I also enjoyed our conversations during office hours.

Readings could be long, but were interesting. Reading quizzes were not overly difficult. Lectures were solid and slideshow heavy, still interesting though. Encouraged participation. Final paper was very long/tough but very fairly graded with good feedback. Midterm and Final were good. Only take the class if you truly care about the content.
I like him as a person this class was just so boring to me so i stopped going. i only went to the midterm review. slides are online and quizzes are open note. lots of readings. Hes a great guy though

Great teacher! Easy to contact either through office hours or emails, which he usually responds to extremely fast. Answers questions without making the students feel belittled or dumb, and he makes it very clear what he expects you to know for any exams.

Attendance is not mandatory and he lectures straight off his slides which he puts online. He gives you the test questions before the midterms so as long as you outline/study those you are good to go. There are weekly online reading quizzes and make sure you get 100% on those because they will carry your grade. Country memo at the end
Great prof. Gives test questions beforehand, and a country memo essay at the end. Attendance isn't taken either. Great guy too and is funny.

This was a pretty easy class overall. Dr. Pierskalla is a great guy who makes the exams so easy. Literally just memorizing answers to practice short answer problems, then he picks a few and makes them the test. The final paper is a bit trickier and denser, but if you go talk to him about it he's willing to work with you. I would really recommend
He was super awesome.  He truly wanted to help us learn and gave us access to all the lectures.  Study the powerpoints, learn some vocab, and apply it to the essays. Super easy, cut and dry.

I took the Politics of the Developing World with Dr Pierskalla and was not disappointed. He was committed to communicating the material well and I learned a lot. Lectures were sometimes dry, but if the course is interesting to you that's not going to be a big problem.  Exams were straightforward and a list of essays were provided as a study guide

Teacher gave very little homework and graded very generously to the point where the class I was taking with her (POLISCI 4242 - Incomplete Democracies) was almost too easy. Class difficulty aside, she is an obviously qualified and knowledgeable teacher with interesting lectures where she sufficiently encourages critical thinking.
Easy grader, attendance matters, but class is super interesting.

Dr. Schatz is an amazing professor. Unlike other professors, every lecture dived deep into an interesting topic and was so glad that she brought in guest speakers. Her grading guidelines were extremely clear and if I ever had a question or did not understand a subject clearly, she made sure to explain it and made sure that I was prepared.
Dr. Schatz is a great professor! She makes sure her class is not stressful and the midterm is a pass/no pass! Totally recommend!

Sara is an amazing professor! You can tell she really cares about her students and wants everyone to understand the material and succeed. She found ways to make the material interesting and engaging. Id highly recommend taking this class with her.

Very informative class and super enjoyable if you enjoy discussion. Majority of the course grade is based on the completion of a final essay and presentation, however you can base your research on a variety of topics and Professor Schatz will help guide your work. Lots of information provided in presentations and videos support the lectures. Great!

I really enjoyed this class and liked this professor. All the content was about things I had not really had the chance to learn about before. The professor uses a lot of online media. There is minimal homework and the exam is pass/fail.
Not a lot of homework, very interesting class! The prof uses lots of videos and online media

I had her during COVID so take it with a grain of salt. I thought that she was pretty unorganized and her lectures were quite chaotic. I learned a bit, but it was really easy to do close to nothing in this class and get an A. If that's what you're looking for and you don't mind sitting through some bland classes, this is it.

Sara is seriously the best proff here at OSU! Her exam is pass fail, one final paper, and a presentation that is basically written for you. The class is basically one the Latin American drug war, and the lectures are really interesting and Sara is keeps you engaged. Highly recommend, but attendance is a huge part of your grade

Silfa is obviously knowledgeable and genuinely cares about the subject she teaches, but the way she lectures doesn't do her any favors- they are all quite dry and don't add much if you already read the recommended textbook. Tests are easy if you study the vocab and understand the big concepts... there's also extra credit (+5) available on each one.

Easy class, extra credit is offered on every test and it is a lot of points. Lectures are really boring and she just reads off the slides, so you could be fine missing class often. Graded by 4 exams, so make sure to study. Commit the vocab to memory and know the big topics and you will ace the test guaranteed.

Easiest political science class I've ever taken and it was a 4000 level! I would highly recommend taking 4110 if she teaches it again, but also the lectures are incredibly boring, so strap in to leave class early.

Great professor who is knowledgeable and passionate about criminology. While the readings themselves can become burdensome, the lectures are great and help to summarize (but not replace) the readings and situate them in a larger context. He does a great job of fostering critical thinking and making traditionally dry material really engaging.

Huang is obviously qualified and knows how to explain Game Theory decently well; you can go to his lectures and avoid the textbook. Grades generously on homework but is tough but fair on the tests which ONLY cover material in lectures and have problems similar to those in the homework. Lectures at times get swamped by complex and unnecessary models

Professor Sylvan is dedicated to helping students learn, ask questions, and understand the material, but his grading style made this class very stressful which is why I didn't do very great. He's an extremely strict grader, deducting points if answers don't match his exact expectations. An interesting class but I wouldn't retake again.

Graded on 3 things, and he grades so hard for no reason. He makes the assignments so vague and broad, then complains when you don't understand or hit his exact points. He also says he's biased but literally never argues for the other side. DO NOT TAKE A CLASS WITH HIM!!!

Lectures are super boring and everyone is on their phone/laptops. We only get graded on 3 things and he is such a tough grader. He's wearing a mask and if you sit in the back, it's hard to hear anything. The subjects aren't boring, the way he teaches is. Never again...

Great professor. grades pretty tough, lots of reading (2 textbooks). Relies a lot on the lectures and books as supplementary. Lectures are really good and informative. loves when people ask questions and will make sure you understand it.

Professor Sylvan really cares about the success of the students. From the first day, he sets the expectation of equal effort being the key to success in his class. This is true-its necessary to put in early effort and keep up with workload. Having background knowledge about the region is VERY helpful - readings are dense and lectures move quickly.

Prof. Slyvan is awesome. Very knowledgable on the Middle East and his class format allows for students to take risks and provide their own opinions on tough topics. Lots of reading outside of class, as with most Poli Sci classes. 2 tests and a final paper make up the majority of your grade and he is a tough grader but definitely fair.

The entire class is graded on a midterm, a final, and a paper. He is the most particular grader Ive ever had, & if you do not make exactly the point he wants, you lose major points. His instructions and expectations are extremely unclear. He claims to answer questions if you email him, but he is almost unreachable. Would NOT recommend.

He has really good stories and you learn a lot, but he is so unclear on what is required to answer his questions. Almost all the points in the class come from the paper and 2 tests, which would be fine if it was easier to understand what he even means by his questions, and if you dont hit the specific answer he wants you lose a lot of points.

Professor Sylvan was a solid teacher. My grade suffered due to poor effort early in the course, and my grade reflected it. The lectures were not the most gripping, but they were still informative. Textbook reading was absolutely essential.

This man is the light of my life. Super caring, super available, really wants you to succeed. He's old school though, he puts a lot of effort into teaching his classes and he expects a lot of effort back. 1000% worth it, he's extremely brilliant and knowledgable, very organized and easy to understand.
Teaches the material, but hard assessments. Lots of reading (most of it is not necessary).
He lectures really slowly but is very knowledgeable and clearly cares about the subject matter. Make sure you analyze in ur term paper rather than merely describe what you are discussing.

I took both of his courses and loved them. He understands the material and presents it EXTREMELY well. His lectures are engaging. Constantly asks students questions. That said, he's a REALLY tough grader (though his TA does most of it). Expect to read 1000+ pages, notes are NOT online, and you're going to work your ass off. But you'll learn SO much

Very fascinating guy with a lot of interesting stories to tell and teaches the material with passion. Tests are 50% reading and 50% lecture and the readings are not discussed in class, so do the readings (and there's a lot)! Very tough grader, so you have to know what you're talking about to get a decent grade.

Politics of the Middle East is a tough topic. Things are always changing and history is currently being written. It's a lot of information from the past and present so get ready to read. Sylvan's TA is a tough grader and instructions are very vague, so make sure you know what you're doing on the exams and paper. Down to earth guy.
Very tough grader. Not clear on paper. He doesn't incorporate the readings with class lectures. AVOID IF YOU CAN!!!!
Guy is such a hard grader, good luck getting a B in this class.
Worst Professor at Ohio State! He is not helpful! Avoid if you can!
His class is super interesting, he gets the student involved and interested in learning the material. The class will be difficult but rewarding.

This course is very subjective and really hard. He doesn't offer a lot of office hour times and says he flexible, but really not. He's not clear on his paper assignment and doesn't curve anything even when half of the class has failed. I don't recommend this instructor by any means!

Middle East Politics. Overall, one of the most challenging courses I've taken at OSU. Dr. Sylvan is very friendly and knowledgeable. Textbook use is essential as lectures do not cover material found within books. Exams cover material from class and textbooks on an equal basis. Utilize office hours and ask questions. Not easy, but valuable.

Middle East politics. Midterm (30%) ten page paper (35%) final (35%) (noncumulative). Assigns 80-100 pages of historical reading a week. Lectures and readings rarely overlap (lectures cover analytical constructs helpful for interpreting readings). Exams are roughly 50% lecture 50% reading. No study guides. Must read carefully. Hard class. Worth it
Dr. Steffensmeier is a very good woman. She sets the course very reasonably. The quizzes and midterms are very simple. I recommend to choose her!
Not great. Wont take again.

The online course is super, super easy, but very dull in part to the Powerpoint-filled lectures and the horrible, horrible book.  Don't take this course if you actually have an interest in the subject material.  Super easy A, though.

The online course is terrible. Have fun reading out of the book, watching hour long lectures online, wanting to jump out your window, reading from a mandatory second website and taking 2, in-depth and very specific, quizzes a week. High School required less busy work.
Teacher greatly interested in teaching, very accessible, interesting material.

Took online course. Two seperate quizzes every week one you have to read the chapter (about 50 pgs) to do good on them the other is readings and questions which are a lil time consuming. But also offers easy extra credit. I never had to do any papers. Also tests are pretty easy & are even in order. Just make sure you do your quizzes on time & read.

Completely stupid class, way harder than it should have been.  Had to write 14 papers, 4 of which were 5 pages.  The class before the exam she tells us the test was 90% from the book, so going to class is useless. Exam was VERY specific, i.e What percent of (specific ethnicity) voted in the last election? Midterm and final were both 108 questtions.
Dr. Box-Steffensmeier is a very good woman. She sets the course very reasonably. The quizzes and midterms are very simple. I recommend to choose her!

Took her class online and had zero interaction with her, only her teaching assistant. The course was set up well, extremely user friendly, and on the same schedule every week. If you listen to the lectures and do the homework, you will be fine. Make sure to buy the online textbook, homework questions are worth a good chunk of the grade.

This professor relied heavily on class engagement, which was helpful. However, his expectations for the midterm and final exam was unrealistic. The study guide questions required so much writing, expecting students to memorize the answers to all of them under his grading requirements made it hard to expect an A.

Prof. McKean is incredibly knowledgeable and teaches complex content in such an understanding and perceptive matter. You will know exactly what is on the exams, the reading quizzes are straight-forward, and participation is in Canvas, so no need to talk. He is just one of those professors who you know cares about what they teach!

Such a great guy. Super knowledgeable about any topic he teaches. You can just ask him about whatever regarding the lecture and gives a clear answer immediately. Exams also had no surprises: the essay questions were literally on the study guide! As long you do the readings and understand the content, you will do just fine in the class. Take it !

Amazing guy, truly cares about what he teaches and communicates what he expects from you. Incredibly understanding about mental health and made lectures engaging and interesting. 10/10 would take again.

Great teacher with lots of knowledge in his field. He tries to engage the class in small discussions and explains things very well and in depth. There is alot of study that needs to be done for the midterm and final but everything is in his sides and its very doable if you are paying attention to the lectures and taking some notes.

Mckean is excellent, he really cares about his students, and is funny in class. I wasn't the biggest fan of the class, but that is not fault of his -- he is very accommodating and his grading rubrics are pretty clear for both papers and exams. Lots of reading, but he does a great job clarifying confusing readings. A fairly easy A given the work.

Ben is an absolutely amazing professor. He cares about his students SO much and is incredibly understanding of mental health. This class has a lot of readings, but you can get away with skimming them as long as you pay attention to his lectures.

This guy is great just like what other comments said. The problem is that this class was assigned with some really bad TAs who don't give a damn. They are some extremely tough graders and they don't care for giving you good feedback. They don't even grade things until those assignments they are 3 weeks old. Absolute jerks.

Great class! A lot of reading, but it's worth it if you are interested in political theory. Assignment feedback was very helpful, especially on papers. He made a graduate level class accessible to all of the students who took it (including undergrads and Program 60 students). Very understanding about his students' pandemic-related struggles, too.

I love him *so* much! Ben is so nice and funny and helpful. I had a blast in his class and he is so smart. Yeah, you might not get As on all the papers, but there are more than enough points to make up for it. Lots of extra credit too, makes up for the pop quizzes (drops the worst ones). Honestly such a cool dude. Love him, wish it was my major.

Though he presents information in odd orders, Benjamin McKean was an amazing professor to have for Intro to Peace Studies. He is very thorough in his lectures, and he actually inquires students on their thoughts on theories, and he makes an effort to understand their opinions. He gives you the final questions before the exam as well.

McKean is really great, he knows a crazy amount about what he teaches. Also just generally, the class let's you see a lot of things in a new light, things you might be tuned out to (green movement, sweatshop workers). Also, if you don't do the reading or didn't understand it, he makes it very clear in class what the major takeaways are.
