Ben is a tough grader, but he is very inspiring and compelling. Of the classes I've had thus far, he is definitely the best professor that I have had. There is a ton of reading for the class, but usually the information was decently interesting. You will learn a lot if you just put forth the effort.

This was probably the best college course I've ever taken; very interesting, lots of new ideas, great teacher. The reading is tough, but he's forgiving on grading IMO. If you do the reading and make an honest effort on the essays you will get a good grade.

One of the best professors I've had. Extremely passionate, extremely helpful. Very globally aware and fun to talk to in general. If you're interested in PS, you will love his class. That being said, he grades somewhat difficult but you will learn a LOT. Put in the work and you will be fine. Don't skip class, participate, and READ THE TEXTS.

Hes an interesting person who is passionate about what he teaches and he cares about his students. He teaches lectures off the dome so don't miss class, it's mandatory and he doesn't have anything online to refer to if you miss class. Study for like 2 hours for tests w/ quizlet and you'll be fine. Breath of fresh air in terms of professors for sure

This is a different kind of professor who cares a lot about his students. He wants his students to do well and it shows every class that he shows up. Not the typical professor, that's for sure. This is my second time taking a course from him and it is well worth it. He is always connecting the lectures to real life.
I really enjoyed taking Dr. Jeffries class, he really takes pride in teaching his students.

I don't know what this November 30th person is talking about! They said they had only two assignments, a quiz and a final. In the three classes I took with professor Jeffries there were 3 to 4 quizzes in each, a book review and a final in each class. I have never known Professor Jeffries to be anything but supportive and helpful to students.

There were two assignments TOTAL. One quiz one final. No notes to refer to, and not a good lecturer. Gets so sidetracked during class you do not learn what you need to know about the quizzes. If you ask for help he asks why you are not working harder and is fond of public humiliation during lectures. Listen to the reviews, do not take this prof.

People can say what they want about Dr. Judson Jeffries, but I learned so much from him. Plus he gives students opportunities that we don't get from any other professor. I am a published author because of Dr. Jeffries. Now how many undergraduates on campus can say that? If they can say that, chances are it is because of Dr. J

Dr. Jeffries is a different kind of professor, different kind of guy, period. I've learned a great deal from him. I have taken two classes from him. The theme prevailing theme in both classes that I took from him was "learn to think for yourself," not accept everything in life on face-value.

Dr Jeffries is brilliant. He is so passionate about teaching in a way that can be applied to the real world, and hes all about empowering students. Hes tough, for sure- and old school. No PowerPoints or online submissions. This allows for a lot of fluidity and also requires a lot of quality participation. But honestly, I highly recommend him.

I have never had a professor of this caliber. This professor is the epitome of a guy with street-smarts and book smarts. He does a very good job of relating the material to the real-world. He not only breaks down the material in a way that anyone can understand, but he teaches you about life. I have never had that in a professor before.

Great professor but his class is structured a little weird. Never super clear about what he wants so a friend in the class will help a lot. He seems intimidating but he definitely wants everyone to succeed so don't be shy about questions.

Dr. Jeffries is an amazing professor who is full of knowledge and encourages you to think for yourself. The set of the class is much different than the typical class, but it pays off well if you show up and pay attention. The grading is weird but you put a lot of effort in, he'll award an A with no problem.
Hes an excellent professor ! Challenging but I learned so much .

If you are looking for a class to improve your GPA, this class isnt an option. The professor doesnt use carmen so you dont know how you are perfuming in the class. The are two textbooks you must read and couple of videos. Be ready to write using pen. This is a class where professor expects undergraduate students to perform like Ph.D students.

Did not show up on the first day, On the second he came to class with nothing and lectured how it is our responsibility for what we want to learn apparently because he does not understand he is suppose to come to class to teach not just talk about whatever he wants without any guidelines. Never gave us the syllabus and emailed it after the 3rd week

The class was a little overwhelming at first but as the course progresses things get easier. There is a lot of class discussions so if that is not your thing then take another class. He wants everyone to think for themselves and makes sure that we are getting what we need from him. Great class!

Absolutely amazing! DEAR OSU: Please allow Dr. Jeffries to teach classes in my major. I could fill the 350 limit word with fancy, verbose adjectives and praise for Dr. Jeffries, but you should just save me the time and take his class!!!
Easy class if you complete the work. He cancelled multiple classes and took over a month to grade my midterm exam, but I really can't hold it against him he's genuine and honest.

Erik is awesome!! Loved him and his class, made political theory not so boring. Gives you question bank of what might be on midterm/final which is extremely helpful. Quizzes are easy. Take him to fulfill your theory credit!!

Professor Wisniewski is a great professor who is very passionate about the topic he teaches. Although political theory can be very difficult to understand, he always makes sure that we understand what we learn in class!

Professor Wisniewski is incredibly passionate and knowledgeable about what he teaches. He does a great job of facilitating class discussion and answering questions. Readings are long, but manageable. Quizzes are easy as long as you read. Overall, a great class.
Great! He gives quizzes that are totally reasonable and genuinely cares about what he's teaching.

Professor Wisniewski was an awesome instructor. He is very passionate about the subject matter at hand. He is kind, always willing to help and answer questions, and so funny. Profession Wisniewski also offers very generous extra credit, and has a curve for each exam. Though, the readings can be quite lengthy they are still manageable.

Jared is an AMAZING professor. His class is structured very well and when you get the hang of the routine, the class is easy. In class we have a group activity worth 10 points but you can make it up if you miss class. There are readings we do for every class. This is what quizzes/exams are over. Jared is an absolute gem and will help you succeed.

Jared slayed his first semester teaching this Human Rights course. It's comprised of weekly participation assignments, midterm, final, and a human rights research paper. Attendance wasn't mandatory, but the graded participation is helpful to understand test material. That being said, it's important to do the readings, or you will be lost.

He is genuinely so condescending and I feel so uncomfortable participating in his class. He wants people to participate but when they do he talks down to them. His tests are extremely hard and his quizzes are on the dumbest little details that we talked about for ten seconds. Do NOT take this class.(I have a 3.9 gpa and will prob get a 2.5 in here)

Took PLS 334 with him and MSU and he was the worst lecturer and the exams were ridiculously hard, and not curved. Class average on midterm was a 70% and he told everyone that he graded very harshly. I went to every class and did all the reading and the midterms were still insanely hard
Easy A if u go to class. Took his class at Michigan State. PLS 394

Literally the most annoying voice i have ever heard. Reads the papers but doesnt really understand them, tells you, you did put things into the paper when they are obviously there. 10/10 would not recommend

I actually took ISS328 online through Michigan State.  Professor Smidt was very helpful BUT his TA took forever to get grades back to you. I learned a lot from this class but I think I could've learned more and done better had I had feedback on my responses and mini-projects earlier than 2 weeks later. Great class!

this guy is boring and does not explain things very good at all. Also, his class is a note taking marathon. If you like to have 50 pages of notes to study for a test Corky is your guy. I don't know what they person is talking about saying he was an easy A? Maybe if you were related to him it was but if not. Take Stat 135 with Sprangers. Avoid Corky

This class was the easiest A but you have to do the work. As long as you have the notebook, do all of your homework, you will definitely be fine. The final was a piece of cake, all it was was memorization of key words and doing problems on the computer.  And he also explains everything and gives detailed examples. Really helpful teacher.
avoid him and his class at all costs!
This guy was not very nice and had enormous power point presentations with many, many, slides. His hw's were very hard and his midterm and final were brutal. Take stat 135 or Ivanchenkos.
*****NOTICE****RMP HAS PLACED THIS TEACHER ON RESTRICTION, SO YOU MUST BE LOGGED IN TO RATE THIS IS DUE TO POSSIBLE ABUSE OF THESE PAGES. Signed RMP Trusted Administrator

Very friendly, funny, and helpful. Unless you're interested in political analysis, you will be bored but that cannot be helped. BTW, you DON'T have to take tons of notes, and he definately does not suck!
This guy thought he was the smartest guy ever, way too full of himself. Just be glad he left OSU so no one has to put up with him again. Also, the faculty hated him too.

I thought he was a great professor; not too much reading, clear and organized lectures, extremely knowledgeable and passionate about the subject, helpful outside of class. Tough grader but if you know your stuff, he will definitely notice and reward you. He's quirky - I might agree with the "aging hipster" comment below - but he pulls it off well.

IDK...An aging hipster? smart and witty. He's helpful outside of the classroom as well. I talked to him about grads school a couple of times.But the class wast very engaging to me since I knew nothing about food politics...

He's a hard grader. Class was interesting but he is full of himself and not helpful outside of class. Not willing to write recs for people who got a's in previous classes. Not easy to talk to. Not interested in getting to know students. Lots of reading and an extensive research paper.

He definitely knows his stuff. I don't understand the resentment towards him. If you go and ask him for help and if you are attentive in class then you will do well. He is not there to give you a good grade, he expects you to learn from him. He is very passionate about his field and it comes out in his lectures.

He knows his stuff, but isn't very helpful inside or outside of class.  His syllabus is very sarcastic and so is he.  The readings were pretty good, but he doesn't provide any insight whatsoever as to what he's looking for in the written assignments.

Worst teacher ever! so full of himself. Expects your papers to be so good they will solve every peace crisis ever. Unrealistic expectations from students. Not clear on most everything.  Thinks he's god incarnate.
Nice guy, you'll learn a lot... but don't expect an A.  You might think you are doing well, but he's taking notes.  And if you don't speak up / do readings, you are toast by the end of the quarter.
WORST TEACHER EVER. HATE HIM. HE DOESNT EXLAIN ANYTHING. GRADES SO HARD. PAPERS ARE RIDICULOUS

Not sure why there are so many negative reviews. Hopf is very knowledgeable on the subject. His lectures sometimes are scattered but his personality makes them interesting--he's pretty fun. The mid-term and final are take home, but still extensive and difficult. Do the readings and come to class and you'll learn a lot/do well!
Does not make it clear what is expected in writing assignments. Generally not helpful. Reading assignments are long, hard to understand, and sometimes his own essays. Seems really full of himself.

Also surprised by negative reviews. He is very erudite and articulate, and also witty/funny enough to keep things interesting. An A is very doable if you take good notes and at least read the readings relevant to your midterm/final. Skipping class is not a good idea as some exam questions will be nearly impossible without detailed notes.

I'm very surprised by all of the negative ratings. Professor Hopf gave clear, interesting lectures, injected them with a bit of humor, and responded politely to a number of inane questions from the hoi polloi. He's a great prof and seems like a fun guy with whom to have a beer. Apropos of grades: take good notes and write, dry, dense essays.
tough class, but you'll know your stuff when your done. I thought it was well worth the effort.

Professor Hopf is challenging yet motivating. Anyone who says to avoid his class doesn't want to do the work. The readings are dense and tedious but you walk away from the class with usable knowledge about the world. Apply the readings as much as possible to the essays and you'll get an A. start early, make an outline and re-read your answers.
This guy grades way too hard. He expects you to be as advanced as he is, and can't come down to a normal college student's level. The readings are wayyyy too long. Avoid Hopf if you value your GPA.

Avoid if at all humanly possible- very very full of himself, and if you disagree with him, WATCH OUT- he's very nasty and sarcastic and his comments on papers are completely unhelpful.  An awful teacher.

Great class, Hopf is the man when it comes to Soviet past-present politics.  First couple of classes are the best.  The only****ty part was the last 2 weeks of class when groups have to present presentations.  There is no reason to even attend class and it is a complete waste of time and hopefully he will cut it out.  Be careful he doesn't turn you into a full-fledged Commie though, he loves the USSR/Russia!

Fantastic professor, extremely witty and knowledgeable. Class was mostly student presentations, but he communicated the main points of the readings. Very personable, quite fun to talk to. Was great about communicating expectations re: papers, etc. I'm not sure why his reviews are so negative, as I found him quite easy and straightforward.

Arrogant jerk.  Totally unhelpful, but he sure manages to flirt with the attractive girls in class.  You're better off if you avoid his classes.  If you are a Communist you may enjoy his class, but if you differ from his thoughts in any way, you will be harshly penalized.

This guy will 'teach' history as it didn't happen...And DO NOT challenge him on his incorrect assumptions or you will be punished.  He is smart, knows it and thinks we're all stupid.  DO NOT take this class if you can help it!  Lectures are boring, seem unstructured and going to office hours for clarification is a complete waste of time with him.

Boring class, hard to stay awake because his lectures droned on.  also, he was obsessed with running his hand through his hair every moment.  Plus, he tried to grade harder since it was an honors class.  positives include his somewhat interesting tangents
a bit of a jerk
Cool ass dude. Knows ALOT. Inspires good discussion in class.
While very smart, also very difficult to deal with and often unclear what he wants.  He does put together good syllabi and has good, interesting readings that you actually want to do.
A bit strange, and he seems a bit aloof.  But the guy knows everything about Soviet-post Soviet politics, and yes...he is much smarter than you so get over it.
No Comments
a little strange
No Comments
No Comments

Ripley's class is kind of a unique animal. He's unbelievably intelligent and a wealth of knowledge (although he does go on a lot of long-winded tangents), and it can be tempting to skip class, but he knows who shows up consistently and who doesn't. If you go to class almost always and act at least somewhat engaged, you'll be successful.
Very boring lectures, doesn't use visual aid, grade comes down to midterm, final, research paper

Lectures not mandatory. If you read the books you don't need to go. Such a nice and brilliant man. Long paper assigned, and is expected to be heavy in statistical data. Even if you go to lecture, buy the book. It's very hard to take notes and stay focused. Great man
Ripley is an expert on Congress and highly recommended. Personable, entertaining class, and genuinely cares about his students
Dr. Ripley's course can be challenging, but he is highly supportive of students. Well worth the effort you need to put in. He is an expert on Congress.
Dr. Ripley's course is very challenging, but worthwhile. He is an expert on Congress and is definitely worth the time.
Doctor Ripley is an expert on Legislative Politics. The class is rigorous, but you will learn a great deal. Ripley is an excellent professor and is highly recommended.

Mr. Ripley is a really nice guy.  His style is very dry though.  I wish he would use more powerpoint or other visuals.  He lectures almost the every class of the quarter.  Not very exciting.  Had to write a long paper and had two exams in the class.
grades very hard, couldn't really help with the essay
Very friendly and very intelligent, but appallingly dry lectures. He reads straight from a prepared script in a monotone voice.
Very intelligent instructor who explains things thoroughly. Only three grades in the glass. Make sure you read the books!

Lectures were a NIGHTMARE.  I could not make it through one lecture without leaving.  I literally was falling asleep by the break.  He is a very nice guy and he knows his stuff, but he is impossible to deal with in a group/lecture setting.  The exams were not hard.  PS majors should know alot of the info already.  paper was uncalled for!  17 pages!

Randall Ripley did a very good job teaching the course. He is very smart and this showed in his lectures. Dr. Ripley is very passionate about legislative politics. The class is easy, though there are quite a few books (a fair amount for a 500 level class). Responds to emails very fast and is a nice person.

Very difficult professor.  Grades without a curve.  Unclear about what is expected, very picky about what you write.  Gives out Cs even without explanation about what is wrong with assignment/exam.  Avoid!!

Though Prof. Ripley is an amazingly nice man, I'm not sure if I could stand to sit there for 10 weeks again. The tests and essay were easy, but lectures were not at all helpful to the class. Refers you to sections of the book and spends nearly an hour talking about what poli sci majors should already know-- the political news. nice guy but do avoid

The most boring political science class I have ever taken! He basically speed reads from the book, and takes the entire time each session. Will never answer a question straight forward. Gives you a study sheet for the midterm but expects you to remember every little detail. Avoid!!!!!!!
neutral
Really good teacher and he interacts with class to make the lecture a little less boring.  You need to read because he gives pop quizzes and his tests are relatively easy

This professor is very knowledgeable on the subject matter that he teaches; he's witty and engages the class, for the most part. He is a little boring at times but his quirkiness makes up for that. He's fair in the tests and although attendance is not mandatory, he has pop quizzes on the reading throughout the course.

10 quizzes. Drops 2 and allows you to miss 2 on each and still get 100%. Midterm worth 20% of your final grade and final worth 25% of final grade. 4 homework assignments worth 35% of final grade. 3 EC opportunities. Agnar's class was very structured and easy to navigate. He was open to student concerns and always willing to re-explain the material.

The class is HARD. If you don't know basic stats and basic programming, you're going to struggle. The prof is super helpful and replied to my emails in less than 24hrs. I would definitely advise everyone to AVOID this class especially online.
Great lectures. Slides are not online, but you'd want to come to class anyway to be at the lecture. Very helpful with answering students' questions and really encourages participation.

I took GP 1300 with him and just loved it! We had 3 tests, 3 short in class writings (about a paragraph in length with super easy topics), and a group project that lasted the second half of the semester. Jason is super nice but does not post notes online so make sure you go to class! He also assigns a lot of readings that will be on the test.
Great teacher, clear lectures, easy grader. Really nice guy who is passionate about what he teaches.
Best professor I've had at OSU! So understand and the class is challenging but if you show up you'll be fine! He is amazing wish I could take all his classes!

His class was interesting and easily my favorite out of all my Poli Sci classes. I would definitely recommend taking this class. The reading quizzes were pretty easy, if you just skimmed the readings you would get them correct. His lectures were great and keeps you up to date on current events.
Literally the man. Taking 4318 next semester solely because he's teaching it.

Took Keiber for 4318 and 2300. He's intelligent, passionate about teaching, and genuine. In 2300, we had three exams and two 750 word papers. The exams were each 25% of the final grade. The first paper was 10% and the second was 15%. Going into my second semester as a Junior and Keiber is still the only professor who made me want to wake up at 8 am

Really fun class, he makes the topic interesting. Exams have some pin-point questions so review all notes thoroughly. Always willing to answer questions and clarify things in class or out of class. Hilarious, too.

His lectures are great and very clear, getting to the main points of the readings. He won't give you every detail you need for the exam but will give you hints as to what you need to get from each reading. The exams have questions about class discussions and slides, so go to class. The quizzes are announced but pretty tricky ready carefully.

One of the best instructors I've had at Ohio State. Excellent knowledge, enthusiasm, and willingness to discuss the topic. His course was the only time I woke up first thing in the morning excited to go to class instead of sleeping in. Even without mandatory attendance, I hardly missed a class.

One of the best professors I have had. He made every class incredibly engaging and he is also really interested in helping his students. He's incredibly genuine, interesting, and a cool person in general. I took his class on terrorism, but I'm sure any class he teaches is great. I would recommend this class to any OSU student.
extremely helpful professor. One of the better teachers at OSU. Work hard and your grade will reflect your effort. Not an easy A but class is extremely interesting.

Extremely easy class if you do the readings. If you don't, you will struggle. 90% of the exams are directly from the quizzes. Don't slack off on the quizzes because they're worth the most in his class.
Probs the best. Probs.

Great guy. Unfortunately, he starts class off by referring to NY Times,Al Jazeera, and CNN for daily news. Some of the assigned readings are from Left wingers. 20-30pgs of reading per class. attendance is not mandatory. 95% of quizzes and exams are from readings,5% from his lectures. Easy A if you attend, but Easy B if you don't attend class.

Really an informed and engaging teacher who's interested in what he teaches and wants students to learn. The class is readings-heavy, but the discussions that build off them in class make you think a lot about them - it doesn't seem pointless at all. Attendance isn't required, but the class is so worth going to. Amazing. Take his classes!

I have never had such an awesome teacher before that has been so helpful.  He is the kind of guy who will meet you the night before an exam or paper is due and will help you with any questions you have.  He makes the class worthwhile to attend, never gives homework, and really really makes it clear that he is in it for you to succeed.
No textbooks, just articles. Pretty funny and just an awesome class to take.

Best professor I've had at OSU by far. He doesn't give you too much work but keeps class really interesting. No textbook, just different articles to read each class. Couple "quickwrites" that aren't overly demanding, but worthwhile. TAKE THIS CLASS if you are a political science major because it's really unique. Jason is awesome.

Class covers an interesting subject and Jason simply makes the class better. Lectures are interesting and the grading is fair. You will get an A on the exams if you do the readings. Definitely worth taking.

Jason is the best instructor I've had in my time at OSU. The course material was incredibly interesting, the classroom discussion was engaging, and Jason is the perfect mix of informative and hilarious. Furthermore, although the workload was not demanding I know I have taken away more from this class than  any other Political Science class at OSU.

Jason is an awesome guy and a fantastic teacher, probably my best at OSU so far. This class exceeded every expectation, partly because terrorism is an interesting topic but also because Jason is a rather brilliant and exceptional teacher. We had a moderate amount of easy reading, some minor assignments, and take home exams so it was pretty easy too
Jason is awesome! take his class and you won't regret it.  It was very, very easy.  Just go to class and participate.  Midterm and Final were take home.
obsessed with this class and him. He is awesome and probably one of the most intelligent professors at OSU. everyone should take this class and broaden their minds a little bit.
Jason is by far the best professor Ive had at OSU. You can tell he loves teaching and Ive never learned so much from a class in college or in high school. You need to take a class with him.

Amazing! Excellent class. Had him for 210 (political theory) and he changed my life then! Jason steered me towards my academic passion. Wrote me a rec. Offered anything and everything one could want out of an instructor. The only negative? The last day of class when you have to part ways. You naturally grow attached to Jason in his classes. Cheers!

Simply the best.  Jason is the best teacher I have ever had at OSU. To put this class in summation, you simply read 40-50 pages of academic articles a week and discuss them in class. As with any class Jason teaches, you will learn to think for yourself and challenge the authors' beliefs. Every undergrad should be required to take a class with Jason

Guy is a great teacher. Very helpful. Who doesn't find terrorism interesting? He's a very personable professor, doesn't just lecture, he engages, gets you to think. Keeps up with current events in the world which makes it even more interesting. Great Fun Class, Just a lot of reading

Take a class with Jason! When our exam was moved unexpectedly from Tues to Mon, Jason hosted special office hours in the library on Sunday because he wanted us to be able to see him before the exam if we needed... on a Sunday! How many teachers do that? Not only is he great at teaching, but he cares so much and wants you to succeed in his classes!

Took my final today, handed it in to Jason, said goodbye, and left the class. When I left I was hit with an instant feeling of sadness. Not necessarily that I'll never see Jason again, I'm a PS major so I could very well have in again, but the sadness was over the fact that after my 1st class taken with him, all my other teachers won't be like him.

On the first day of class Jason mentioned how before coming back to OSU, he did work in D.C. I sincerely hope he never returns back to that world, he isn't cut out for it. I don't mean that he isn't smart enough or skilled enough for it, but that he is so cut out for teaching, that I can't envision him in another profession. He is that incredible.

Jason has every characteristic of an excellent teacher. He is compassionate, extremely knowledgeable of the subject matter, and will do anything to help a student out. I would HIGHLY recommend taking any of his classes because I can guarantee no matter what your major is, his classes will keep your interest. Awesome guy, awesome course.

Jason is the man. He is extremely intelligent as well as passionate about what he teaches. I would definitely recommend any of his classes even if you are not a Poly Sci major. He also knows how to get a laugh everyone so often which helps break up the uninteresting topics.

This class has been absolutely amazing! Keiber gives fantastic lectures and had extremely flexible office hours to help out his students. He's funny, intelligent, and passionate about the material - one of my favorite profs at OSU so far. I am definitely planning on taking another class by him at some point even though I'm a business major.

Material could be pretty confusing. But he does a great job of explaining it. He really cares about the students and really goes out of his way to help. Have class discussions every day which really helps to better understand everything.

Very committed to helping students understand the material, which is nice since the material can be oddly worded and difficult at times. Makes himself available more than most profs. Really wants students to engage themselves in classroom discussion and is never condescending to students. PS: The facial hair was manly. I lost respect when cut it :)

Excellent prof! Keiber is more than willing to help you and explain the material...gives study guides prior to exams and reading guides for each assignment. He really wants you to learn, but is straight forward with exactly what he wants you to focus on. Extremely rewarding class, I would recommend it to anyone!!
He moves fast and expects you to have learned his readings the night before. Even if its hard, he won't spend too much time on it unless no one is getting it.

Legit Dude...Fantastic Teacher who truly LOVES what he teaches. His class has the ability to alter your view on life. Rarely can that be said about a CLASS...One negative: He has a terrible beard. Needs a razor!!!

Politics of Film and Television is pretty straightforward. For lectures there are small quizzes, and then you sit back and watch a movie. Be prepared going into lecture by reading the material. Overall a good class and the instructor facilitated learning well.

Paul is the best professor I had this semester. Everything he wanted was extremely clear in the syllabus. There were never any questions. Also, he offered up to 20 points extra credit just for tweeting about something relevant to foreign policy. He's very approachable and interested in what he teaches. I would take any class I could with him.
Wonderful professor. Really interested in the material he is teaching, approachable and a very fair grader on exams. I would absolutely take any class taught by him.
very passionate and approachable

He is crystal clear. It seems at first like you use the text book a lot. However, he gives u a checklist of what to take notes on at the beginning of each week- listen and take good notes on his online lectures first. then, whatever is left on the list of what you need to know, look for in the text. you don't need to read it thoroughly . He's great
He posted interesting lectures and tried to make the boring subjects better. The quizzes, participation and exams were also pretty easy.
Easy class. Professor Debell is very clear and well-organized. Bonus on quizzes; very hard to not get an A.

Wonderful instructor. Even though it was an online course, he was very helpful and useful. His lectures are very clear and he is well spoken. Quizzes and exams are very fair. Required an average amount of reading and work. If you just follow his weekly overviews, you will have no problem getting an A in his class.
Show up, pay attention, the lectures are in depth but you will learn so much from him.  When working on the paper, go to him he will you the feedback you need to pass.  He is a great teacher.

Asher is really one of the best at OSU.  His tests are tough but fair, the paper is easy if you follow his instructions and go to him for help, and the reading isn't really necessary.  The guy is absolutely brilliant and knows an unbelievable amount about OH politics, you will learn a ton!

Having your Ohio Politics class taught by Presdident Gee's Senior Political Advisor is pretty darn awesome! Definitely attend lectures, as Asher has plenty of insightful stories and experience on the subject matter. A TON of reading, but most was relevant and helpful on exams. Attendance, studying and reading are all necessary for an A!

Prof Asher is a very good lecturer. The class is a typical poli sci class, with two midterms that are essay based. Recitation is used to explore interesting topics. Also, there is a requirement to volunteer for a campaign 6-10 hours a week, with a paper due at the end of the quarter. Would definitely recommend prof Asher.

Excellent.  His lectures are very interesting, and he is really laid-back.  You have to work for six hours per week with a campaign of your choice and write an essay about it.  Do not buy the textbooks; you will never even look at them.
I thought Dr. Asher's Ohio Politics class was outstanding.  He's the best professor I've had at the university thusfar.  And no, it's not impossible to get an A in his class.

Great Prof!! Very entertaining, and very personable. He's biased, and doesn't try to hide it, but will like you no matter your opinions as long as you share your opinions. We barely used the textbooks, and the exams weren't bad if you paid attention in class. I learned a lot in this class!

Independents and third-party supporters beware: this guy often confuses facts with opinions, whether or not his students realize it. He is quite biased against certain candidates and parties, yet some of the things he says contradict with his own biased statements-- apparently not enough to get him to change his mind.. What a letdown.

LOVED his class. Learned so much! He made it interesting by actually "talking" to the class and not lecturing in a monotone class.  He has a sense of humor about things,but if ur not a "favorite" don't expect to be called on. My favorite PS class ever.
Dr. Asher is a wonderful professor. No political science degree is complete without taking his classes. Lectures were interesting, and I learned a great deal from him.
Great lectures, you will learn a good deal about Ohio Politics.
Good prof... easy class didn't buy the books and go an A.  Just show up and you'll be fine.

Great class.  If you are actually a PoliSci major this is a great class and you will learn a lot.  This is a high level class so no, he is not going to hold your hand and give you outlines and essay questions but it is stupid to presume that an instructor should do so.  It's called college, not high school. Overall, a good class with lots of info.

Really, great guy, great class.  Those claiming he is biased are absolutely ridiculous, you can be conservative as you want and the guy is respectful.  Easy, fun, and informative.  Take him if you can.

Herb Asher is the best professor at OSU!  His lectures are interesting, informative, and full of relevant anecdotes.  He loves what he teaches and he cares for his students.  If you get to know him, he will make a great mentor and will take the time to meet with you and offer advice to you.  I always looked forward to going to his classes!

decent professor and a funny guy, although you don't really learn a lot in his class. exams are not fun at all, since he doesn't provide an outline of terms or anything to that extent in the way of preperation. overall it's not that difficult of a class, just be prepared to spend time working outside of class doing volunteering, surveys, etc.
Do not even bother unless you are a democrat. Very Very liberal. Biggest name dropper in the world. Who the hell cares who Vern Riffe is, I sure don't. HAVE FUN!!!!

Excellent professor!  If you want to learn about Ohio and her politics, there is no better professor to have than Herb Asher; its definitely a class that you don't want to miss!  His lectures are always informative, relevant and never boring.  On a separate note, I read one of his books for another class (Polling and the Public:  What Every Citize
Straight forward class: midterm, final, and paper
Good lectures.  Go to class in order to do well on the tests.  Grades papers slightly hard.  Knows his Ohio policitcs quite well.
Excellent lectures, he lets you know what to expect on the tests beforehand.

This is what you should do: Take one class w/ him, let him get to know you a bit.  Get your B or C in that class, then take another class with him.  By then, he should know you very well and would pick you in with his "favorites", and you will get your A.  Smart guy, and funny too, but you can def. tell he's not normally a college professor.
best professor i've ever had

Great prof, and a true master of Ohio politics.  Cocky, yet backs it up with superb lectures, memorizes most students' names, and tells hilarious stories.  Don't expect a free lunch though; he grades tough.  And there is no need to do any of the readings, just memorize every note possible for the tests.
BEST professor at Ohio State- maybe ever...
A bit pompous and tends to play favourites.  If you don't get in good it's difficult to manage the A you would get otherwise.  You will learn a lot, but dealing with his ego may not be worth it.

By far the best professor I've had- the best professor at Ohio State. He knows what he's talking about and has the experience to back it up. Always willing to help students, most of his tests were from lectures. His tests and assignments were hard- but it
No Comments

A very challenging professor whao challenges students to think for them selves. Prof. Asher doesn't give easy A's and what he expects from a paper can be unclear, but his lectures are entertaining and highly informative. Also, despite being very politically active Democrat in Ohio, you would not know it form his class. He treats all students fairly

Asher required us to read three books but most of the test questions were from the lecture. He did not provide a study guide which made it difficult to study for tests and he acted like we were idiots when we asked to many questions about the required paper. I do not recommend this class unless you really good at sucking up.
Asher is a bit of a know-it-all and is prone to excessive name dropping, but he is still perhaps the most entertaining and the most informative professor I had this quarter.

Funny, informative, helpful, smart, smartass... this guy is something else!  just because he has his favorites doesn't mean the others get screwed... he is a fair, fair guy... who just happens to be VERY high on himself.  You'll learn a lot, though, and with some ease.  I have a feeling I coulda done without two of the three textbooks... oh well.
He is as bad as they come and who thinks he is Henry Kissinger and wants you to kiss up to him..He should leave the classroom

Fun classes, interesting information-not sure about getting an A, but I was pretty quiet and unnoticed, just paid attention in class, got an A- in each, no butt-kissing at all, seeing as I never spoke to him or in class.  No need to buy/read books.  Go to all lectures and pay attention/take notes.
Definitely knows his stuff. He makes class interesting although it seems impossible to get an A in it if you don't kiss some butt on the side.

I have had the benefit of being a political insider while taking his courses.  Asher does know who the players are, but he doens't know what is going on.  Don't let him mislead you on that.  When he talks inside baseball he's usally only about 25% right.
He's an Ohio political insider so he knows practically everyone who is important.  A great guy, and if you make yourself known to him, he'll do everything he can to help you.

Herb is by far one of the best professors at Ohio State. He truly loves teaching and the ass kissing. Just make him notice you in the first week and you're golden. I had him for both 502 and 506 and I enjoyed both courses equally, he makes class fun.

Larned a lot about Ohio Politics & always interesting.  However, grading not always clear & I got the impression that Asher was looking for certain things in papers, so found self trying to guess what he wanted rather than thinking on own.
Smart, funny, informative.  I want to be Herb Asher when I grow up.
No Comments
A great professor, extremely intelligent and a wonderful man.
This guy really knows his stuff and keeps it interesting.  Good Teacher

He's a good teacher, but he's pretty slimy. You'll get better grades if you work for someone important.  I worked my ass off for this class and somehow managed to only get a slightly higher grade than my boss.  This guy LOVES ass-kissing, too.
Learned a ton about Ohio Politics

Prof. Beck's course is largely statistical and focuses on the kinda stuff most political science students probably already know (at least in a loose sense). As such, lectures are quite boring and most of the information can be gathered from skimming the slides he provides. He's terribly dry but very smart, so you can't really help but respect him.

He's a great professor.  The lectures are dull and sooooo long, and you'll definitely fall asleep.  He really knows what he's talking about, though, and you really have no excuse for not doing well if you show up.  Lots of readings, but skimming them is more than enough.
Great teacher

Mr.Beck is a great teacher who knows his stuff. He is liberal(check fec.gov for who he's donated to) but does a great job hiding it. DO THE READINGS.the exams are multiple choice/essay. he gives the possible 6 essay questions in advance. My advice would be to draft the essays out in advance after doing readings,so that you're not doing the night B4

Amazing professor! Creates a great balance between professionalism and fun (humor) in the classroom. Material is very relevant to current affairs. He's always very accessible, and is always willing to help. He's a Prof. Emeritus, so take a class with him while he's still at the University!

Dr. Beck is extremely passionate about the field of Political Science and is very knowledgable about the subject matter. Yes he does tend to stray off topic, but the majority of his lectures are interesting and informative. He references the books and they are extremely helpful to study for the midterms with.

Mr. Beck is very knowledgeable and enthusiastic about political parties. He is a great teacher, but sometimes his lectures can be a bit dry, boring, and repetitive. The two exams he gives are 25 multiple choice questions each with a long essay response as well. He also has you do a research paper that makes up a big portion of your grade.
Professor Beck is incredibly well knowledge and generally a nice person. I highly recommend him.

Really great professor, one of the best I've ever had. Very friendly and communicates really well with the students. The class wasn't too challenging but wasn't easy, and I learned a lot. Highly recommended.

Awesome guy. Class is easy and he really knows his stuff. Always gives you room to voice your opinion, and grades you not on your opinion, but how you back it up and how well you know the material. Exams are straightforward and simple and he puts in a lot of cool stories and opinion pieces in his lectures. Definitely recommend him.

Prof Beck is a really great teacher. Helpful with anything you could ever need help with. Instant responses to emails, go out of his way for office hours etc. Lecture can be boring at times, but a lot of political anecdotes. Paper is fairly easy and exams are straight forward. Gives you essays ahead of time to study.

Great teacher.  Clearly knew the topic, researched any questions he did not know the answer to.  Grades very fairly, the essay was easy to get a good grade on.  Attendance not required, but can be used to bump grade up if you are close.  Overall great teacher, if you have the option, take him!
Professor Beck is a good guy. His class is easy, but you learn a lot. I thought the material was interesting - and you could see that he enjoyed teaching it.

Dean Beck is a good teacher. He is very informative and does a great job relating the topics to more recent elections. The class can get boring at times, but it is very interesting. The class is not too difficult and the paper topic is very interesting.
very nice and interesting! Explains everything clearly
Very nice man, interesting class; genuinely decent human being and very bright man.
Easy but boring.
No Comments
Great sense of humor.
No Comments
THE BEST PROFESSOR AT OHIO STATE!
No Comments
Great course
Good pleasant professor

Prof Holland is awesome! I loved his Problems of the contempt world class. He's a really cool guy and extremely knowledgeable about drug trade and the illicit market. Readings for every class were long and there were daily quizzes on the readings but the quizzes were manageable but you must at least skim the readings! The final was a paper.
Very interessing class. One of the best i've taken so far. Way to go Prof Raines!

I highly enjoyed the class, though it was online. Lectures were highly enjoyable, with lots of entertaining and relevant material. Quizzes are very tough, but he curves at the end. Overall, I would highly recommend him.
Good class. Covers lots of interesting, current topics and lectures are entertaining. You do have to keep up with the reading or you won't know what's going on for quizzes.

I really enjoyed this course. Raines kept the lectures and material interesting. Also you can make up for any missed material from lectures if you stay on top of the required readings. Overall the amount of effort you put in the course will determine your grade.

This instructor uses his diverse experiences and incredible knowledge to explain valuable concepts in fine detail. A must take introductory class to know more about different parts of the and to clear misconceptions about them.
Make sure you use the textbook and take the quizzes that she requires on there because it counts for a very large portion of your grade.

I actually really enjoyed this online class. I knew nothing about politics going into this class, and finished it with more interest and knowledge. Dr. Ratliff does a great job with the lectures and answering any questions. This course does require A LOT of reading to prepare for the weekly quizzes & exams. Put in the work and you will learn a lot!

Prof Silverman is a really cool guy, and he knows what he's talking about. The class is based on two articles a week. You should read them, but you can kind of skim through to get the gist. I recommend Silverman. Do what you're supposed to do and you'll get an A.
The class has a decent amount of readings, but the class is enjoyable and if you put in the time you will do well in the class.

Most of the reading in the class is academic literature, which can be pretty dense and inaccessible at times. Professor Silverman does a great job at teaching students how to break down the readings and make them engaging.

Silverman is a great professor for American Foreign Policy 2300, and in general. The course is 3 credit hours and instead of reading a textbook is based on scholarly articles. We read about 40-50 pages a week and the reading quizzes are very easy if you go to lecture you should get an A. The midterm was a take home test. Super genuine and smart guy

Prof. Silverman is just staring out but is a good professor. There are readings online for each lecture and he posts the powerpoint slides on carmen. No homework, just reading quizzes, a midterm, and a final. Easy to get a good grade if you pay attention and are interested in the topic. Overall, clear, well organized, and a nice guy.

Shes the nicest professor I have had here so far. Really good teacher that is really good at explaining things. She really cares about her students and wants you to do well. Lectures are really in depth and the tests are kinda hard but if you read the textbook and make sure you understand can definitely get an A.

Great professor! She's very upbeat and energetic and makes the class somewhat interesting. Doesn't give any homework and reading the book isn't a necessity. If you look at her powerpoints (which she posts online) you'll be fine for the tests. The tests are super easy and she gives extra credit. Always willing to help if you're struggling.

Good Professor, she cares a lot about the material. Sometimes is kind of a hot mess, dropping pens and pencils and falling down. Most of the material is based right off the textbook, class is not mandatory but make sure you go to the review days before exams. There are 2 exams, 2 quizzes and opportunities to get extra credit.

Gabriella Lloyd is a great professor! She has a lot of enthusiasm for what she teaches, which makes the lectures more interesting. To do well in the class, make sure you do your reading and study the lecture PowerPoints. Also, make sure you go to the in-class review days, because the practice questions covered will most likely end up on the exam!

A very friendly teacher who understands the material very well.  Her lectures are based solely on the contents in the textbook.  As long as you understand the contents in the textbook, you will definitely get an A in class.  She is not very strict with attendance, just make sure that you show up on the exam days.

This is one of the best professors I have had. She does not cut beat around the bush, she is very to the point. She always gives study guides for the exams and as long as you do those and pay attention in class you will get an A. Highly recommend any of her classes and she gives extra credit a fair amount so that you have to pass this class. :)
No Comments
Amazing Lecturer! I really enjoyed his class. Made me consider a change in my major. Read the material and you should do very well. Oh, yeah and he is Hilarious

Johnny wants you to do well. He may spend alot of time gossiping in class but if you do the reading you're set. He gave us a review sheet and a girl complained that he had a question on the exam that wasn't on the sheet and he gave everyone credit for the question! He also gave our class ample opportunities for extra credit.

Really easy class but you still have to do the readings in order to do well on the test, not everything is covered in class. Tests were fairly easy, and he lets you drop your lowest grade. Recommend this class if you need an easy filler b/c there is not much to do for it and he lets you out early each time. He loves the Seahawks more than politics
Best teacher i've had at ohio state in 4 years. i'd take any class he taught
fun guy, knows a lot about pop culture and sports.  do the readings and know them well, as many times he can get sidetracked and off topic in class.  nice guy, fair-grader, good class.
Fun guy to have a class with. Make sure you do the readings and you can ace the daily reading quizzes. Grading is fairly easy as well. Overall the class was a hoot.

He was very helpful.  I went to office hours daily and he practically told me the questions that would be on the quiz as well as went over the lecture beforehand. He checks rough drafts, helps you study, etc.  Very nice guy.  Daily quizes were annoying but it helped in the end.  midterm was a lil tricky, final was piece of cake.

Easy teacher and grader, but there are many assignments and daily reading quizzes.  Don't take this class without doing the work or it will be rather difficult, otherwise you should be set for a good grade.
Johnny is so great, if you love politics, you will love his class. I learned so much, I would def. take any class he was teaching.

Great wealthy of knowledge, Johnny knows his stuff...and tries to relay it to you; even a better class during the recent presidential elections,do the weekly homework,show up for attendence points, and you'll know your stuff for the exams

He's definately a cool and fun guy, who really enjoys his subject, which is always fun to see. He treats his class with respect, and never puts down someone's opinion. From now on he's gonna be the first guy I look for if I have to take another Poli Sci class. DEAR OSU: MAKE THIS MAN A PROFFESOR.

Looks a little like Jack Black & tries to be funny like him too. Nice guy real understanding, his review sheets help a lot for the 3 tests. Weekly homeworks are easy and there are extra credit opportunities.
best teacher i've had yet! take any class he teaches
VERY good teacher, relates material to real world, funny and understanding

Very fun way of teaching. Talked about more than just the class curriculum, including football and The Simpsons. Great class. Easy if you go occasionally and read every once in a while. Chance for an easy A. If you need GPA help, take this class.

Johny's a really cool guy.  He makes class fun.  I never read and occasionly went to class and i got almost a perfect score on everything.  Poly Sci majors looking for an easy elective should definitly take this class from Johny.
A for effort; D for ability
Very entertaining but demanding; lots of reading, tries to be helpful though

Avery is very hilarious and intelligent. Class is VERY discussion-oriented and he respects everyones comments. Grade consists of weekly papers on the previous weeks topic, as well as 2 quizzes per week on the readings. All of these are graded out of 3 points each (3A, 2B, etc.). Great class to learn several areas of poli-theory. LOTS of reading!

I did not attend this class once in the final month and a half of the semester. And still got a %100.  To get a perspective on how easy this class is, participation was %10 of the grade, and I spoke 3 times in all of the classes I actually went to.  I didn't skip because I could though, I skipped because it was painfully boring.

A large part of our class was based on attendance, never took it and everyone got 100% even though most didn't come all semester. Everyone also got 100% on presentations and the lowest grade on any paper was 80%. Breathe and you get an A. Lots of reading "required" but really not at all. Super unorganized.

First teacher I've ever had who just didn't care. Didn't organize the class whatsoever and made participation 30% of the grade. The issue with this is he didn't keep track of attendance and gave students bad grades for it who went to class. Losing 10% on your final grade for missing one class is insane, right? Bad teacher, bad class.

Extremely easy. The midterm is 10 MC Questions, that you can take home. The final is the same. Rest of the grade is based off your Tophat participation. If you're looking to get an easy A, this is the class for you. That being said, you learn relatively little. Other political science courses here go more in depth. Overall, easy A, but not useful.

I am very picky in regards to who I will actually take classes with. The course time for this was later than I would usually bother with. However, my academic advisor  said to; "take it with him, I know you'll love it". She was completely right! The material is spot on and makes you really consider perspectives. Justin is brilliant.

Justin really makes you think, especially when the topics get more abstract. The grading and expected requirements are never very clear, and I feel like the grades were rather random. However, it really provided me with a lot to think of and enhanced my skills in writing. If you take his class, make sure to take notes and attend his office hours!

*1st time teaching this class*  Grades: reading summary due every class, 2 papers + final.  Advise:  read/do every homework & pay attention in class  it'll make papers and final easier. He is very unclear of what is expected in assignments therefore loose unexplainable points.

One of the few classes where I felt like the information I got out of it mattered more than the grade.  Class consists of discussion and 3 papers. If you read the articles and are engaged in discussion you will get a lot of out it.  I personally feel as though I am able to think more clearly about political issues and understand political arguments

Very helpful, and genuinely wants you to get the material. Format of class is an open discussion, which is nice. Discussions can get abstract at times. There is a lot of reading, but as long as you get the principle of the reading you're fine. Basically the entire grade consists of 3 papers that consist of how you feel about politics.
She deeply cares about her students but her lectures are very boring.  There is a group paper also which personally I absolutely hate.

Took this class during May, and she was super awesome. We had reading quizzes pretty much every day, but they were open book. Overall she really cares about students being successful and as long as you participate and make an effort to do well, you will get an A.

I did not think I would like her or the class but I was wrong! Great class if you're interested in law or CJS. Straight forward lectures; clean, to the point slides and class almost always ends 15 min early. It takes work to get an A but its nothing unmanagable. Study guides cover everything on the exams! Exams: MC + ID terms and short answers.

Course seemed basic enough at first, but I quickly realized how dry Prof. McGraw's was. The subject matter is fairly interesting, but lectures are stuffed and very boring. Exams are ridiculous, mostly multiple choice but they test the most insignificant details. And if you mess up, they're worth 35%, so good luck. First W, I say avoid at all costs.

Midterm (35%), final (35%) (noncumulative) and paper (30%). Gives out very detailed study guides for the exams which have around 40 MC questions and 10-15 short answer. Paper is over a famous court trial in the 20th century. Material covered in class is very interesting. Focused on the criminal justice system. Put in the time in and get the grade.

I usually do not post any type of review or rating for professors. I, however, believed this to be an instance where such was imperative. In my correspondence with Prof. McGraw, she was rude, condescending, and unnecessarily degrading. He behavior was inexcusable and completely unprofessional, and therefore I do not recommend any of her courses.
Professor McGraw is a great lecturer. Her notes a clear and she tells you exactly what she is looking for. Plus class was usually only an hour long! She provides an overly detailed study guide.

I really can't say enough about this professor. I found her to be very intelligent and engaging, and I found the course material to be relevant and applicable as a great intro to law. The reading is the lecture, and the lecture is very well structured. Attend the class. If you do the work in this class, you get the grade.

Prof is very liberal and not afraid to tell you that. However she is a pretty good instructor, but her exams are kinda tough. She provides a study guide, but it is in about size 8 font, with 2 columns on each side of the page and packed full of EVERYTHING that was covered the whole time, so it really doesn't help you focus your studying much.
great professor got promoted to chair so wont be teaching for a while

I find it hard to believe that she didn't learn students names in the aformentioned class...because in my class of 60+ she knows a good deal of names (maybe you just have to participate.) Great prof...515 is a very interesting class.
Assigns a lot of work, but exams and grading are very reasonable.  If you get to know her, you'll think she's fabulous.

She makes no attempt to learn students' names or get to know them.  Her tests are extremely easy, but there's a long paper at the end (but she grades that easily, too.) She seemed to not enjoy teaching.
not very nice at all (i'm not bitter -- got a good grade but still).
Wonderful prof. One of the best at Ohio State!
The lectures are pretty boring, but the tests are easy because you can 75 out of the 100 questions are in the online textbook.

Very long and boring lectures, attendance is mandatory (need to attend 20 lectures), very easy paper everyone gets a 100, final is noncumulative, midterm and final consist of 75 questions people already have access to, easy A just boring and annoying to get through

Very easy-going man with a lot of knowledge on the policy process.  Three exams (final non-cumulative) were not very hard and had up to 5 bonus points for turning in questions after lecture. Also a short paper due at the end of the class. Readings and lectures could sometimes be dull but the class is a good foundation for Poli Sci students.
You have to be willing to read and study for his tests.

The lectures were boring and hard to sit through, but they're only two hours a week and attendance is optional.  Your entire grade is based on two midterms (half take home, half multiple choice) and two papers, so not a lot of work, but he is pretty unclear about what he's looking for.

Lectures are dull but not too long. He's definitely attractive in a dad-grandpa DILF/GILF sort of way and genuinely cares about his students. Two exams, the essay portion is take home and quizzes every Friday which you'll ace if you look over the lecture slide (which are all online)

Honestly, Wright is a great professor. He made the heavy sometimes depressing subject of political science less bearable and I definitely learned a lot from him. He's also funny and cute for an old guy. Would recommend this class if you're willing to read some supplemental readings and take an easy quiz every Friday. Not bad, but not an easy A.

Prof. Wright was so great! Not only did he make lecture interesting (with the exception of some dry media topics,) he was very helpful, and he pointed me in the right direction for thesis advisers. Great man!

Class format is lecture on Monday and Wednesday and a "workshop" on Fridays. About 1/4 of the class attends lectures since the slides are all online, but it is more helpful to sit in class because he goes over things that might be on the midterm. Group project at the end instead of a final. Not a fun class, but interesting.

This class wasn't a totally easy A.  You really need to attend class and read the book to really understand the material and do well in the class.  Professor Wright knows what he is talking about and is interesting.  However I would not take this class unless you really want to learn more about the American government.

Great Professor.  Material was interesting and informing.  Lectures were to the point and engaged in class discussion frequently.  I would highly recommend going to class because quiz's and tests were based on class lecture.  Grades fairly, but not an easy A.
Easy A. All you have to do is read the chapters.  There are 3 midterms, not cumulative, and no final.  And I think he cancelled lecture or recitation about 5 times too!
I would give him a B.
Extremely boring but to the point. Puts the lecture on Carmen so no need to take notes; just listen to lecture and read book and you will have no trouble with class.

Professor Wright was a very nice man. Personally, no one seemed to have a problem with him. However, the lectures were hit and miss in terms of material. A good majority of lectures seemed little to do with actual "party politics". However, the tests were pretty easy and the essay question was mostly straight forward.

Topic was interesting but the class was not well constructed. He really had no lectures at all more like just came in wanting to talk everyday, really about almost anything. Somedays you get to materal that matters other days you don't No Midterm, No Final, a quiz, 2 papers, and reading notes so you actually have to read th stuff. Lots of reading.
Easy class, boring lectures. The texts he assigns are interesting and stimulating. Very knowledgeable about politics and you can learn a great deal from him.
Very interesting class. Knows his material....puts powerpoints online. My TA sucked (Bouche), but Prof. Wright was great. Tests weren't too difficult.

great prof.   very helpful and clear good guest speakers very approachable.  one paper and easy to medium exam strength based on how much you study.  Chapter readings were about 50 pages every lecture but they werent too bad

Lecture was boring, but I put up with it (and the ridiculously long readings) thinking that it would help on the exams.  Well, I was wrong.    Plus he was always tripping over his mic cord (which was turned up waaaay too loud by the way..so much that you could hear every gulp of water, every single scratch, every time CLEARED HIS THROAT!)
Lectures were boring and long. Tests based totally on book. Lots of reading involved. Not the easiest GEC
Nice guy..wants you to do well. Easy if you attend lecture and read the book..tests mostly on the book and the few videos he shows in class.
just a good guy, easy if you pay attention and read, easy A
He is an easy professor. Extremely boring professor, but he has a very interesting subject to teach about. He does everything in his power to help you pass

Class was very interesting. The class is a huge lecture, and doesn't matter if you attend the lectures. 2 Midterms and 1 Final. Midterms are easy. He gives you a study test and half of those are on the midterm. Also posts all his lectures online. I recommend this class. Easy GEC
No Comments

Dan was pretty cool and somewhat lenient if he sees that you are putting forth an honest effort. This class isn't difficult so long as you watch the lectures and take notes. I did not do any of the readings and did not open the book once and I did alright. DO THE EXTRA CREDIT! It would've boosted me up a letter grade in the end.

He genuinely cares about your learning, he gave me great feedback on my paper. There's readings, lectures to watch, discussion boards, and two online exams. First exam hard, second was easy. Assignment themselves are challenging, but he is not a hard grader. Not an easy A by any means but a reasonable work load for an online class.

Great instructor, down-to-earth, caring, unbiased, and a true expert in Political Psychology & IR Theories. Lectures are somewhat long, but he tried best to explain the materials in the simplest ways so everyone can understand.  His exams and assignments seem are difficult, but doable. He is not stingy on giving good grades as long as you work hard

Class is not overall not too hard and Dan does not make it an unnecessary burden. His lectures for the weeks are somewhat long (expect 2-3 hours online) and he requires a certain amount of participation in the discussion forum (although he is somewhat vague on what will get you full credit). Tests are relatively easy and he gives a good study guide

Dan covers the topics discussed very well and definitely knows what he's talking about. However, the notes and lectures aren't very good for studying. They're basically powerpoints with him speaking over but the powerpoints are very basic.I like to read them, especially when studying,  so this was frustrating.

Professor Wollrich is one of the best teachers I've ever had. He explained sometimes complex ideas of foreign policy in ways everyone could understand and did a great job of making them applicable to actual current events. He encouraged involvement in the class and never made someone feel dumb for putting forward any idea.

Awesome guy. One of my favorite polysci professors! Super knowledgeable and easy to understand on tough topics. Offers really great unbiased information on course material and current events. Gives pop quizzes so do the readings and show up to class cause he covers more than what's on the slides, also gives easy to follow study guides for exams

Great guy and a great class. He has a lot of knowledge, and his lectures are clear and concise. Readings supplement material well, and he is always available to answer any questions. Gives great study guides to help prepare for exams. Pop quizzes are given, but are generally simple if you did the reading. I recommend this class!

Dan is a great guy who cares about the material being covered. He class was interesting, and the workload was extremely manageable. The pop quizzes and random attendance roll-calls should keep you coming to class. I would highly recommend making sure that you do the readings ahead of time. He gave us a study guide which made the exams a breeze

Good professor. He is a solid lecturer and he posts his lectures online. The quizzes are on the previous nights reading and are done at random. However, he assigns a bit of reading and it can be relatively boring. There were group debates which were not too bad, but the topics could be slightly weighted towards one side.

Dan is a nice guy who is very motivated about the material. He gives like 5 quizzes at random, so you want to make sure you're in class. Also, he randomly will take attendance some days. Quizzes and exams are extremely easy (I got a 100% on the first one). He grades the papers tougher, but they aren't worth too much of your grade. Overall: A+

Dedicated his life to studying polish politics... except hes a Canadian living in the US. Changed the grading system after the last class ended, dramatically dropping everyones grades. Youd think that with the class being a 1 credit hour seminar, especially one for scholars, that itd be intended as a grade booster. Nope. He loves lowering GPAs.

This was a really easy class, where if you do everything that is expected of you, you will get an A. Peter clearly outlines what is expected, and as long as you come to class/don't leave early, you'll be fine. He is also very accessible out outside of class.

Took this class as required by Scholars seminar. I was bamboozled into thinking the class was going to be taught by the program director, however, she left and never returned. Peter came in, and taught the class focused on niche Polish politics and the wonderfulness of Canada. Also, he thinks he's hilarious and the world's best hockey player.
Right on

I took his class for my International Affairs seminar, and he is not a terrible professor he isn't my favorite. Participation in the class is mandatory if you want to pass, so do the readings before class. Minimal effort was needed to get a good grade. Lack of feedback is given and things are very open ended. Really loves Poland and Canada.

Peter is a super nice guy and he was helpful during office hours. Exams weren't too hard and there was a review day before. Be prepared to do a lot of reading because the quizzes are  very specific and they can easily keep you from an A in the course.

The reading quizzes are extremely difficult and will probably keep any student from getting an A in this class. Exams are easy and he gives you extra credit for attending lecture, but I would stay away from this class if you are not an audio learner because he doesn't not use slideshows or visual notes. Overall, not a good teacher

As a TA at Ohio State, Michael displayed that he is genuinely not ready to teach a course. Michael struggles with simple interactions with students, as he claimed one student was biased against women because he asked the professor about a question on the exam for one example. He grades inconsistently and threatens to remove points when questioned.
Incredibly intelligent, clearly in love with the material. Class has lots of material, but she makes everything very easy. Midterms and finals are multi-component papers, no testsquizzes.

I am so glad to have her as my professor and she thought me how to care about issues that didn't matter to me in the past. She changed my way of thinking through her easy and simple way if teaching . She is not worrying you by giving you a lot of quiz's and exams , but she teaches you to learn the subject ,eventually I learn more from her than some

Take a course with Professor Amadae, you won't regret it! This is my second course with her. She is enthusiastic and knowledgable about the material, and cares a great deal about students. We covered several policies such as eminent domain and homeland security to name a few. She makes class fun and you learn a great deal about policy also.
Professor Amadae is the best professor I've had at Ohio State. Her passion for the subject, attention to detail, and love for the material was inspirational. I highly recommend this course!

Intelligent and passionate about the field, but is a terrible professor. She's very scatter-brained and jumps from one subject to another without any function. She goes off on tangents and can't backtrack to her point. Tries to make it interesting but it was a dry class. Exams had way too much work involved, take home essay and an in class.

She tends to be disorganized; if you were looking for a classic absent-minded professor she'd be it. But she does make everything clear in the end, obviously cares about teaching, and always answers student questions in detail. If you like organized & very efficient in a course, no. If you like rigor and wandering into intellectual side roads, yes.

She is definitely brilliant and passionate, but she is an awful professor. This semester, she has a fellowship at Harvard so it may have something to do with why she's so disorganized, but I was incredibly frustrated throughout this course. Lectures were pointless and not helpful and I never knew what was due. Would not recommend at all.

She is clearly passionate about human rights and has a lot of interesting life experiences. There's a lot of reading and a lot of breaking into discussion groups. If you want to sit through a lecture without talking, she's not for you. She jumps around a lot but the info is there. She shows several documentaries which are a nice break.

Prof. Amadae is a great person. The class is easy. She gives you the actually exam questions before the exams. You will feel frustrated because she is scatterbrained but it is worth it for the A and she knows her stuff. She is fun. Get to know her!

Don't bother taking this class if you want to learn something. You will just read a ton of material & not really discuss it in class because she talks in circles. Then she will give you the questions for the exam & you'll spend hours preparing for it & then you'll get to the exam & the questions will be completely different. Pretty bad Professor.

Nice lady, not a great teacher. She clearly knows her stuff, but is not very good at conveying it to a classroom. She does not take command of the class and is all over the place. She also waits till the last possible minute to post things on Carmen (for the class). I like her as a person, but she may be the worse prof. I've ever had.

Tons of reading. She is nice and very passionate about the material, but she really is all over the place and difficult to follow. My notes make no sense because she interrupts herself and often doesn't complete a sentence before she is on to the next sentence. Her exams are ridiculous, too much info crammed into one test.

Professor Amadae was all over the place. I am a PoliSci major and have taken courses with some of the best faculty in the department. Professor Amadae was often flustered in class, and seemed frustrated. There is a lot of reading in the class; so, be prepared to read. Her teaching is not clear, and she does not take command of class well.

Very friendly and helpful.  Expect to work hard and do a TON of reading, but Amadae is upbeat and really knows her stuff.  I highly recommend her class, so long as you are willing to invest a lot of time preparing for each class.  Also, she is very open to discussion and alternative perspectives on concepts and texts. No textbook, lots of articles.
Great professor. Extremely passionate about material. Interesting class, great readings, films and discussions. I would highly recommend it. She's interesting one-on-one as well.
If you are a poli sci major, take a class with Amadae. She is awesome.
Very challenging but interesting class. Be prepared to do a ton of reading.

SOOOO hard to understand... she is extremely intelligent but talks way over any ones head and is hard to follow. Luckily the T.A. that graded exams agreed and graded fairly. Usually didn't respond to e-mail.

The most terrible teacher I've encountered so far @ osu. She's nice & passionate about teaching. But she's really terrible at it. Unorganized, can never give direct answers to questions, & never prepared. Grades are easy to get b/c she strictly follows review shts. But she doesn't put notes she promised to put online till the day before the final!
Her class was very poorly organized.  Lectures very difficult to follow.  Jumps around a lot without fully explaining concepts.  She is a very pleasant woman just not a very good lecturer.

She is truly genuwinely interested in helping students and teaching.  My problem with her is that she is very back and forth in lecture.  It is very all over the place.  It is very hard to take notes.  She will start with something and before fully explaining it jump to something else.  However, I understand theory classes are hard to teach though.

I loved this class. It was one of the most interesting I've ever taken.  She is really concerned with making sure we understand the material, and the tests are straightforward. I would recommend her as a professor to anyone.

I really enjoyed the class. Lots of difficult reading outside of class, but quizzes and tests were generally easy and straight-forward.  Grading was fair. Although, the clarity of instruction was not always perfect, Amadae seemed to really care about whether students grasped material and was constantly there to help reiterare and reexpress.
Awesome if challenging professor!
Awesome professor. Studied at some University called Cambridge? He adds like 20 points onto everyones quizzes and as long as you read the book  theyre easy. If you like history then take this class

This class is WAY too difficult for a GEC. I don't know what he expects and he is not clear AT ALL when giving lectures. The notes he gives online are also not very good. I would not recommend taking this course with this particular professor unless you already have a good background of Western Europe.

Quizzes are unbelievably hard. A LOT of reliance on the book. (You have to read like 100 pages a week) Quizzes don't pertain to lecture. Exams are easier, one essay based on lecture and a few short answer questions. He's not very clear and has an EXTRAVAGANT vocabulary that is hard to understand. This class is TOO hard to be a GEC.
He is incredibly intelligent and international studies 210 was the epitome of a liberal arts education.
His exams are very difficult; for a GEC this class is WAY too hard.
