Thinks he's above students, boring, lets his TA do the work, the paper and exams were tough and harshly graded. I go out of my way to not take his classes. On the positive side he knows his stuff.

This class was way too hard for a GEC 210 level class.  Don't take it! I didn't trust the other comments that warned not to take it and had to learn the hard way that this class sucks.  He is a great professor, full of information, but he gives you no direction on what you need to look over.  I went to every lecture and was still completely lost.
There is a lot of information. I had 50 written pages of notes for each of the midterm and final. There is also a final paper. The grading scale was nice

far too in-depth for a 200 level class. The readings were long, not discussed, and not chronologically relevant to the day's lecture. The man is brilliant, but he expects you to be also in how he constructs his test questions. Tons of material overall. Avoid.
Prof. Gunther is an expert on modern democracies (particularly regarding southern Europe), and his enthusiasm for the subject made his class very fun.  I learned a lot about modern democracies.

Juggernaut of information to absorb, even with the online Study Guides.  Brilliant man.  Go to every class, sit in front, record his lecture, and listen to them while munching on some chips.  And go to the operas and orchestras for 6% extra credit.

His energy of strong interest in the subject matter is highly contagious. Relates themes well to real world change. Taking notes is a strong requirement for success on the quizzes and exams, the latter having above average difficulty. Solid Five Star Recommend.

Professor Gunther knows what he is talking about. Mostly all of his info was recited from memory, very passionate making him interesting to listen to. The class is difficult though. Pop quizzes are tough, Essay midterm wasn't bad. Prepare for tons of reading. Not an easy class.
This man is unbelievably smart.  I've learned so much from him.  If you are looking for an easy A, try something else, but if you want to actually learn something, IS 210 is a great class.
A fantastic lecturer.  I now go out of my way to find what class he teaches so that I can schedule it.  My favorite professor at OSU.

The level of knowledge Dr. Gunther has regarding democracies around the world is intimidating; nearly all of his statistics are recited from memory. What I assumed would be a dull class turned into one of my favorites, all due to Gunther. I'd take another class with him in a heartbeat.

Dr. Gunther made what could of been a dull class fairly interesting. The tests were essay, but they were over lecture material and not very difficult. The reading is very dull, but it is not very essential for the tests. Long term paper.

He's passionate and lecture isn't bad, but he goes off on tangents sometimes. Slides are poor and bare minimum.  Midterm and final were cake, but the quizzes are a bit difficult and worth 100 points!  A paper of five pages is only worth 10 points, though....?

Hard class (especially for an intro, 200-level class), I don't recommend it unless you're looking for a challenge. Prof is very smart but dry, and digresses a lot. Text readings are long and became unnecessary. 3 pop quizzes, a 5 page paper, midterm (mostly essay), & final (mostly essay). Honestly I'm just reallllly happy that this class is over.

Dr. Gunther is probably one of the most knowledgeable people, not only at OSU, but in the entire world about comparative politics in Europe.(Especially Spain) His lectures are a must since you will learn the bulk of the material there. The class is fairly demanding but I don't think I have ever learned more in a class than his. Great Professor

If you seriously think this class was too hard, maybe you shouldn't be in college. An overview of Western European history with music and art, lectures are a must and you should at least skim the textbook. The 3 "unannounced" quizzes are not bad. Clearly passionate and has a dry sense of humor. Easier than AP European, which I took in 10th grade.

This should be renamed International Studies 510. The material covered in class is from the time of Constantine to the present. You cover A LOT. You not only cover the actual hard history, but the evolution of art and music. The art and music is tested extensively. The good thing is that there is a very big curve on everything. Take at own risk.

Terrible Professor, the TA's do much much more then him. He teaches and his topics although organized in time period are not clear at all. He makes the exams and quizzes but doesn't grade anything and couldn't even give a lecture without a TA there. DO not take this class.
Very Hard.  Definitely the hardest class i had that quarter. He might be the smartest man at OSU but he also may expect too much of his students, especially for a 200 level class.

Professor Gunther is so passionate about the subjects that he teaches that there is no doubt that he is giving us everything that he has to offer. If you do the reading you should be set for the two unannounced quizzes, the midterm, and the final. I never did the readings and I am still averaging a B in the class. Going to lectures are a must.

Great Professor to learn from if you don't care about your grade. Not an easy A or easy B for that matter. I worked really hard this quarter read every reading and will most likely get a B he said our paper would be 10% of our grade then he takes it out of 10 points when the pop quizzes are out of a hundred points themselves. Don't take this class

all these people who are recommending this class must be INSANE. there is so much reading, lectures that do not correspond to the texts, he shows you hundreds of art forms and then tests you on 4 random pictures. honestly there are 3 classes in one...this class is a waste, don't take it.

If you want to learn a lot about comparative government, he is excellent. He is extremely knowledgeable, listing off names, dates, even electoral data without notes for all two hours of class. There are a lot of readings and great deal of information to take in. Not for the weak of heart, but a must if you're serious about comparative politics.
Great professor, throughly enjoys teaching very much and it shows. Very knowledgable. Interesting class, only drawback, the class is somewhat challenging.

A fantastic professor, really enthusiastic about the subject matter, and completely passionate about helping students. Don't get turned off my his assigning his own work; he is the preeminent scholar in S. European comparative politics and waives all royalties. Great course. Lectures are fascinating but can drone on.

GO TO CLASS!!  his tests are passable only if you attend classes.  He's a great teacher!  He lectures like a textbook from time to time, but I don't think there's a prof at Ohio State who knows his subject more!!
He was a wonderful man. He is definitely very into the class topics, which makes it more enjoyable for the students. I would definitely recommend his class.
He is very enthusiastic about the class.  There are quizzes that are out of the book and over the art, but the tests are largely drawn from the lectures.

I loved him! He is the most knowledgable and overall sweet man. You can easily get a B+ in this class just by attending and taking notes. If you try really hard, you'll get the A. He curves this class. Really great guy, glad I took this class from him instead of someone else.

Prof. Gunther is a great teacher and his class is a piece of cake if you take good notes. I've had three classes with him and have never read a single page of assigned reading, and I've never gotten below a B in any of his classes. If you can take notes and then write essays off of those notes, you're golden.
UGH!!  get out while you can!!
Excellent professor.  He really knows the material and has a passion for it, which makes class interesting.  Sadly, his TAs are harsh graders.
No Comments

This class was very challenging but great. Gunther is not an easy teacher but he really knows his stuff and I would highly recommend him. His enthusiasm really made me interested in the otherwise boring material.

Very demanding pop quizzes constitute a large portion of the grade, no review sheets for midterm or final and TONS of reading required.  However, the quizzes and midterms usually have a curve...so he is somewhat merciful.  You will learn a lot in this class.

This guy makes you think to yourself, "man i should drop this class" the first day. Stick with it though...tough to stay awake sometimes because he is so monotonous and serious, but he definately knows his stuff. At least this guy makes me feel like Im getting my money's worth. Average difficulty.
Interesting class.  Superfluous amount of reading material, and some can be dry, but all in all not a bad class. ****her is a VERY well established prof.

Eastern Europe. This is a hard class.  He changed the mid-terms because of the students, but they were just harder.  He is an awesome teacher though.  It's really cool though because he shows a ton of slides and covers not just the history, but the art and architecture of EE.
No Comments
No Comments
not good, very boring
Very challenging class, but he presents a wealth of information.  Can be a bit confusing at times, but take some time and effort to pay attention and you'll see how everything fits together.
Not a Poly Sci major (International Studies) so did not really understand the cleass and ****her does not help. Very confusing and the worst reading assignments.
Lectures are a little confusing, but only because there's so much information and he tries to show how everything relates.  Best poli sci class I have ever taken.
No Comments

Really tough teacher, but he taught me so much!  His lectures can be hard to follow, but if you listen carefully, you'lllearn more in his class than in ten other poli sci classes.  Seems stuffy and gruff, but he'll totally go out of his way to help you.

He went to the University of Chicago and studied with John Mearsheimer, so he thinks he's really cool. He's fairly intelligent, but beware because he often slips--eg. citing the U.S. atomic weapons, "Fat Boy and Little Man." He's really into his own ideas, so be prepared to have your input shut down. That said--read, come to class & pass. Not hard.

He's a new instructor. He can be a little over the top about some things, he insists you read every single article. There's two 5 pg response papers, a mid term and final. Not my favorite instructor but he seems smart.

Fair grader. Do all the readings. COME TO CLASS! Test material is based solely on lectures derived from readings. Two 2 pg response papers. Participation counts.Midterm & Final. Great class highly recommend this professor!

He's at Temple University now and he's unsure of what he's doing. We had a lot on our syllabus to do and then he changed everything to weekly reflection papers and a final research paper. I never go to class and I have an A. Easy teacher. Great guy.
Mr. Crawford is a pretty cool guy. As long as you take notes in class you should do fine on the exams. Should be an easy class if you put in effort.

Prof. Crawford was great. His lectures were easy to understand, he made jokes, kept us interested and overall really did make US Politics more clear especially about issues that go on with the government today like public policy.

I thought it was a great class. Nyron is a great teacher and loves hearing what the class thinks about the topic and about the class in general. He grades pretty easily and the class discussions are usually very interesting. Really enjoyed it.

I'm pretty conflicted here, because Nyron is a nice guy, and quite helpful. His lectures are pretty interesting, and he is quite clear in them. However, I felt that many of the homework assignments were just busy work, and the exams were made much harder than they needed to be. I'm really not sure if I would have taken this knowing what I know now.
Her lectures were really interesting and easy to understand, I really like her as a teacher

She is seriously AMAZING. She gives you all of the information that you need during her lectures and offers extra credit assignments. Attendance is mandatory and as long as you take some notes, you will definitely get an A. Her powerpoints don't give the information so you have to go to class. But she is so nice and a great teacher!
Great instructor and very easy to get an A

She's a very nice and fun teacher. Majority of her tests come from her lectures. She likes to listen to your comments and questions.As long as you go to class and take a few notes then you'll pass. You will need to read the book sometimes. She posts Powerpoint notes online and those are very helpful. Easy class.
awful. tests were easy. papers were alright. lectures were pointless. attendance was mandatory tho.... just awful
Amazing teacher. Exams were so easy as long as you go to class and listen. I didnt read at all and got an A in the class. Ms Bayram is very interesting and fun lady.
Attendance is mandatory, participation encouraged but overall a great professor and knows all the material
Best woman ever!!! Ms. Bayram helps you with everything and allows you to draw your own conclusions. Best class and Best prof at OSU by far.

Best professor I've ever had! She makes class interesting, and honestly cares what her students have to say. TONS of interesting discussion, so if you get involved it's never boring. Exam was easy, just as long as you go to class and pay attention. She's a genius!!
This was an easy class but attendance is mandatory and she'll make it awkward if no one participates. If you do participate you'll be on her good side for sure.

Wonderful class! She is extremely intelligent, but she explains everything until class understands. Notecard allowed for exams, no surprises on exams. One of the best professors I've had, if not the best! Awesome discussions during class, encourages you to think for yourself. If you get the chance, DEFINITELY take a course with her :)

The first thing I have to say about Ms (hopefully still Ms) Bayram is that she is HOT!! She has a smile that is so tantalizing. As far as the class, it was pretty easy. She allowed us to use a notecard for our tests so hopefully you can write really really small. I walked away with a B but I could've gotten an A. I just got lazy.

Hands-down the most unprofessional professor I've ever met. Inflexible attendance policy (she recommends dropping her class if you need to miss one class). She ostracized/mocked a student in front of the class on the first day for e-mail inquiries about her attendance policy. I dropped and ran while I could.

He is absolutely genuine about helping his students. Great professor, quality lectures, fair assignments. I recommend him to Political Science majors and those who just need GE credits, he makes the class worth going to and interesting.
Jess is perf. Perf
I really enjoyed Professor Goode. He is so nice and is genuinely interested in his students and loves teaching. He is a fair grader and wants you to succeed. I would highly recommend him.
Great Professor who wants you to understand the material and succeed in his class.
Great professor who enjoys the material he teaches. Jess will help his students no matter what they need help with, and he brought us candy every Friday! Great guy, great teacher.

He is a very good teacher, he really wants you to participate. His quizzes and exams are taken online, but using a lockdown broswer. He is very personable, and usually has a couple good jokes in him. He's very nice and very clear in what he explains, also he posts his notes on Carmen
She is organized but so damn hard in grading. She is hot though!

For a 4000 lvl PS class, this class is easy. she says attendance is mandatory but never takes roll. Chung also makes her students do presentations on all the readings.she goes over it once plus the groups, no need to read them before hand. The best part of the class is the simulation. its really fun and interactive. just pay attention to get an A!
Really nice but very hard. Would not recommend taking a class with her.

She tells us a section to read, then forces 3 students to teach the section for her. She then teaches the same section we learned twice already, she is obsolete. She reads her lectures off of a page, and answers questions with questions. Oh and she "misplaced 10% of my score on the midterm," She's nice, and likes IR, but... never again
Extremely hard midterm. Final is online, but also hard.
Willing to discuss most any political science topic with students. Very helpful with papers and a vaguely easy grader. Show up to class and the readings become pretty optional.

Professor Traven gives very interesting and engaging lectures, while staying unbiased and clear.  He does require a lot of reading, but it is pretty basic stuff, and I was able to skip a few of them and not miss a beat.

Very interesting instructor with vast knowledge on the subject matter.  The readings are long and sometimes difficult, but you can get away with skimming.  He is a very reasonable grader, and is always willing to help!

Excellent professor. Spent a lot of time in his office hours. Was very eager to help. Classes were interesting as well- encouraged significant class discussion. The texts he assigned were at times difficult to understand but he made a sincere effort to explain them clearly to us and this was usually successful.

Overall a good guy. Sometimes I disagree with his views, but otherwise he is rather clear about his topics and is amazing at creating ad lib ways of explaining anything that a student doesn't understand.
Polite, and apparently intelligent, but also smug and capricious. I did not care for his grading or class-management style, and he seemed to have a certain ideological agenda.
Great teacher, more concerned about what we learn, so he uses a real easy grading system so we can focus on learning and not just on getting a good grade. Interesting class too
Even though it was a one-hundred level class, it was really interesting. Totally laid back and receptive of his students needs.

Dane was one of the best professors I have ever had at Ohio State. He has very high expectations, thus it is difficult to do well in his class. However, I learned so much from him and he has increased my confidence in my writing skills. He is always available to help, so take advantage of his office hours from day one. Please take this class!

Definitely one of the best instructors at OSU, and he's only a grad student. He had clear, thought-provoking lectures, and was always super helpful. Lots of reading, but it's interesting and worth the read. Really nice guy, genuinely cares about his students. Must go to class, but if you keep up with the material, it'll pay off. Highly recommend!

Extremely passionate about class material, he is always prepared and easy going. He is very engaging and opts for class discussion of material than pure lecture. He genuinely cares about students and when he can't answer a question in class, he will research it then come to class prepared with a response. 1 of the best instructors at OSU-TAKE HIM!!

Dane is a great teacher who genuinely cares about his students. He goes out of his way to help and answer any questions that you may have. He expects his students to work hard so be prepared to work for an A. Although he does require the best of his students, I came out as a much better student and writer once the class was over. Take his classes!

Dane was the best teacher that I have had at OSU. He goes out of his way to be friendly and helpful to students. With this said, he expects the best of you so you can't expect an easy A in the class. If you do the reading and put time into it though you come out a much better student with an A.

Do not enroll in this class if you're expecting an easy A. With that said, Dane is an excellent instructor: approachable, knowledgeable, and an overall good guy. The course is reading heavy, and the material covered can not merely be glossed over. The class is, initially, quite theory heavy as well. However, if you put in work, you'll do well.

Dane is easily one of the best instructors that I have ever had at Ohio State. He is very intelligent, engaging, and had a very effective teaching style. He expects the best from his students, but that shouldn't be a problem if you have a legitimate interest in the course material, do the readings, and participate in class. Take his classes!

Dane is a great professor and I highly recommend ANY class he teaches. With that said, he expects a lot from his students and dishes out quite a work load. You'll come out of this class a much better writer guaranteed. Heavily advised for PS majors (freshman year=best) because it gives background on regions all over the globe. No exams or tbs.

I love Imerman.  He's super nice and very intelligent.  Class is a lot of discussion, which I love.  He's a relatively tough grader but he usually leaves clear criticisms. I've really enjoyed his class.

Class was very helpful, really helped with my writing. It was a lot of work, so don't take this class if you're not interested in policy or improving your writing. But it's a must take for any aspiring political science majors.
Great professor. Gives everyone a chance to voice their opinion. Midterms are a lot of studying, but he gives you everything it will cover. No surprises or tricks. Highly recommend him.

Dane is a fantastic instructor, especially for a class geared toward discussion like this one.  His typical lecture often deals with the readings and then moves toward a discussion by the class.  You will have to think for this class, but if you do the readings and attend class (which is mandatory), you'll get a good grade.
Really helpful teacher. Is knowledgeable and not biased, which is important for Poli Sci. Class is a lot of work, but he helps you a lot.

Lectures were on easy material, but had nothing to do with the quizes and attendence was still manditory.  Spent lots of class time editing other peoples papers but was not worth anything towards my grade.  All the work that was part of the final paper was 50% of the grade but had nothing to do with the in class material.  Poorly structered class.
Tests are hard. You must attend class for the material but not required for grade.

Dane is the best professor I've had.  Straightforward with the lectures which are long but very informative, and includes content that really makes you think as it relates to today's world.  Always helpful with any questions and a quick email response.  Recommend the class for sure.

Always there to help and he responds to e-mails very quickly.  He is SO sexy. which is nice during the boring lectures, but he tries to make them interesting.  If you work hard, you'll get an A. Just go to class and study.  If you're looking for an easy GEC, then I would take 101.  145 actually teaches you things you don't already know.

Dane was a great teacher. He included the class in his discussions to avoid him standing up there and lecturing the entire class. He was very easy to talk to. The tests are fair. If you study for them, you should be ok.
I really loved this class. He made the material interesting and easy to understand. Was very helpful around exam time with extra office hours. I definitely reccommend this class!

this was an AWFUL class and the way that he lectures was BEYOND boring.  I could take 8 caffiene pills before class and still manage to fall asleep.  There were only like 5 assignments that got graded so if you got a bad grade on one of them, you were SCREWED.  Theres no book and his lectures don't make sense. DON'T TAKE THIS CLASS!

Not a bad class, the way he gives grades is rough. Not impossible to get an A/B, but I ended up with a D on the midterm and a C- on the final because it's straight up regurgitation, and thats not my style. However, I had an A on every single other assignment. So if you can handle lots of reading and regurgitating for a low level class, take it.
Amazing teaching ability!  He really knows his material and lectures in a very understandable way.

Really helpful and friendly guy...Do the first reading, which is complex, and really take the time to understand it because it outlines the course. He responds to emails almost instantly. Very nice to see younger professors take an interest in class and not have that bitter post-grad student edge. You know what I'm talking about.

Early on the class is tough and involves reading a hard book, but he helps and it isn't worth much of your grade. Midterm isn't bad, but probably not an easy A. Requires an 8 page paper which is time consuming but not terrible. Don't read anything for the class until after the midterm. It's a waste of your time. Good guy, moderately tough class.
This man is a GREAT professor! I reccomend him to all!
Great instructor, always available for help and responded to emails quickly!

This class was great!  The use of carmen eliminated the need to buy exprensive course packets (every proff should do this!), the readings were interesting, and the papers that we had to write were easy. Imerman is a great instructor.  He genuinely has empathy for his students.  You won't regret taking his courses!
Pu is a nice professor. His class was pretty easy. The lectures aren't exactly exciting but it's still a pretty informative course.
Very helpful and an easy grader. I enjoyed his class a lot.

Professor Pu is a great teacher who is very enthusiastic about the material you learn. The reading isn't very difficult, and though it may seem long, it is very helpful in understanding the concepts learned in class. He is also quite easy, both in his comprehensive midterm and final paper

Prof Pu is an amazing teacher. His 245 class is interesting and extremely stimulating. Definitely knows what he is talking about, and is passionate about it. He often explains abstract materials in an interesting way.  A nice guy and always answers questions after class.  You?ll learn a lot and get a good grade.
Amazing teacher.  Take his class

He knows a ton about the subject matter and Class is fun because he allows for a lot of discussion. Tests are easy if you read over the powerpoints and fill out the study guide he gives you. Definitely recommend
Easy class as long as you use the study guides he gives you and you go to class. Has an accent and reads of the slides but you know what he is talking about

The class was interesting but lectures were very boring. All he did was read off powerpoints that he posts online, and yet he made attendance mandatory. The class itself wasn't very hard, he tells you exactly what is on the final and most of what is on the midterm. There is one presentation that was fairly easy. Okay class, okay teacher.
Very good instructor. Explains the subject well and is very knowledgeable.
Really good instructor. Very clear and intelligible in the material. Highest Recommendation.

As another said, he has an accent but is not hard to understand. He clearly loves the subject and has very organized PowerPoints. He clearly gets excited when there is class discussion; many classes are not "lectures" but rather "discussions." - it's really rather fun.

Great teacher! Very interested in helping students. Very fair grader. Strong Korean accent but decent English speaker. Great powerpoints presentations. Attendance mandatory and bonus given for great attendance. Discuss hot button issues in modern politics. Very interesting. Final paper instead of test, I enjoyed that. Answer lots of questions!
A mediocre professor, but inexplicably rude in all our interactions.

I know most of his scores on here are from a couple years ago but I still can't believe how low they are.  I thought he was an effective professor that went out of his way to help me succeed.  I thought he was pretty clear about what he expected out of us and the difficulty level was fair.

Not a good class.  First half of class is normal, second half is ridiculous.  Content of class changes to stat-based and he doesn't explain any of it.  When asked to explain, he repeats what he just said, nothing more.  Had an A at the midpoint of class, finished with a B- because he could not clarify what he expected of class.
Class is very challenging. Tons of stats, most of which he just breezes through and assumes that you already know how to do. I would not recommend this class or this professor.

Probably one of the worst professors ive ever met. HORRIBLE!!! Seems pretty nice at first but hes really an ****. DONT TAKE A CLASS WITH HIM!!!!!! Thought i had an A the whole time, turns out i missed 3 homework assignments and did bad on the final (even with a B+ on the midterm) and ended with a D?! Gotta be kidding me, save yourselves.
worst professor ever!!!!!!!!!

Don't take 503.  I had an A in elementary statistics going into this class and I couldn't keep up with the statistical/mathematical part of the course because he didn't even come close to adequately preparing people to learn the material.  He also doesn't encourage participation, but when he asks for it, he gets pissed when no one does.

Do not take unless you've taken Stats.  He's nice enough but breezes over semi-difficult statistics and isn't very clear when you ask for clarification.  I also don't recommend taking in the morning...you'll have trouble staying awake.

do not take this class unless you are interested in math/statistics.  there should be a stats pre-req for this class because it can get difficult and i had a stats class prior to taking this one.  he knows his stuff, but expects everyone to be proficient in excel and therefore doesn't offer many examples

The class is both incredibly easy and incredibly boring. He talks about the scientific method for practically the first four weeks of the class.  If you want an easy A take it. Be warned the class drags on. Because there isn't a final the class  is basically irrelevant after the midterm. The midterm feels like a test you would take in high school.

Your grade is based on attendance (10%), essays (45%), and a midterm (45%). No final exam. The TA is an extremely easy grader and just look over the powerpoints before the midterm and you should do fine. Prof White is a little unclear at times but the class was actually pretty interesting.
Black Politics was awesome. If you are in to Black Politics (which I am) you will love this class!!
Political Psych was a pretty interesting class. He's pretty laid back professor and there's not many grades. I would recommend taking his class because it's pretty easy and straight forward.

Professor White says 'right' almost every other word. It is most maddening to sit through a class with someone who is clearly not up-to-date regarding Political Science, uses HIS OWN BOOK in class (conceited much?), and says 'right' in a question form every five seconds (or less!). The grading is VERY easy, but sitting through class was torture.
Ok class. Deals too much with psychology and not enough with politics but Prof wihke isfun.
I actually enjoyed the course but it was easy.

Ismail often does not know what he is talking about and had to ask the class or his TA's a lot of questions. Tests not very well done. Very easy class if you took a high school government class as you will not learn anything new. Very exaggerated New Orleans accent makes him very difficult to understand. Attndence turned out not to be grade factor!

I got an A in the class, but that was almost entirely due to knowledge I had from before I took it.  Mr. White is very disorganized and regularly says incorrect things. On multiple occasions he had to ask his TAs if the info he was saying was correct because he wasn't sure. Additionally, a few exam questions were not covered in class or by the book
Dr. White is entertaining, however I learned a lot more from my TA.

Good class overall. Good professor very tough grader make sure to do all your work to a T. This professor is merciless when it comes to grading papers, tests, you name it. Class lecture is stimulating. He is willing to work with you and shows a genuine interest in your success as a student. COME TO CLASS,posts lectures online,but take notes!
Love this teacher. Very easy to talk to and office hours are extremely helpful when writing the research paper.

Decent teacher.  I little too cool for school, but good overall.  The problems are with his tests.  He provided a review sheet for the midterm but there was a LOT that was on the test that was not on the sheet.  Also, he asks irrelevant questions.  Tough grader and kindof arrogant.

Took this class in Au/2011. One of the best classes ive taken. Dustin is a really cool guy, and brought a lot of energy to each class. Material was interesting too. I didn't read all of the textbook, but he gives you a review sheet before the midterm and final which really helps. 4-5 page paper as well.

He was very good with lectures, kept them interesting, very tough grader though, at times he wants more than he specified for papers making it hard to get an A, participation is required in this class so if your not willing to answer questions and be involved, your grade will suffer, just something to keep in mind.

He was an amazing teacher, who really enjoyed what he was teaching. He is willing to help with anything you need, but you have to actually go to class, and/or read the book to pass the class. Overall, if you are considering this class, he one to take it with

He knows his stuff and is really good at getting it across, so this was that rare OSU course where I actually learned something! The textbooks aren't needed at all, but you will want to read the cases he assigns. He asks tricky multiple choice questions, but he gives TONS of bonus points on quizzes and exams, so it's not that hard to get an A.

Very tough class. I'm a history major, but it was required for my degree. The material is very complex, and I would recommend that you have some sort of familiarity with international law before taking the class. Mandatory quizzes (7) are straight from the material, two midterms that are tough, but fair. The final project is easy.

I was intimidated by the subject matter going into the class, but Professor Nunez made the complex topic of international law accessible and interesting. Lectures were well organized, clear, and engaging. One of those classes were you learn a lot. Readings are mandatory for the quizzes and midterms. Participation is necessary. I highly recommend!

Fernando was very organized and clear and a fair grader. The class can be dull if you are not into International relations or law, but I thought it was very interesting. There are 2 exams and 7 carmen quizzes. It's pretty easy, I definitely recommend this class.

Fernando is an awesome professor. An 'A' is attainable, but you will have to work for it. I recommend this class to anyone interested in law or global problem-solving. You will walk away with tons of knowledge. Midterm and final based off quizzes. DO THE READING AND GO TO CLASS!!!

Loved PoliSci 551, but then again I'm into international law. Fernando explained everything well and if you read the cases you're just fine. Weekly quizzes based off of readings. You have to go to class to get your participation grade. Midterm & final were really easy and totally based on quizzes.
Fernando is great but this class was harder than hell
Excellent professor. Very knowledgeable and clear. Hard class though (don't take it if you're not interested in law)

Teacher was unclear, long winded, and taught at a level far below college-level.  Never knew someone could spend two hours explaining the most basic principles of a Nash Equilibrium or Prisoners' Dilema...  Avoid if at all possible.
Very friendly and helpful.  I enjoyed going to class even if the material was a bit boring.  He gave bonus points on the quizzes and tests which helped make the class easier.
A very nice professor that uses the visual aid of teletubbies.  His quizzes and tests are quite hard so make sure you read!
Class is hard and quizzes are harder. it all works fine if you read before class. fernando is nice and challenging. not sure I enjoyed the class but I did learn a lot
Takes dry material and does a pretty good job of making it interesting. Fair grader, really nice guy, and a pleasure to spend a semester with.

Really cool professor. He cares about his students and as long as you try you should do well. I didn't realize how much I learned in this class until after I took it. A lot of the material I learned has helped me in other courses. Interesting open discussions and writings about cases concerning women.

don't need to read the textbook, he tells you everything important in class. largely based on discussion.  two papers that were more annoying to write than anything.  he's a little all over the place but he's a nice guy and he tries to make this stuff interesting.

He s very sharp and requires the same from his students. Rarely lectures, classes are engaging and interesting discussions. On the down side he assigns absurd amounts of reading nightly and the only grades (3 exams) have little to absolutely nothing to do with what is discussed in class. I feel like he could improve to be a great teacher.
He was knowledgeable about his subject but at times he could be kind of boring. You have to read a whole lot but if you do, then your grade shows it. I'd recommend him.

Class was not easy but if you did the reading and attended lecture you can get a lot from it. Very knowledgable on his topic and told a few funny stories from his work overseas. He was helpful and fair. Don't take if you want a cakewalk of a class.

Awful awful awful teacher!!!  Boring class, boring teacher; you cannot hear half the things he says.  Did not provide notes, you basically get your notes by listening to others in the class.  TONS of reading and it will be the death of you lol  Test were fair/kinda easy and he grades fair.

Go to class. He is very clear and very knowledgeable. He explains everything well and the midterms are cake if you go to class and take good notes. You don't really need to read to do well, unless you have confusion about the material covered in class, but for the most part, everything on the tests is covered in class.  A very quality professor.
This professor was very knowledgable in his field and made everything make sense. He is a great teacher who was straight forward and helps his students greatly.
Good class. Daniel is intelligent and a great mediator of discussions. Class requires A LOT of reading though, often complex theories. Overall though, a very worth-while class.
Daniel is clear, informative, and helpful. The class was fun and easy.
Great Class Knows his stuff

He is very excited about the material and teaching; however, class is not mandatory.  That being said, 95% of the exam is based on the readings.  You receive a review guide with questions that will be on the test in some form.  You MUST read to pass.
Very good class, professor was very into the material. Very difficult class with a lot of reading though.
you are a dependeble teacher

This class was easily one of the best I have ever taken at OSU. Irfan is also probably one of the best teachers here as well; be warned, though, the class is a LOT of work and you must keep up with the reading. If you do, though, you will have an amazing time.

By far the most difficult and rewarding class I have ever taken.  If you are up to date on your reading and willing to participate, lecture is actually FUN, something I have never said about a college course.  I learned more in this class than every other college course I have taken combined.

If you want to be significantly challenged and acquire a reasonably thorough education on Indian politics - this is your class. Expectations are very high. Irfan has that sort of sense of humor which some find unappealing. But I assure if you work hard and deliver, you will find him to be very gracious and helpful.

The class is intellectually stimulating but very challenging. Lazy students who don't appreciate academia will probably fail. My only gripe is that there were many expensive required readings. However, I used the OSU library system to get the books and thus didn't spend a dime. I wish he had just put the readings online though.

Best POLI SCI class I ever took at OSU.  Just sorry I waited to take his class during my last quarter (AU06) because I would have taken more of his courses.  High workload, but high satisfaction if you can hack it.
Terrible.  Spent a crapload on books, spent countless hours reading those books.  Still had to drop his stupid class.  This guy is a joke.  The most arrogant SOB I've ever had.
Best professor at OSU.  If you cannot devote your full attention to this course it will be better if you just don't take it.  You will learn more than you ever have in a class.

Don't take his classes if you're lazy. It's not a class you can slack in and do well. But it's totally worth the effort because you will get a lot out of the class. One of the best classes I've taken at OSU. And he's willing to help you out as much or little as you want, as long as you're willing to seek out the help.

Please look at the other comments. Only take this class if it's your ONLY class and you are willing to read 100+ pages a night. You can't skim, you have to KNOW the material because everyday he literally calls on you to speak up. YOU have to participate. No ducking and hiding. It's very tough. I had to drop it.
Hmm...How to describe without using profanity???

Irfan was probably the most arrogant, smug professor that I've ever had in my college career.  Take my advice, avoid him at all costs.  Do you really want to read hundreds of pages each night?  Even if you do all of the reading many still fail his tests.  He's just a smug, arrogant piece of crap.
You have to work... but it will be the most worthy class you will ever take.

Assigns insane amounts of reading, be prepared to spend all of your time doing work for his class and abandon your other classes.  Doesn't realize people have OTHER classes to study for in addition to his!

Extremely arrogant and only helpful to a certain few.  Assigned in excess of 1000 pages of reading before the first midterm.  I read nearly every page and after the midterm I was told I needed at least a B+ to get a D- in the class.  Needless to say I dropped.  Remember though, he's right, and you're generally wrong!

i could've gotten the same grade (B+) without spending $300 on books. attendance wasn't helpful so i didn't go. professor isn't helpful, so don't seek it out. just don't take the class; watch born into brothels. it's basically the same thing.
the reading load is ridiculous.... very hard grader not recommended at all

Irfan was exceptionally helpful and interesting. The reading load was a bit much, but at least it was all on topic. i enjoyed lectures a great deal because he allowed for much discussion. He is a good professor and it was a good class - if you can keep up.

Irfan is a great professor.  He teaches with a lot of logic and talks through complicated problems.  Always helpful, realistic, enthusiastic, and most of all knowledgible.  I highly recommend him. I've taken 2 classes with him now.

I took his first year honors course when he taught at University of Michigan.  He is quite preachy and full of himself, but also one of the few profs I remember 5 years later.  Is proud of his infamy for giving unfairly low grades.

best class i've taken at osu, bar none. very interesting readings and great discussions. this class is meant for people who really want to learn this is by no mean an easy A. it is extremely challenging with a ridiculous amount of readings but worth taking.

Ifran has a unique way of teaching.  You will do copious amounts of reading, and then he will moderate a discussion. Having said that, I didn't attend much and only read the night before the final.  I got a B-.  The other guys are whiners.

Irfan's a good guy, honestly.  but it's ohio state, not harvard.  I eventually got used to reading 300 pages a week, but the midterm was downright impossible for anyone with an IQ under 140.  Effort amounted to nothing.  The geniuses did well, the rest got an "E".  I had to drop.  A few written assignments before the midterm would be quite helpful

One of the few teachers left around OSU who believes challenging students is what they are here for. You aren't paying out the ass to get classes you can skip and get an A, you're in college last time I checked. Classes like his make you a better thinker, reader, writer... just keep your attitude positive and be prepared to READ.

There are tough professors and then there is Irfan. You will learn a lot from him and this class. It's definitely worth taking this class. This class was a paradigm shift for me in a lot of ways. However, BE PREPARED TO WORK VERY HARD!!! Take this class when you're taking a light load.
No Comments
This course is a lot of work, but worth it.  Very objective and intelligent, a rare combination in today's political world.  You can learn how to save the world, the question will be, do you want to?
avoid this guy at all costs
No Comments

I found this class very interesting and I learned a lot. There is a lot of reading. If you take this class expect to learn a lot and work hard. This is not any easy A but he will help you if you ask for help.

He does well in making his students intellectual on the topics of development and growth. True Poli Sci students will not have a problem, be sure to take when other course work is light.If willing to challenge yourself, this class will set you up for any Poli Sci class taken later.Do the readings and MEET WITH HIM TO EXPRESS intrest and do well.

I will go ahead and agree will the previous comments about the readings.  Many times I would try to do them but I would fall asleep in the middle.  I like the way the actual class is set up, a disscussion where he calls on you and wants your thoughts and to see if you did the reading.  He would not tell our class what he wanted on a paper.

Irfan is the most arrogant person I have ever known.  He thinks he is too good for Ohio State and gives the students an incredibly unrealistic amount of reading.  If you're an intellectual snob go ahead and take his class.  Otherwise, save yourself the trouble and take a course from a prof who actually cares about his students.
The reading is far too much for any class. I had to buy 8 books and a 600 page course packet. His grading is pretty tough. Expects you to have nothing else in your life but his class.
No Comments

As for the pompous person underneath me, even those of us who are in college to learn something still don't have to like Irfan.  Vague theoretical topics and intellectual mumbo jumbo can make you feel like you are an intellectual but that doesn't make you one nor make the class worth anything.

If you're in college for an education and you are willing to put in the effort that you should be regardless, take a class from him.  The people that dislike him are those that are in college to do something other than learn.
I ended up having to take zooloft to make it thru this class.  The readings for this class was unrealistic.  I like poli sci before I took this class now I hate it.
The Irfman's not fun.

Irfan believes in two things-hard work and no sleep. So if you're opposed to either of these, save yourself from a quarter of hell and take the regular poli sci class. This said, Irfan expects ALOT but it is rewarding in the end to feel that you've been intellectually challenged.
He expects a lot out of his students and the class is really hard, but he's the best professor i have had and he is very available for questions as long as you dont wait until the last minute.
If you want to be an intellectual, this is a must-have class. If you want an easy A, spare the rest of us and don't take it.
thinking about his class makes me want to throw up

Irfan is the best professor I ever had.  The class is tough, real tough, but you come out of it twice the person you were before you took it.  If you go to his office hourse he is super helpful and it always there for you.  It's been over a year since I took his class and we still keep in touch.

He can barely speak English, and also thinks he is the most amazing thing on this Earth.  Don't take his honors 100 poly sci unless you want to take an advanced economic analysis course.  Papers subjects are very very unclear.  Sucks.

Irfan is difficult, but stick with it! You'll be thankful at the end!  He expects a lot of you, but he makes you think at a higher level.  There's a lot of reading, but you will benefit from the abundance of new knowledge.
Very easy class, but EXTREMELY boring. Two horribly long essays, in addition to a midterm and quizzes. Take if looking for easy A. If you want something interesting, look elsewhere.

This has been my least favorite class taken at OSU. Classes are long and boring,John is a HORRIBLE lecturer, and generally only accepts answers that directly correlate with his own opinions. Readings are boring and dense, and the final is really a 5-6 page essay in disguise. If you have ANY other choice, don't take this class!

John was a great instructor. This course is not for slouches you get what you put into it . If you consistently are absent from class you will not make it. John is very helpful so don't be afraid to ask questions he'll guide you in the right direction.
Mr Oates is an extremely nice guy who cares about his students. I talked to him outside of class a handful of times and he doesn't hesitate to do extra work if he isn't fully learned on a subject.
So subjective when it comes to grading, tests are all essay with no rhyme or reason as to what grade you will receive. BORING class and learned nothing.

Real nice guy, knowledgable and interested in his area. He's hilarious and doesn't even know it. Class is average difficulty; not very hard subject matter but a lot of reading, as expected. Most reading material is covered in class. Very apolitical and often plays devils advocate for both sides. Willing to help students.

Though I did well, he unfortunately did not make my dreams come true. His grading can be odd at times, though he is willing to explain his rationale. He generally teaches from a powerpoint. Easier to talk to on a one-on-one level than class. The actual classroom experience is very average.

Most of his topics are presented in an interesting manner, and he uses video, audio, as well as newspapers to teach most of the themes. If you pay attention and even do just the important readings you can get an A- easily. Is a very objective grader too, is fairly apolitical during debates, encouraging all kinds of views.
Brilliant Professor, makes the most dreary stuff interesting. Biggest crush I've had.

Best teacher i have ever had in all my years of schooling. I have never had so much fun while learning... and i have actually learned a ton. Not only about the material but about myself as well. I would recommend her to anyone.

Just plain incredible. Makes political theory relatable to everyday life, and even makes it fun (which isn't an easy task). One of a kind individual. Really funny in class and laid back. Makes you think for yourself. Also, by far the biggest crush I have ever had on a teacher/instructor in my entire life. Just amazing.

By far my favorite class ever taken at OSU. She definitely made me love political science even more. Extremely helpful- would literally do anything for her students. Taught her class based on individual students and really took time to get to know each of her students. Doesnt expect alot but does expect quality work which is fair. Take her class!
Great class. Definitely on the easy side but if you are interested in getting into some of the more nuanced parts of the class there are many opportunities to do so through papers etc.

Nina is absolutely amazing by making theory fun and easy to understand.  No texbook is used as all HW (15 pages max) is all online.  She was extremely helpful and funny; definitely one of the best teachers at OSU!
Great teacher! Keeps class interesting. She's quite witty and makes tough material graspable. I would suggest taking her section if possible!

He knows a lot about IR, however this class was the worst PS classes I've taken at OSU. The Game is cool but it does nothing for your grade. The prompts for the papers didn't give a clear picture of what was expected. You need to ready 80+ pages per week for the reading quizzes and the class average was less than 60%. He curves it, so its an easy B

Roughly 80 pages of reading a week. Pop quizzes throughout. Three exams. First exam had an in-class and out of class portion. In-class was a long-form essay. Out of class was a four page paper. Second exam was a four page paper. Third exam focused on the causal logics of the readings. You'll come away with vast knowledge if you put the time in.

Professor Herrmann is a really great professor. He knows everything about IR and has experience like no other professor I know of. He has a tendency towards being curt and dismissive to students who want to take any time outside of lectures to talk. If you're looking for help, don't be offended by this. If you can talk to him, you'll learn a lot.

No doubt that Rick knows the material like the back of his hand. However, the lectures have little to no structure. Actively take notes to try to piece it all together. Exams are difficult and hard to prepare for. Definitely read the book before class; he likes to randomly call on people. In-class simulations were fun. Not an easy-A, but an easy-B.

There is little structure to lectures and office hours do not prove helpful. Material is presented in the form of incoherent rants. The syllabus was not an accurate preview for this roller-coaster ride.

good lecturer, but I have find him biased individual.sometimes his tone comes out to resemble State Department spokesperson. otherwise great selection of the Academic journals(mostly current). I would encourage anyone who has serious interest of IR or U.S foreign policy to take this class with him.

Great professor, really knowledgeable on the subject. Its a great class if you're into current events and international relations. The game simulation is really unique experience and a lot of fun. I would highly recommend taking this class, definitely one of the most fun PS classes I've taken.

Herrmann is a very knowledgeable guy, worked in the State Dept and clearly has had practical experience with his subject. Still, he seems to genuinely enjoy teaching. Get to participate in a fun diplomatic "game" in second half of class. Midterm and final require lots of preparation, reading. Difficult class, but worth it.

Class was a very interesting, although it was pretty much impossible to take notes during the lectures as he just stood up there and spoke freely.  He has a lot of experience and deserves a lot of respect for his knowledge on the subject. At the end of the class you play a foreign policy gamet that is a lot of fun.  The exams are no joke.

A mess of a prof, no direction in lecture, impossible to take notes and study for exams. The only fun/useful part of the whole class is the strategy game you play the second half. But its in a building that is RIDICULOUSLY far away and there is no indication of this when you sign up.

Absolutely loved this class and this man! It was so interesting and he's incredibly smart. You should really go to class and if you get into the assignments, you can come out of the class with vast knowledge on the subject matter. I would even take it again someday (and might audit it..). Definitely take it if you like international relations!

Very challenging professor... the class is graded strictly on how everyone else in the class performs in the class... the exams are very difficult because you need to write exactly what he wants you to know- just do the readings and reread everything before the exams and go to all of the study groups and you'll be fine

Herrmann is a fantastic professor. He mixes good textbook information with current events with his own research incredibly well and does so in an interesting fashion. Be prepared to earn your grade if you want an A. The midterm and final are a **** to prepare, but it's very possible to do well. Don't slack off on the reading, or you'll regret it.

Like the comments below, Herrmann is an incredible professor with as much experience and knowledge as you'd ever expect to find at OSU. His class is very professional and he treats the students like adults. That means he expects a lot from you. It's a great class, just make sure you leave plenty of time to do the work, cause there's a lot of it.

about as close to real world political science experience as you can get in a classroom. this guy is top notch in experience, knowledge etc and expects a lot from his students. very direct and open to student concerns, consider yourself lucky if he still has matt scherebath (sp?) as his TA.
TAKE HIS CLASSES!  He is the most wornderful professor I've found in the Poli Sci Department.

He's a good teacher who used to serve as a UN Diplomat under old Bush.  His foreign relations class is excellent, he's very dedicated to helping students, and his real life experiences make for a very intersting and informative class.  Wish he taught more

I think the Department's high placement in the national rankings has a lot to do with Dr. Herrmann. I'm in graduate school now, and his courses were bar-none the best preparation I received as an undergrad. He's the real thing--  don't waste his time.

Wonderful Professor.Very smart,very friendly and helpful.Will bend over backwards to help students and while his class is not easy,you'll learn a lot about foreign policy decision making. Great class.
AWESOME PROF!!! One of the best at OSU.
Full of knowledge. Make you want to learn more.
This class was definately =not= an undergraduate class. Very hard, wouldn't recommend him as a professor. The guy is wicked smart, though. Very knowledgable.
Herrmann is the MAN! He is incredibly knowledgable and well-connected- take his classes if you can get in them.
He is  great teacher.  Very interesting and knowledgeable
Dr. Herrmman is one of the best in the department. Jump on any class he teaches.
GREAT INTERACTIVE CLASS...TAKE IT

Steven Beale is SUCH s great lecturer!! He assigned a lot of reading in his American Foriegn Policy class. It was never vital that we read them so I would recomend skimming them and it would help you get a half to whole letter grade better. The tests were pretty challenging so make sure to study for them because it's a HUGE part of the grade.
Nothing bad to say. He's a good teacher and knows what he is talking about. Will help and answer any questions you'll have. If I can I want to take another class with him!

His syllabus was a little unclear, but I think it's because he's still new to teaching. However, that's the only critique I had because this class was great. Two papers and two tests. Study the slides he posts online and you should get an A on the tests easily. He also posts readings online so no book needed! Steven is smart, young, and cute!

He is a fairly easy grader, but is extremely boring. You really only need to go to class on quiz days and just review the PowerPoint's ahead of time. He isn't very clear on paper revisions either. Overall he isn't a bad teacher just hard to pay attention to.
Great!

He was a fairly new professor, and a tough graded. The class material was interesting but he did not always make it the easiest to understand. When it come to papers his responses were a bit vague and hard to understand what he wanted from you in the next paper.

Duska was a blast. Class was always entertaining and it ended up being my favorite for the quarter. He definitely relates better to students and the topics covered were really interesting. He always promoted discussion. I would email him questions at 3 in the morning and receive a response instantly. Outstanding educator in every way.

Like someone else said, he's a weird dude. He often goes on weird tangents about things like spirit animals and bears. And he talks a ton about Canada. But he's a good dude. He's really helpful during office hours. He was really helpful in helping me make an outline for my paper when I was completely lost on what to do. I totally recommend him.

An extremely interesting professor who gives  entertaining lectures. Seems to really know his critical security studies stuff. No exams but a lot of writing. Kind of nit-picky but fair grading. He's really far to the left but accepts different viewpoints. Good discussion.
Easy class. Strange guy but he was really good. The exams are take home but they are insane.
One of the most interesting lecturers at the University. Had a great time attending classes. Will help you with anything throughout the quarter.
doesn't take attendance. long take-home exams but pretty easy except for crazy multiple choice questions. gave me an extension without any questions. really easy-going.
Take-home exams. Talks a bit fast. But really nice guy.

Professor Wallace is an awesome professor. There is a ton of reading for the class, but if you go to every class he goes over all of the signifiant readings. Take really good notes on everything he says and you will know enough about the readings to reference them when needed on exams. Short paper at the end of the course. Very interesting class.

Professor Wallace is a easy going professor, not to say that he doesn't demand anything from his students, but he isn't that hard. Go to Class! I didn't do much of the readings my second half of the quarter but managed to do very well because I studied. He has lived in China is very approachable and very willing to help

Professor relies solely upon the readings to teach but gives a participation grade for the class. 75% of the class is the between two exams. Expect to memorize which of twelve authors said anything specific about China. Your grade will depend on it.
Dr. Wallace is great. He demands a lot but is fair and balanced.

Great Professor.  Extremely knowledgeable, engaging, and interesting.  Changed teaching habits frequently to engage the class and was very interactive.  I would definitely recommend take this class.  Great readings and interesting topics!
will help students if needed, easy a
Very nice, however her lectures are all discussion and can be boring. The exams are pretty easy (she tells you exactly what will be on them), and the class isn't very hard.

Shabad is a bit of a mixed bag. On one hand, she's not that great a lecturer and over assigns readings. On the other, she has an encyclopaedic knowledge of East European politics. Both classes I've been in, she shows a movie. Clearly defined workload (two essay exams, 10-15 pages of writing). Only take if the subject matter interests you.
Rambles during lecture, doesn't facilitate effective in-class discussions, no real course structure.

VERY Difficult and unpleasant person to deal with; does not answer emails on a regular basis; I received an A and did not find the class to be terribly difficult grade-wise; although there was a lot of reading, none of it was very difficult- mostly one-liner articles.

Very advisable to skip reading if you want a decent grade, but not if you want to understand the material.  Will not give out A's, but will arbitrarily hand out A-'s.  Don't know of anyone who did worse than a B, so, if you're comfortable with a glass ceiling on A's, a good class.  EXTREMELY tiring though, not sure if it was her fault or the subj.

Don't waste your time reading the huge course packet she makes you buy. She picks terrible readings and doesn't hold you acocuntable for knowing the content. The class is ok...but she's just not a very likable lady.

I pity anyone who has to take a(nother) class with this woman- she's the worst; I don't mind a hard challenging professor, but she's terribly unpleasant to deal with; she always has a nasty attitude and is off-putting in the extreme; talks down to students.

Her lectures are generally disorganized and boring.    I wouldn't recommend saying much-she usually misunderstands what students say.  However, she is a knowledgeable instructor and a fair grader.  Here's a tip:  if she starts shouting, she's saying something she wants you to write down.
Terrible class. Incredibly boring and she expects you to know a ton about international politics coming in. Avoid this class with her at all costs.
No Comments

There was this one class of hers I found really interesting but it must have been a fluke. To sum it up: assumes a lot of prior knowledge, you'll get really good at pretending to be awake, gives all essay tests, assigns readings you shouldn't do, and assigns a lot of papers. I got a B+!

The class was eye-crossingly dull but easy.  She isn't very inspiring or entertaining.  She has a boring NPR-esque tone that puts you to sleep.  She talks in long incoherant sentences much like John Kerry.  Reader Beware!
She knows her stuff.  Class is challenging, interesting.
GET AWAY
Avoid.
THinks post communism should be our lives 24/7 unrealistic expectations and little clarity......the worst poli sci prof I have had
No Comments
Very mean. Likes to hear herself talk a lot. Don't publically disagree w/ her.
No Comments
Knows subject matter.  Likes discussions.

Basically just stood up and lectured, then tested over pretty specific things he mentioned. Take good notes, but don't bother reading the book (do go to class though). Vague on what he wants from you in your paper, so just go for it, he's a pretty nice guy and not too harsh with his grading.
Only gripe with him is, he assigns projects and reports with very little guidelines, then penalizes you for not following his "guidelines"
Nice guy, comes prepared, tries to keep it amusing, took his 201 class.
His class wasn't good, his grading was off, and his teaching technique was lacking, besides that he is a cool guy but he really needs to re-evaluate his teaching.

Del ROCKS!  He is refreshing to have as a teacher.  He has a sense of humor, which is highly lacking here.  I would laugh when he would briefly go off course.  But he always got back on course.  He tries to get feedback from the class and he is very helpful.  As long as you read the materials and go to class you will do fine.  Simply a good guy!
He is not good....That's all!!
Del is better than you, trust me. Just learn to accept it.
Del is a wonderful person.  He is always willing to help and even comes to out of class study sessions.  I will miss him as he goes back to Canada.
Del is a fantastic human being, and he knows his****
I Love Del
I hate stats. Del was cool though.
are u serious, this dude was handing out assignments not even relevant to class.

Required participation, points daily for "one comment a day," but will be lenient as he "understands some students have a harder time speaking up." This is complete **** as he favors students. I literally attended every class and commented around 50% of the time; ended up still failing because of participation.
It was a decent class. He tends to picks some favorites in the class at the beginning, but it improves a bit as the class progresses. If you take a class of his, be ready to write A LOT of papers.

He's a grad student, and I unf. got the first class he ever taught. You can definitely tell. He only lectures, no slides/anything.  The papers due every week are only 1-2 pages, which I have no problem with, but he's awful when grading!!! It's just not a class I would recommend.  The only positive I have to say is that he'll email you back quickly.
Lacked all people skills. Material was clear, but grades seems to be handed out arbitrarily.  Readings assigned were useless.

Great online class.  Austin is a great lecturer (funny too) and genuinely wants students to succeed.  Open-book/open-notes exams.  Most info is on the lectures so make sure you take good notes.  Quiz questions are repeated on exams so make sure you know what you missed!

(online course) responded really quick to e-mails, notes and lectures were fairly easy to digest. You get a good sense of what the midterm and final are like from the weekly quizzes. Fairly laid-back, funny guy.

Mr. Carson's lectures are very interesting and the class participates in them as well! Attendance isn't required, but everyone has to answer a question one day in class at random. If you are not there you will lose points. There is a final and midterm with id's, short essays, and a long essay. There also is a group project and presentation you do.

Class was taught really well. Kept political opinions to a minimum and had a good balance between lectures and class room discussion. Exams were fair. Although he didn't take attendance, he had creative ways of making sure you were in class- whether it be an exam question or your day that you were supposed to "ask a question." Highly recommend!
Overall a great, friendly, and interesting professor.

Corrine is a personable professor who is extremely knowledgeable about politics, particularly relating to gender. If you do the work and go to class you should do well. She can sometimes go off on tangents, and she's sarcastic at times but in general very nice and engaging. I would recommend this course.

Awesome professor, if you don't take this class you are missing out. She plays Steve Colbert and Jon Stewart in class and she is also a hilarious/brilliant teacher. Actually cares about students which is a rarity at OSU. If you read the articles, participate, and try hard you should do well. This is the most fun poli sci class I have ever taken!

Corrine is a great professor, possibly my favorite for my major being political science. She really is passionate about the subject matter and with her being young, she projects material in a way you can better understand. No textbook, really nice. Even brought us doughnuts and coffee for last class considering it was a small class. Definitely rec.

She is a good professor, her lectures are long and boring at times but political science isn't the most interesting subject. She is very helpful in office hours. Her tests are long, but  they're multiple choice. The tests are based on understanding the content not memorization. It's not an easy GE, so take only if needed to.
good

This class was way too hard. First I'm an international studies PS major not american politics PS and I'm not from ohio, but she still expected us to already understand not just the national election process but the specific laws, procedures, and candidates of Ohio. I worked harder & got a lower grade here than in my two other 4000 PS classes
Uses too many videos when homework is focused on reading. Clarification in class about readings should be pushed.  Was hoping for more from this class.

Women in politics...Strict on attendance, iffy grader on exams, allows you to ask about grades but reserves the right to lower them if she sees fit, lectures are semi-interesting, no text book to buy,group presentation large part of grade.

Jessy is a fairly good lecturer. Class can get a bit boring but overall she's down-to-earth, interested in what she's teaching, and tries to use a lot of videos. There's a quiz every class but it's not as bad as it sounds. Midterm is straightforward. Topic is interesting. Reading is not overwhelming.
Class is focused on writing a research paper. Nick is a difficult grader on papers but he offers a ton of feedback and will help you improve.

Nick is a pretty cool guy. The midterm is pretty easy. He tends to grade pretty hard when it comes to papers. It is one of those classes where it is incredibly easy to get a B but you have to work really hard/be a liberal to get an A
He is very helpful and understanding, all you really have to do is attend class and read usually short articles he gives you and you'll get an A. Highly recommended.

Horrible class. Used his students for his own research purposes. Gave the most vague instructions for papers and docked off points for no reason. Horrible exam formatting and don't even get me started on the reading. SO MUCH READING. Terrible instructor and would NOT recommend

Josh was a mediocre teacher at best. Assigns so much reading that you can't realistically keep up with it , it's extremely boring too. Gives the most general directions on papers and docks off points because you couldn't read his mind to format it how he wanted. Very dry lecturer and apparently his attendance is mandatory now. Would not recommend.

He's funny, and he definitely has a passion for his subject, but there is an enormous amount of reading. You will never have a day where you do not need to read an article for this class and they are not short articles. He does enjoy in-class group work that gets tedious, but it's not the worst thing in the world.
Keeps class interesting. Harsh grader if you OBVIOUSLY do not put effort into your papers. Still fair and goes out of his way to make sure you understand the material. Definitely recommend him.

I took his class because it was all that fit in my schedule, but I was pleasantly surprised.  If you do the readings and put in the effort he appreciates it and your grade will reflect it.  There is lots of reading, but it isn's as dry as other poly sci classes.  I would take another one of his classes again!

Horrible class. SO much reading and he is very vague about EVERYTHING. Plays stupid games in class that have nothing to do with what we're learning. Horrible sense of humor. Overall horrible class. Don't take
She was a great teacher and kept the class very enjoyable. Open to all opinions. Definitely recommend her to anyone who is interested in Politics or needs to get the GEC.
I enjoyed her class and I have limited interest in the subject. Her tests were right from the notes.
Really nice teacher and explains the subject well. Makes class enjoyable to go to. I definitely recommend her to anyone who is a polysci major.

I don't know where all the positive comments are coming from, Lewis is the worst prof I've had at OSU.  Her class will bore you to tears and I learned 50 times more about campaigns and elections in my high school gov class.  This is a total joke for a 500 level class and an embarrassment to what is otherwise a brilliant department.

Really boring class, all lectures. Super super nice lady but very Republican and when questioned about things, she would get confused and would just ask the class instead of really answering it. Has good intentions but doesn't come off very intelligent. Cool life stories though but very boring class
Really good prof. She really knows what she's talking about, and is genuinely interesting in helping you understand also.
Easy class, just show up. Dr. Lewis is a very good professor, she knows what she's talking about and has a ton of experience in politics.

If you're already well versed on the basics of the American political system then this class isn't for you.  Class consists of her taking what the book says and tying it to her own life experiences.  There is a largely partisan (R) slant to the class in regards to opinion and guest speakers.  Overall easy and boring.

Her problem was that she had such boring lectures that everyone hated going to the class.  I thought it was interesting and informative.  We had to do a paper but she grades that easily.  SHe has pretty simple essay tests.  I would say that she is a pretty good overall teacher, if you need the class.
Poly Sci 100
Very nice lady, easy to talk to, and knows her stuff because she has lived it

Dr. Lewis always incorporates her life experience of lobbying or working with other politicians to the class, which not only makes it more interesting, but gives you an amazing contact for future internships, etc.
No Comments
She brings real world experiance to the class.  Can get a bit boring at times, but her stories are fascinating and always willing to help you.

Scott is a great teacher. His lectures are organized and easy to understand. He is always around to help. Statistics was super easy to learn with him teaching it. Oh and he is probably the best looking teacher at ohio state

Pretty cool guy. Explains the equations in the class to the class's satisfaction. Few lengthy homework assignments but beneficial for the exams. Highest Recommendation. Note* This class counts as both your Theory (For Polysci Majors) and your GEC Math credit.

I do not know who said this professor was good, but he is terrible.  He is extraordinarily **** and gives the males frequently lower grades than females.  Moreover, he does not care to clarify himself, and does not care at all for you.  If you take this class, be prepared to learn EVERYTHING out of the book and hope you make no mistakes.

I was forced to take 485 for Data Analysis GEC credit, but Scott fortunately turned out to be an extremely insightful instructor and got me through the course. He does a great job at making the statistics portion of the class clear and approachable. Too bad he's leaving for the University of Tennessee this summer; OSU should miss him!

Having no previous knowledge about statistics, I came to this subject matter with many worries, and it turned out to be a true challenge - demanding much dedication, patience, and review. However, the key factor of my success in this course was the instructor. Scott was crystal-clear, straight forward, and an overall sharp teacher. Great experience

A really chill guy who sincerely wants students to do well. He wants to play an active part in students education. Classes aren't mandatory, but unless you have prior experience with statistics it can be helpful to go. Even though reading isn't mandatory, it is SUPER helpful. If you put in the effort there is no reason not to get an A.

It's a tough subject, but Scott is very good at explaining it overall.  You don't need to read the textbook but you will need it for assignments.  Study for the midterm and final and you should be fine!  He's young and pretty good looking too :-)
very easy A and fun prof
No Comments
He's just wonderful. The program he uses is easy to understand and he has great, relevant examples. He even brings in polish donuts on fat tuesday!

Good professor- makes the class as interesting as he can- considering statistics is boring in itself! really helps any student who needs it; he's funny, young, and really understands what its like to still be a student (unliek most professors). definitely recommend him!

This guy is awesome, but boring. he keeps it real, if you want an A, you can get one. does not throw anything random at you. easy A, i mean i got an A and i'm rather dumb. Good luck fellow students of higher education

Wyplosz is a grad student and this very clear to see as some days he seems very hurried and frantic. But over all he is a great teacher and is always happy to answer questions and try to ensure that the student is taking what they want from the class. He is clearly devoted to political science although maybe not comparative politics.

Clement is witty and very intelligent. However, he's fairly awkward and pretty arrogant. He's French, so listening to him about his past was fun, but he always made jokes about Americans.
