They were pretty harsh sometimes, and I'm pretty sure he meant them. I learnt a lot, but you have to do all the readings (A LOT) to really get something out of it

He isn't terrible but the class could be so much better. Tries to have a discussion based class which is tough when no one cares. Assigns a ton of reading but seems to grade pretty easy and has a nice french accent.
expect to read around 100pgs a week, plus a book during the quarter. Very dry and boring to listen too, and I normally enjoy listening to teachers lecture.

This teacher is terrible - makes you memorize a battles/wars that take place and you must know the specific dates, who took part, and identify on the map where it is. I though that memorization was for lower level classes. I took a war class prior to this one and its very clear that this guy can't teach b/c the other professor taught us well. LAME!

So, if you really pay attention in the class, you won't have any problems at all with the test. She goes over EVERYTHING in detail. The problems I have with her: she has a tendency to be really condescending to students during class. She acts somewhat childish at times when students displease her. I think this discourages many people.

While she has a tendency to repeat herself, she only repeats the most important info. The class is easy and relatively interesting if you like polisci. Reading the textbook is important as most of the test information comes from material that is discussed in class after the assigned readings.

Decent teacher, tendency to repeat herself often (for good or for worse), classes can be EXTREMELY boring due to this.  Class is very easy however, with the quizzes/tests directly taken from class notes
A Great and helpful Teacher. He genuinely cares whether or not the student has a grasp on the material. Phenomenal teacher
Very intelligent and very helpful. Still my favorite class I have taken in college.

This teacher is very difficult and not compassionate.  She seems more concerned with making her tests difficult.  She is highly interested in her topic, but is not very good at making sure her students actually learn the content.  Her tests are not a fair way of assessing knowledge. She won't easily admitt her own mistakes.

This class was challenging but appropriately designed for a 500 level course.  The analytical thinking and ancillary skills strengthened through the coursework were as valuable as the subject matter focused on during class.  Organization and preparation for both the homework and tests were integral for successful grades.

Terrible class.  Lectures give you nothing you can't learn out of the book.  Tests are via carmen and are WAY too long.  I type quickly and still struggled to finish them.  The difficulty wasn't too bad but it was the length of the tests and her merciless grading that made the class unbearable.
Sadly she left OSU for a job in Japan. Otherwise, great GTA and class!
Very knowledgeable and helps improve your writing by a lot. I would definitely recommend taking her class.

Nothing very difficult about this class.  Sarah tried to engage students, but the material does not always relate or appeal to students; a common issue in 200 level classes.  I basically did nothing and wound up with a B+.  Anyone giving one iota of effort should finish no worse than did I. If you're PolSci, might as well take it.

Not sure why everyone thinks this class is so hard, maybe it depends on the T.A. Anyway, I highly recommend some kind of recording device for this class, as lectures consist entirely of him talking. Not the most enthralling class, but if you are pre-law I would seriously consider taking his section of this course. You will learn quite a lot.
Professor Slotnick is extremely knowledgeable. The class is challenging because he assigns a huge breadth of reading and his exams ask specific questions. Very popular class among pre-law students.
Best professor I have ever had

Pretty intelligent guy, but kind of an ****!  The reading was intense but most of it wasnt too bad as far as content goes.  I had judicial politcs and i got an A- but i worked my ass off for it.  If your up to it, id say take the class. Oh, and if you are a girl, he's a real****so get ready to brown nose for you're grade.

I was told that I was "not college material" presumably because I did not echo the liberal mantra.  I dropped the class for fear of my grade.  I am now an attorney in a large, sophisticated Ohio law firm.
That reading was ridiculous!  Everything else wrong in the class pales in comparison to the fact that nobody could ever read that much.
DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS !!!!

Took a class on constitutional law w/him. Hardest class I took in my life. Had to read 200 pages a night for a 500-level, 5-hour class! Buddy, this ain't law school! I am a 3.8 maj. student and get great grades but the work we had to do was just ludicrous

How the heck does he grade? He is also very liberal, it is sickening. The material in the course is pretty straight forward, but the exams are very hard, if you get out of the class with a C consider yourself lucky.
Getting an A would be miraculous with this guy.  Way too hard to follow.  In lecture, you think you understand what's going on, but when test time rolls around, it's like a foreign languange.
No Comments
Class was long and boring and the prof. although intelligent had a completely illogical system of grading.
Class was pretty difficult. E is pretty smart, very wordy, but there's some good information. Lots of readings required. Difficult to take notes.
Good teacher, very knowledgeable, but grading procedures are completely unfair.
No Comments
Has shown up to maybe 4 out of all the classes does not give notes, just rambles
Easiest Online Class Ever!! Everything was online including both exams. No Writing assignments just weekly online quizzes and 2 exams. There is supplemental quizzes, but they were easy.

Even though attendance isn't mandatory you should attend because at least once and starting the 8th week twice a week, you have group debates in front of class. Your attendance is 20% of your overall grade, and your group and Vanessa grades you! The midterm was a lot of writing but doable! Read the book!!!!
not understanding in the least bit

Professor Kumar was not good, at all. Class wasn't hard but I struggled thru lecture staying awake. He reads off of PP. When he asks a question if nobody knows the historical background he will move on and you'll never know the answer. Very inconsistent grader on midterms. Final paper was not specific at all, easy once you start but very confusing

This class is not as bad as everyone says it is. Yes the lectures are boring since they are just powerpoints that largely regurgitate the readings, but the exam method is extremely fair 10 questions, pick 5 to answer and the final paper isn't "unclear" if you actually talk to him about it, its actually pretty easy. Just make sure to read and attend
Not helpful at all, class run off of powerpoints that dont make sense. better off staying home and reading the book. DO NOT TAKE

Terrible class. Kumar is incomprehensible.  Lectures taught directly off of powerpoints, which had bad grammar and rarely made sense.  Unclear about expectations, didn't respond to emails and was never around for office hours. Avoid him. On top of it, he wasn't familiar with the content. Frequently brought students to tears of frustration in class.

Worst Professor. Did better on my midterms by not attending class and staying in my dorm reading the textbook. The class is nowhere as insightful as the textbook, which in itself should put him out of a job. Attendance grade was a joke and final prompt was so vague, writing it was mind numbing

This guy was terrible flat out. The midterms were based on the book but we never discussed the book in class?? The best was the final though. He had no way of explaining what he wanted the paper to be about just an extremely vague topic of following a newspaper story, and one girl was brought to tears because of her confusion and stress. Dont take

Pretty unclear about exactly what he expected us to know for the tests and how to go about writing the final paper.  Readings are long and tuff to read.  Also there are so many conflicting theories and he takes ideas from random readings so often that if you aren't on top of things it's easy to have no idea what's going on.

I have to agree with the last rating. The readings were ridiculous and the professor did little to clarify. The lectures barely helped with the readings. Read articles 5 to 6 times in order to be able to answer random in-depth questions on mid-term and quizzes. I do not recommend.

Worst class ever. Lecture was useless and boring and generally turned into two or three students arguing over politics. He is very condescending and not helpful at all! He gave very little instructions for assignments and didn't seem to understand or care when people were totally lost. I dreaded this class.

I'm posting just because I don't think the other person who posted was particularly fair. It's not an easy class but he's been fair. He has an in-class midterm which he grades fairly and a long final paper. Topics and classes are interesting if students are involved not just sitting like bumps on logs.
Was not helpful if you could not make office hours. RARELY answered emails. Do not recommend.

I took virtually all of Prof. Shull's grad courses at the University of New Orleans pre-Katrina (Presidential-Congressional Relations, etc.) and I enjoyed him well enough. Kinda Goldilocks-like in that he wasn't too easy or too hard. Just right. Once you take a couple of his classes you have him down cold as he always follows the same template.
horrible.  one of the worst classes i have ever taken.  lecture slides were cluttered, many he even skipped over.  one of the most frustrating classes i have even taken.

Very nice and intelligent professor, a little old; will let you out of class early.  Lectures and readings are very important, he sometimes goes fast so copy the notes fast, if you read and take good notes its an easy A.  Others think he graded the paper hard but I got an A.

He's very knowledgeable, well known in his field and has a lot of creative, unconventional ideas. Important to keep up with the readings as the midterm (33%) and final (67%) heavily focus on the reading (of which there is a lot). Has an amusing, wry sense of humor which keeps lectures fairly interesting. Definitely worth taking, but tough.

A lot of reading. Tests are extremely specific and difficult (look at previous exams for types of questions) but there's a very significant curve. TAKE THIS CLASS! even though some lectures can be dry, he is incredibly knowledgeable and you will learn so much. great professor

Prof. Mueller is clearly very knowlegable on the subject and I thought the class was very interesting.  The slides in class are next to useless, and the exams are mostly on what he says in class and the books you are required to read. The books, esp. the one he wrote are easy to read and very informative, my favorite poli sci class yet.

I think he's a little crazy but I really enjoyed having him as a teacher. I learned A LOT in my class and he usually kept my attention. Definitely do the readings (usually one of the books is his.. haha). They came up a lot on the tests. GO TO CLASS. If you go and do the work it's honestly not that hard. It's very straightforward.

Read all of the material, at least come to class and you'll get an A on the exams.  The material is good, but he relies heavily on public opinion polls (in contrast to some of the assigned readings which show how irrelevant they often are) and his lectures often come off as self-aggrandizing.

Lectures are difficult to follow since they randomly just jump around subjects.  He posts his slides online so I just printed them and took notes on the print outs.  For the final I read all the readings he assigned in about two days and got a A on it since most of the essay questions were from the readings.

This guy really knows his stuff.  He is incredibly knowledgeable in his field.  The problem comes in his tests; they are really hard and incorporate very little from class.  If you do all the readings, then re-read them, and then go to his office hours and talk about them, you will do all right on the tests.

Mueller is a very good lecturer and uses a lot of hard to find video clips in class.  He pushed his own research/bias when we learned about current policies and terrorism.  Nevertheless, class was informative, and there wasn't too much work involved.  That said, keep up with the readings (take notes!) to survive the midterm (33%) and final (67%).

I REALLY enjoyed the class and the way he taught.  He was awesome and is extremely intelligent. I would definitely recomend not only taking a class with him but going to office hours to talk to him.  Hes a really nice guy and was extremely helpful when i had questions.
Tests are ridiculous, he doesnt prepare you for them at all.

Very very intelligent.  Has written several books on this topic.  Knows a ton.  Need to attend class to have much of an idea of what's going on.  Lectures are pretty good, but sometimes can get boring and he likes to go off on tangents occassionally.  Not easy, but not difficult either if you pay attention.  I got a B on the final and didn't read.

This man is EXTREMELY intelligent and knowledgable.  However, the tests are so hard that my 62% turned into a B+ after the curve.  Its rediculous to make the class that hard, but in the end, if you pay attention in class then you'll receive the grade you deserve.

This class is NOT difficult.  The tests are a bit hard but the curve is huge and if you pay attention, do the reading, and study you should do fine on them without the curve anyway.  This class is definitely worth your time.
thank god for the curve in the class!!!!!!!!!!!!
I think that I am in the previous reviewer's class.  In fairness to Prof. Mueller, there is a pretty good curve on the midterm.  It makes up for the difficulty on the test.
WTF!!!! Why does he have all these high marks? His midterm was f-ing horrible. everything i didnot prepare for was on it, trust me I prepared.oh yeah, looking at old midterms doesnt accomplish****!
Smartest teacher I ever had at OSU. Make sure you read and go to class. You'll take a million notes. Highly recommend you take his class.

i loved the class, he is really knowledgeable but the reading is insane. get a study group. his grader was an ****, but i think mueller recognizes who goes to lectures and rewards accordingly. i had bad test grades but never missed a class and talked to
No Comments
LOTS of reading, but alot of it was redundant.. Lots of material, but a very comprehensive course... Know everything for the midterm and final. Curves well...
Heavy reading, but a great prof

One of the best. Lectures are intense and fast, but once you adapt to his style, it's easy to anticipate their organization. Very, very knowledgeable guy, funny, and willing to engage in conversation after class. So long as you keep up on readings and never skip, you'll do fine - after the curve.

This guy is great. Lectures can be a bit circular, readings can be heavy, but he knows his stuff and he's respected in the field, and he is extremely willing to talk with students. This is definitely a guy you want to learn from--and brown-nose if you can
He rambles and stutters, but he manages to present his thoughts, and he's very smart.  He is willing to help you sift through the hype and actually figure out WHY some policy decisions are made.
very unclear on expectations.
Good professor, interesting ideas, but you don't get them until the end of the course. In the meantime the readings will degenerate your brain.

Nice guy, so not sure what all of the horrible comments are about! Attendance not mandatory but all exam questions are from lecture - didn't read the book once and still did well. Not the most exciting class but only meets 2 days a week and as long as you study you'll be fine. Grade comes from 2 midterms and a final. Didn't have to write any papers

Must read book and attend class to understand and to be able to get lecture notes, which is where the midterm questions come from. Okay class, worth 2 days a week for GEC credits if you can pay attention to lecture in class

Liddle is a really nice guy, but this class is awful. He gets off topic far too much, and it's really a waste of time to attend lectures, but attendance is required. The final paper is all research on your own- you don't even need to do the readings. I would avoid this class if you can, extremely boring.

Terrible at lectures. Really boring and veers off topic way to much to keep the class interested. Poorly organized and puts none of his things on Carmen. For a GEC class, the midterms are overly hard, and are straight essay midterms. Even more boring. I do not recommend his class at all.
Pretty good!Highly recommended!
Liddle is a nice guy but grades difficultly.  He assigns much work to his honors students and expects them to work accordingly.  Class excitement level is determined by students.
great guy, easy to understand his classes and very easy to get along.

Very nice man- let me add the course in the 3rd week with no problem.  Very friendly.  Can be a bit boring in lecture, tends to ramble on. Likes the subject a lot.  Grades are just 3 midterms which may be difficult if you miss lectures, so go to lecture and you'll be set. Lecture notes are often handouts. Easiest course i've taken at osu so far.

Dr.Liddle is extremely knowledgeable about the subject matter..but at times there is so much info that it becomes overwhelming..generally a nice man...and VERY lingwinded..probablly becuase he loves the subject matter..first part of class was tough if you don't really have a background in the subject..but latter half of class is easy..final paper

I rather enjoy Professor Liddle's style of teaching. He gets a bit longwinded but is very knowledgeable and always willing to help. The class is interesting and not difficult by anymeans. All in all, a good experiance

Can't tell what this guy is going on about.  Very interesting to talk to, but not about Political Science.  Has a lot of unrelated stories he babbles on about. I thought if I read the book I'd be OK, but it turns out he wrote the book, so those same unrelated stories are reiterated.  If you have a good TA they will tell you what to look for.
Very Knowledgable, Good amount of work.. had to write a 20-25 page paper for the final. However easy grader, and if you read and do the work you should be fine

This course is the most work you'll ever do for a GEC, but Liddle is worth it. He's passionate about the subject and clarifies confusing texts very well. The midterm and final 20 pg. paper were tortuous, but he's an easy grader. He even cancelled some classes so we had more time to write our finals. Great course, but slackers need not apply.

Come on, its a 100 level class.  Easy overall.  Great professor.  Very knowledgeable.  If you are responsible and go to lecture & recitation, as well as read the material you will do well.  If you get below a C in this class, you should probably drop out of school in general.

i managed to not go to a single lecture that entire quarter and got an a... i do not encourage it but it is the most boring class, he seems very smart and nicebut for freshman it is horrible, if you miss lecture be sure to memorize the notes and become buddies with your ta

Classes involved me sleeping...but in order to do well on the exams you have to be at the lectures...you can't just read. Oh and that book? You can't return it...so thanks for maknig me eat 100 bucks. Understanding however, was able to reschedule exam due to friends death. Depends too much on TAs (who again can't speak english)

not a very tough class. lectures can be a bit tough to stay awake through, but as long as you have an idea of the readings and go over class notes really well before tests its not bad. simple participation ups your grade too...easy
Liddle was a good professor. All he requires is that you do the reading and are engaged in your resitation. I would reccomend him.

VERY HARD... I purposely failed this class (didn't go to the final) so that I could take it again. I can't stand to get C's or below, so I didn't go to the final so I could use the whole "Freshman Forgiveness" and take it over without being penalized! He is very boring and too involved for intro cla
No Comments

Terribly dry lectures. Readings included two 200+ page books, one 400+, and two smaller ones, as well as probably fifteen or so readings, from 5-100 pages. Exam questions are given before, but are very unclear, and he isn't helpful when e-mailed. Would not recommend.

This class was insanely hard for an introductory Global Politics class. He assigned a ton of reading and asked the most ridiculously random questions from the reading on exams. DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS.

I'm convinced that not even a clone of Zoltan could get a good grade in this class. Zoltan is nice and very knowledgeable but grades far too difficult. Exams are ridiculously hard (asks the most insanely specific questions) and the paper is virtually impossible to get a good grade on even if you follow the prompt word for word. I regret this class.
Very funny and friendly professor, but his exams tend to be very hard. Also he takes attendance at the end of each and every class.

Nice professor with a great sense of humor--except when he is annoyed and grumpy. Attendance is mandatory and attendance sheet is circulated at the end of each class. He hands out lecture outlines in class, even though they are also posted on Carmen. The required textbook is however too long, uninformative and boring.

One of the harder professors I've had and mostly because of the confusion of what he wants more so than the actual content of the class. Exams are graded very subjectively with little explanation as to why. I suggest preparing yourself before the lecture and making an outline of the section for that day b/c lectures are very disorganized.

I liked this class a lot, even though I knew very little about Russian politics before I took it. The teacher was very funny, easy going and helpful. However, attendance was mandatory and regularly taken. And the assigned book was real awful.

A very interesting class. Attend lectures regularly and study hard for the exams and you will do well in this class. But if you don't or if you are lazy or dumb, you will be very disappointed at the end.

Nothing's more disappointing than being excited for a class and then having the professor ruin the entire thing for you. Extremely biased, very hard on students with opposing views. The textbook is not only old but just as biased and factually wrong as he is. Exams are a joke-it would have been better to just read the book. Useless and incompetent.
The professor is nice, funny and helful, but he is also a hard-grader and often very grumpy
Attendance is mandatory and don't expect an easy A in this class.

Attendance is mandatory and he expects ridiculously rigid and detailed answers when it comes to the essays (Class Avg : C-). he can be helpful and sincere, depending on his mood...but don't expect an easy A out of this course unless you're willing to attend every class and squint your eyes to figure out his handwriting on the board.

Watch out- takes attendance every class even though it often takes a long time. If you can pay attention for long enough you may find that he has a decent sense of humor, though he is often very hard to understand and hard to hear-- lots of people found his class hard to sit through.

I liked Dr. Rossen and enjoyed the class.  It would help a lot if he gave us his class outline online instead of writing it on the board each class.  Then we could concentrate on what he was saying instead of frantically writing.

I liked Dr. Rossen and enjoyed the class.  It would help a lot if he gave us his class outline online instead of writing it on the board each class.  Then we could concentrate on what he was saying instead of frantically writing.

He is extremely difficult for a intro course. but, if you go to class and take good notes you will do fine.  He loves detail and correct information. Indeed, he is a hard teacher but his essays will make you learn the material.  Good teacher, hard to understand at times...and pretty funny if you are listening.

Attendance is mandatory and taken at the end so you have to stay all class.  His study guides tell you verbatim what will be on the exam, but you have to do A LOT of extra work/preparing since you don't know which questions he'll pick.  Overall, an easy class

One of the worst professors I have had. Hard to understand, quiet, extremely boring, and sometimes just factually wrong. When he wasn't putting us to sleep in class, he was asking us to tell him what the really old and outdated book said or showing ancient horrible movies that went on forever. He seems nice and friendly but is boring and clueless.
He is hard, but sort of funny if you listen closely. Still, very grumpy.

He's a Complete Joke of a Professor.  The study guides for exams are just the headings from the textbook.  Extremely one sided and refuses to teach the other perspective.  Will isolate students who view politics differently.  Basically gives you 15 minutes of information in 2 hours.  Overall, the worst professor I've ever seen in my 3 years at OSU.

He expects a lot of detail and writing on the exams.  It is basically like writing 20 essay questions in two hours.  However, it is possible to do well if you study the study guide and show up for class (and try not to sleep).  Overall, he is very funny and helpful, however sometimes he is not very clear on what he expects.

Very helpful..Expects to write a lot in the exams. He gives out study sheet which basically covers most of the topics in the book. He uses letter grades instead of numerical. Sometimes his voice can make you sleep:) Actually there were people who slept in class :) Interesting class. Overall, study hard for the exam, he is not an easy grader.

Dr. Vassilev is cordial but hard to like. The accent didn't bother me but was incredibly suprised at how detailed the tests were for a 200 level class. Lectures were extremely dry with a lot of supplemental old 'movies'. Worst part is the book, it's outdated and extremely hard to read and digest clearly. In  grading, shows a clear bias of thinking
You need to study hard for this class

The Prof is very slow and the lectures were very disconnected. He makes some funny comments here and there, but it doesn't make up for the low quality and interest level of the lectures. There were a lot of movies and the book was painfully boring to read. The exams were very easy but too long and detailed. However, he gives the topics in advance.
Very nice and funny guy. While some people do, I had no problem with his accent. Just study what the study guides say and you'll do fine.

Very boring. The book used is horrible, written for a 7th grad intelect. The professor is very slow with material and very soft spoke. Maybe it was just because I was a senior in this 200 level class. Still ended up with a good grade, never going to class and putting in little effort.
No Comments

At first, the material was a bit hard to understand, yet as the quarter wore on, it became clearer to me.  We watched a lot of films that definitely made the material easier to understand. His exams seemed a bit hard, but if you study, you'll do fine.

Very nice guy and very informative.  Cant tell he knows his stuff. However, he can be really soft spoken and hard to understand at times, yet very funny as well.  Makes tests seem extremely hard, but tells you everything you need to know.

He speaks softly but he often cracks jokes and is very humorous. I like the fact that he showed at least 3 videos in class that took up entire class periods. He really made a night class interesting to go to.
I thought this class was painfully boring. Our final review sheet was just a list of the chapters. Maybe he used to be easy/good, but I dont think he is anymore.
You are an idiot if you can't pull off a good grade.  he gives you essay questions before every test. The questions aren't east but it is handed out on a silver platter.

A really nice guy but somewhat difficult to understand. He was very upfront about his essay tests but there was a lot of material. He wants you to do well and was willing to help. Go to class, take notes and read the material. You should be fine.

This guy gave us all the questions for the midterm like everyone said but for my class we had to answer over 50 questions in one essay. It was incredibly hard to answer each one in the time given. And for some reason when I got my midterms back my A's were whited out and changed three times...shady!

The first day of class, you'll hate yourself for signing up.  He's hard to understand but you'll get used to it and realize that the class is very easy.  He's very nice and he wants you to enjoy the class, and he'll help you out.

A very nice guy who, although he is difficult to understand at times, really does know his stuff. He gives you all the questions for exams, which may seem just a gimme, but I found I did learn everything he wanted to teach us. I still remember it all,also
Real Basic. Do your work, show up, say something and get an A.
Not the most interesting class but easy.If you need an A...this is the class for you. Vassilev is a nice guy..just talk to him and he will help you out!
No one ever came to this class, except the day before the exam, when he gave us all the answers.

I had her during Summer 2009 classes when I was a freshman. Attendance is mandatory, you WILL have a quiz every class. The midterms are easy, just READ her notes and you'll do great...but if u arent interested in poli sci this class is NOT for you. You also have a paper due every Sunday...a lot of work but if you do it it pays off.

I thought she was a good teacher and was very willing to help.  She is strict about certain things and thus she sometimes comes off the wrong way, but it's not a bad class.  Bottom line: if you're decent at math you'll do fine.

He's a great guy! I loved this class, and I learned a TON. If you go to class and pay attention, you won't have a problem with the midterm and the final, and he grades pretty easy on the final essay. I wish he taught more classes so I could take him again!

Professor Yildirim is a good professor who will help you if you need it. I don't know why these other entries are crying about the readings. Any political science class has a lot of reading involved, and to be honest the readings were pretty reasonable and interesting.
It was a tery rough class, a lot of reading online. Learned a lot though.
he's awesome! he expects quality work and for the readings to be done. he's also nice and smart. he'll help you and work with you. i highly recommend him.

His PowerPoint presentations are hard to interpret. He assigns LOTS of reading on Carmen; I personally dislike reading on the computer and there was too much to print out. He's also a bit biased in some respects (he assigned a reading that was banned by Harvard to teach from) but otherwise is very knowledgeable and overall a good instructor.

Very knowledgeable on the ME.  A lot of reading and regular quizes are required.  This should be a semester class as so much info is covered.  I recommend this class- you will learn a lot.  Rember this is a 500 level class, not 100 level.

This instructor has a bias toward Turkey, though he'll talk more about the country's role in Europe than the Middle East, though the class is supposed to be about the Middle East.  He overlooks important facts for frivolous details and overlooks important concepts.  And I am fairly sure that I know more about the ME than he does.  Avoid this guy!

Very good teacher. Policy memos are a pain but you certainly know your information and how public policy relates to it. Very monotone but clear and interesting. Attendance determined by your name being called out and he randomly asking you a question. Good class overall. Study hard for the exams!!

Professor Volden has a great ability to keep students engaged in a subject that may otherwise be boring. I think he is a fair grader - if you know the material, you will do well, but you have to actually go to class in order to do so. He's a very nice guy, willing to help if you need it - I would recommend him.

Professor Volden was very funny and kept my attention for the entire class.  I think that he teaches you everything you need to know in order to understand pubilc policy.  This class made me pick up the public policy minor actually.  I would fully recommend taking this class.

Hated this class! Like seriously, changed  my major hated this class. Volden is alright, he does the best with the subject, although the tests were tough and the policy memos pointless. Seriously considered trying to bribe him with a Mountain Dew for a good grade...avoid this class!!!!
Best professor I've had so far in college!  Go out of your way to take his class :)
Kind of boring class but its not that hard.  I enoyed the group project but he is a tough grader, also on exams because its very detailed.  Not an easy A but A- is achievable.

Ridiculous group presentation requirement.  Two three page essays on current issues.  He takes off points if you go OVER three pages.  How can you make a policy proposal on immigration in three pages!  YOU CAN'T!  No study guide for the final.  Nice guy.  Should have been a fun class, but it wasn't.

Took this class recently, the problem of taking too many notes has been fixed by his posting them on his website.  Gives a lot of good information on how the Legislature works at both the federal level and the state level.  Assigned a paper in which you had to write about the process of a specific bill.  Exams were essay and short answer.
No Comments

Dr. Volden is a great guy who runs a great classroom in which he treats students as adults. He is easily the most prepared professor I've encountered here. He is very prompt and surprisingly thorough in his grading. Although the class didn't honestly teach me that much new material, I enjoyed learning from him. Definitely a great professor.

I really hope you like taking notes. I took 53 pages of notes (front and back), for a total of 106 pages of notes. So it's a lot of material. Tests aren't bad and cover what's directly in the notes. He's a great professor though, very bright, and very clear. Take his class, you'll learn a ton!

Has extensive knowledge of business and govt. relationship, but makes it very clear.  Uses a lot of overhead; lots of notes.  Two bluebooks and a class presentation, which was fun.  Uses a lot of real world examples which makes the class easier to understand and interesting.
Really smart and always willing to help, but relies too much on overheads.  Be prepared to take LOTS and LOTS of notes and study them all.
Prof Volden is enthusiastic, intelligent, and a political genius. his classes are informative, well organized, and interesting. take his class
Very engaging in discussions.  Knows his stuff intimately.  Definitely take a small class with him.  Learned a TON.
He's awesome.  He expects a lot of research out of you for papers, but he grades them fairly, and you come out of his class knowing a ton.  The next time he teaches a Seminar, you better take it.

Dino is a decent instructor. He communicates the subject matter relatively clearly and tries to be helpful to his students, but you will learn more from the readings and doing the homework assignments than you will from his lectures. The class is A LOT of work, but if you put in the time you can easily get an A. Overall, a mediocre class.

I still hold that PS 485 is one the most valuable classes that I have taken at OSU. Dino was a big part of this and did a great job of communicating the subject material. He is genuinely concerned with teaching and helping. However, he will challenge you and if you are not willing to put in the work, it will be difficult to get anything above a C.

This professor has serious potential. His method of teaching is right on, he seeks to benefit students by giving a workload that reflects the amount of practice required to perform well on tests. However, his lectures, as well as assignments have serious organizational problems that keep him from being a truly "great" professor.

He's a joke, he gives a grade on a rough draft worth 15% of your grade. I made all the adjustments that he wanted and added a whole paragraph and my grade on the paper went from a C- to a C. I took another course from a very successful and published PoliSci Doctor and got a B+ on a similar paper. This guy doesn't know what hes doing.

If you are not a strong writer before coming in than you will not do well. He grades harshly while not instructing how to write a quality paper clearly. Instead, he just talks about politics every day. Quizzes are hard and will hurt your grade rather than help. Also, ratings on here are artificial bc he emails the class to rate him well on RMP

This is a difficult but doable class. One needs to be prepared to work but thats to be expected in a political science writing class. He grades tough but fairly and will give you the benefit of the doubt if you put in the effort. He has high expectations of his students but that is because he sets high expectations of himself as a professor.
He is a tough grader, but interesting class. Good teacher.

Very interesting teacher and an amazing guy.  Class is very tough but definitely rewarding if you stick through and do the work.  If you ever have trouble, he'll help you whenever you can meet (even off campus).  Study hard and do the readings!

Class was interesting, but very theory driven.  It was described as US Foreign Policy post-WW2, but we didn't even start talking about that until after the midterm.  If you're looking for case studies rather than theory, look elsewhere.

Goldstein is a great professor. He knows the subject matter very well and presents his lectures in a fun and entertaining way. Midterm is very difficult but it only gets easier. Plus he makes funny jokes.

Popmpous airbag who likes to hear the sound of his own voice too much. First half of the class is horrible. EXTREMELY theory heavy. Second half is much better, but still is really theory heavy. This class made me not want to take another PoliSci class.

Good professor, but theories can be very confusing.  He will try to test your understanding of them early and often.  Take the time to know them and ask questions because you will be behind before you know it.  Not a easy class by no means, but interesting
Lots of assigned reading, but very interesting.
Sit in the front and partipate and you will get an A with a little work. Not an easy prof though

Really interested in teaching. He knows a lot about the subject! Course material more difficult in beginning but it all come together in the second half. Lots of reading, not all of it necessary but usually interesting.

Takes teaching and class very seriously, which may be what people are taking as him being pompous, but he is amazing when leading discussions, and makes his points crystal clear. He is very accomdating and very interesting. Readings are interesting, but are not always necessary to read. Great class and a great teacher!!

Easily one of my favorite professors.  About a third of the class time is used to discuss and debate.  I found this to be unique and very helpfull.  He will correct people when they say something that is false and he helps guide the conversation.  There is a lot of reading but it isn't as mandatory as he claims.  Doing the readings does help though

This man is amazing! Reading some of the other statements I am thinking they rated someone else! He is articulate, very helpful, was very accomadating with my full-time work schedule, and with out a doubt you get out of this class what YOU put into it. If you want to really learn Mr. Golstein is the man!

Sort of dogmatic and a tad pompous in his lectures, occasionally comes off as condescending in open participation.  Exams are somewhat difficult in the way he words his questions.  He does assign interesting readings and including entertaining movies in the content of the class, as well as hit on many popular subjects pertaining to foreign policy.

He says that he is willing to answer questions but in reality he is an incredibly cold, pompous, an unapproachable professor.He assigns a lot of unnecessary reading, and many of his questions on tests are wordy and not concise. I would not recommend this class to anyone outside a political science major.
not a bad teacher, clear and concise.

You will get out of this class what you put into. He knows his stuff and you will come out with a great degree of knowledge if you put the work into it. A lot of reading, but worth it. Gives exam questions ahead of time so not passing his class is the student's fault.

I love political science, but hated this class. I am glad it was not my first PS class.  He almost came off as pompous.  It seems that older professors are way more relaxed and easy-going (NOT to be mistaken with easier).  Still learned a lot, but would expect that of a college course.
I feel I learned a lot, but he was extremely challenging.  Especially to a non-political science major.  Very open to talking about his class and makes himself fairly accessible.

Im surprised to see all these comments regarding discussion in his class-We have none.He puts it down,never asks the class quest. & answers them himself.Just likes to hear himself talk. Near condescending when giving instructions.This is college, we shouldnt have to be told for 30min not to plagerize or come to class. Worst PS class Ive ever taken
You end up learning a lot from his style of teaching and the material he requires. The class discussions are rich. He is very strict with attendance policy and reading for class. Not an easy A class.
Good teacher fair grader. LOTS of reading. Essays are a little tough but you have more than enough time to prepare for them.

Turns a fun and easy subject (Pol Sci.)into a hard and boring subject.The essay questions were too wordy and academically boring. Has no personality what so ever. He takes no stance on any international issues. I don't care what the author of an article thinks,I'd rather listen to what the professor thinks, even if I disagree with him.Waste of time
very boring and very hard class
very good teacher, makes the class extremely interesting and will challenge your thinking outside of the box enough to make the class very worth taking.

There was a lot of discussion in this class. He always prides himself on keeping his opinion out of lectures, but he's clearly right-leaning. However, he's very well-read and intelligent about the topic; I learned a lot from him. There is a lot of reading involved, and he is very particular when he grades, so this is not a class for slackers.
Testing and grading extremely difficult.  Very picky and particular.  Did well but had to work and read A TON.

Very interesting class with lots of discussion.  The only problem seemed to be getting everyone's opinion in.  The 'gunner' statement is true, although I think know-it-all is a better name.  Seth's a good moderator and a fair grader.  Be sure to go to class and at least skim the readings.  And, unlike the know-it-all, have respect for your peers.

The class can be unbelievably boring, and if you have a 'gunner' in there you'll want to shoot yourself because there is a lot of discussion. However, if you have any interest in politics, you'll learn a lot. The final is moderately hard but he grades fairly.
Great teacher. Assigns very imforn=mative readings and has very discussion-oriented classes. Grades toughly but fairly. great class to take to learn about contemporary foreign policy.
Seth was a very informed and very enthusiastic instructor.  I recommend his class.
Way too much reading involved in this class, but thankfully the lectures are enough to get by. Just make sure you attend class everyday and you'll be fine.

I enjoyed his class, you don't need to read much as he goes over everything in class. Gives very helpful study guides before long but fair exams. Lecture was very useful, skipping class isn't your best option in his classes.
He explained things well, gave good examples and made the class interesting.

He made the class out to be difficult and labor intensive, but in reality I hardly opened the books and doodled during lectures.  He is smart, but covers material very slowly.  If you have any general political knowledge or follow current events, you will do fine.

Lots of reading, but you can skim for main points or read what he said was important after class. The midterm was difficult because of a high number of theories discussed, but the second half of the course is more interesting and easier to follow.
Good dude, class was challenging but fun.  Goldsteins a pretty good teacher

Really good professor.  If you dont read the first half of the quarter your screwed, other than that the rest of the class is really interesting and the reading isnt as bad as the second half of the course. Take good notes. Other than that its a great class
There is a lot of reading, but you can skim for the main points, which is important for class discussion.  Good class to take, a lot of work, but worth it.
No Comments
No Comments
Even if you don't read the books, if you sit there in class, ask questions, and take good notes..you can do just great.  He is always up for suggestions to improve the class as well!!
That was for his POLI SCI 245 Class
Took his Cold War topic class.  Knows his stuff.  Discussions are usually interesting.
No Comments
Such a rewarding course to end the public policy minor! High intensity

He was an amazing professor! As a political science major, it's hard to find a class where you love reading the material, but this class is one of those gems. There's quite a bit of reading but it's mostly cases and applying the reading to those cases. The midterm and the final are take home.. sounds easy but I spent HOURS working on them. If you g
this dude is awesome. very understanding and actually CARES about his students

Professor Wiseman is extremely intelligent and very, very well educated from ivy league level schools. He is also a very nice man. However, PS 511 is a very difficult course and Wiseman's grading has no room for error. If you want a class that you will learn at the cost of lowering your GPA signfigantly, than this is your course.

The best professor I've had.  Loves to interact with students both in and out of class.  Really goes the extra mile to make sure that students who care understand the material and get the most out of the class.  Class project was highly educational and stimulating.

Dr. Wiseman's class is very challenging, and you will do a lot of work in it. But, if you're willing to come to class, to do the readings, and to participate, which is mandatory, then Dr. Wiseman is very helpful and will go out of his way to make sure you understand everything. I highly recommend taking this class. He's great.

Dr. Wiseman is great.  There is a lot of reading which you have to do, this is not a class where you can afford not to buy the books.  Lectures go the entire length.  He is extremely willing to help in and out of class.  I don't know what the previous entry was talking about; he did not leave OSU.
Good professor, but just left OSU (as of Spring 07)

Dr.Wiseman is a extremely knowledgable professor and scholar in his field. He tries very hard to be as helpful as possible.Honor's section is rigorous as should be expected...class projects and small presentations are stressful to prepare but end up being very fun to present and an interesting way to understand larger themes of the class...
Class was very interesting. Dr. Wiseman does a very good communicating the material in lecture. Cases are probably the best part. Group Project is very interesting as well.
i highly recommend taking this class with him..... he keeps the material interesting and actively involves students in the discussions while making the material easy to understand
Boooooooooooooooooring. The guy literally made me fall asleep in the front row.
I hated this class. Anyone not interested in Polysci at all DO NOT TAKE
AWEFUL. I hate politics anyway... but don't go to lectures, unless you need a nap. Just make sure you study for the exams and you'll be fine.
Most of the texts are pointless to buy. The classes drag on forever it feels like. All the slide shows are posted online... doesnt matter because the final will kill you.

The many texts were somewhat unnecessary, but reading FPV is a great guide to the exams.  The material is clear and not as dry as many poli sci courses can be.  Don't bother writing notes in class-- the slides go too quickly.

Professor Wiseman is a great teacher, even though the material can be dry (it's 101, what do you expect?) You'll know a TON about the U.S. government after. Go to his office hours if you have any questions, he's really helpful and fun to talk to about most anything. Study and you'll do great.

Talks & goes through slides very fast. Harder exams b/c they're not just multiple choice. You need to go to lectures and try and keep up, books are over-rated for this class. Buy the main text and forget the others. He gives you random info you don't need sometimes durring lecture--pay attention!

I LOVED THIS CLASS! I went through a phase freshman year when I didn't go to any of my classes except this one. Very energetic, funny and nice. Lectures were always interesting, and usually got out early. Tests were a little hard, but as long as you study you're fine. I highly recommend this class!
Finally, a good professor
He was a quality teacher..Talked a little fast but he knew his stuff.  One of the better teachers on campus.  His midterms are hard but as long as you study you are fine.
pretty funny
Obviously has no girlfriend because he has to get his rocks off by showing you how many pointless facts he knows, then mocks you on the exam for not knowing them too.

His lectures are very, very boring. THey go really fast. He is not energetic, speaks in monotone the entire time. Midterms and finals are cumulative and very hard and tedious. You are expected to know any current event in US government.
take his class!
awesome!! loved going to class
Very energetic....intelligent...enthusiastic proffesor!
Interesting lectures, excellent lecturer. Definately recommend.
Very informed; I would recommend him
No Comments
Very Intelligent, Interesting Lectures
This was the worst professor I have ever had. The class isn't difficult but she has no idea what she is teaching. And to make things worse her english is extremely poor.

Horrible! Writes on the chalk board and does NOT explain things well. you have to go to class.BE PREPARED TO TALK ALOT ABOUT CHINA. She will go in depth about her country and THE QUESTIONS WILL B ON THE MIDTERMS AND FINAL. The text book is useless DONT BUY IT. Most of the quizzes were based off our readings from carmen. Class wasnt hard.
Takes attendance every day.  Four pop quizzes.  Terrible clarity and hand writing, Unorganized teaching...hard to make it to class when i want to shoot myself everytime i step in the classroom.

Emilie is a very helpful teacher and she does her best to keep students engaged in the material. She is very eloquent in explaining the material and tells you exactly what you need to know to get a good grade and know the topic. Her grading is fair - if you know the material, you will do well. I would definitely recommend her.

Emilie was a great teacher. She expects her students to know their stuff, but if you are willing to put in the work, you shouldn't have any problem getting an A. She is always willing to help students and give them feedback/clarification. Sometimes she is hard to hear in class, but other than that highly recommended. You'll learn a lot from her :)

Ms. Becault is really great. She goes way out of her way to help students who care. She is a tough grader, but is fair. If one is willing to work, one will receieve the grade that he or she deserves, and at the same time, learn a great deal.
One word...Awesome! Take her, you will definitely learn a lot of new information and she makes international relations theory interesting. She also is very willing to help students.

Emilie is great. She keeps the topics relevant and interesting and has very structured notes. She is also very clear-cut in what she expects and will help students improve their reading, writing and analytical abilities. I wish she taught additional classes. If you get the chance, take her!...don't let the readings scare you

Emilie was very sweet and helpful, answered every question thoroughly and allowed each student to express her/his opinion.  Though there is a decent amount of reading, she covers the material thoroughly in class and gives very clear study guides for her tests, including word-for-word essay questions.  Not a difficult class.  Instructor is wonderful
This class may sound interesting but most days you will find yourself asleep! Way too much reading and everything had a liberal twist...do not waste your time with this course...

Okay, while the material and readings may be a little difficult at times, emilie is really great. She is more than willing to help students if they ask. She is extremely well versed on the material and was able to keep her personal bias out of debates. It is really great that she includes the class and prompts discussion..you will LEARN a lot!!
Okay, she is a really nice GA, however, she treats this class as if it were a 500-600 level course. Way too much work, many time 50-60 pages of reading before each class, over the top.

I took this class as a GEC and it was a huge mistake. If you are not a poly sci major then I would stay away from this one. The grading is horrible. Also, not only do you have a midterm and paper to write, she still requires a final too. Usually the paper takes the place of that. Says you should read material 3 times which is sometimes 40 pages.
Todd is like a political Tom Cruise.  He makes politics handsomely interesting.  This class also kills two birds with one stone so I highly suggest taking it.

This class covers a large amount of information in a short amount of time.  The classes are very dry and tiring as you try to absorb the massive amount of info.  Todd is very bright and willing to offer assistance, but he struggles to clearly explain this complex text to non data geeks. Only take this class if you have a lot of time!
He is a great guy. He is a brilliant teacher and I learned so much about American politics. He is helpful and would do anything for his student.
Very knowledgeable about the topic. He was willing to give assistance and tried to engage class in topics.  You will need to show up and participate for a good grade but the grading is fair

Todd is a great guy and he is very helpful.Unfortunatly this class is impossible. There would be days when I'd go ask him for help but I the material was so complex I couldn't even formulate an answer. Cheating in this class is impossible becaues no one knows the answers!
Hard class but due to the content of the class and not any intentional actions of teacher.

Todd was as helpful as a professor could possibly be. The material was difficult but he is the guy you want teaching it. The guy would probably do backflips if he thought it would help one of his students.

Don't take this class just because you need a methodology class for your DARS and don't want class on Fridays. This class is HORRIBLE! Its so extremely hard. Teacher, IMO, is very helpful and nice but the class can't be dumbed down anymore than he did. I think I failed it ((grades are still pending))

Lecture extremely boring and attendance is mandatory. Todd seems like an ok person but this class is awful. There are quizzes over the readings and there is homework assigned out of the books.  Books cost nearly $200 just for this class! It seems he could have explained concepts without being as technical and it would have made class more tolerable
No Comments
No Comments
He is just simply one of those lecturers who teach you to think for yourself. Great looks too!!
love his class, he is too cute!

Vossing was a great teacher! There was no textbook which was great but that meant you had to go to every class to get the notes. However, he was very interesting so class wasn't bad and the tests were not that bad

Konstantin was the best professor I've had in a long time. He really just wanted us all to understand the material. He was also not hard to look at, which made class a lot more enjoyable. I would recommend him to anyone.
Great at communicating difficult material very clearly. Helpful and friendly.

Konstantin is awesome. His class is very easy if you go everyday and pay attention. He is definitely interested in helping the students as much as he can. Even if you answer something wrong in class, he makes you feel like you were still on the right track. His grading system is awesome and he's adorable.
Great class, wonderful professor!

Good professor, seems to be interested in helping students.  Term paper isn't bad either, but when he graded mine he told me it didn't relate to the topic and i got a 50, didn't quite understand it, but still got a B so im not complaining.  Grading Scale is awesome btw

One of the best teachers I ever had. Amazing lecture, you learn a LOT, but that doesn't mean it's too hard, since he communicates the matter well. Take his classes and you get an interesting lecture, a fair grade (but not an easy A), and learn a great deal!

He is a wonderful lecturer. He plans his lectures carefully, therefore his lectures are heavily detailed.  In addition, he gives the necessary tools for students to analyze and formulate their own opinions. He is also quite helpful if students need additional help or want to debate discussed topics.  Great class.
Great Teacher. take his class.
One of the best professors I have ever had.  He is smart, enthusiastic and a great lecturer. His exams are a little hard, but if you go to class, you will surely get and A (you'll also learn a ton).
Best teacher I have had at OSU.
Great class and teacher
kind of boring
No Comments

Very interested in making sure that everyone understands the concepts discussed.  The lectures are easy to follow and he encourages opinions and open discussion.  Thanks to a modified grading scale, it is somewhat easier to do well, but there is still a lot of material to cover and that you will be responsible for in exams. An excellent teacher!
Doesn't show up to class.
Very amusing in class, shows a lot of personality.  Helpful grading scale.  Attending class a must, but it makes the readings less essential
No Comments

Excellent teacher.  Very clear in what he expects, and clearly lays out theoretical perspectives.  Do not miss classes or you will get lost in the class...make sure to take good notes. One PROBLEM with him: He is not accessible to students to discuss topics or problems from class.  It is a major shortcoming since otherwise he is a great professor.
Incredibly helpful and informative
I've taken two classes with Konstantin and gotta say, really easy grader. He's very helpful and doesn't require tons of readings.
Great Teacher. Really cares. Take all and any of his classes.
This is a wonderful class.  He was always helpful and willing to accomidate to your needs, i.e., rescheduling tests and e-mail lecture notes if you needed them!
Take his class! He is helpful and clear.  Very interesting and he will try to help students understand the topics.
British Accent, decent teacher. LOTS of book reading that jumps around (takes pieces from some text books and meshes them all together).

I totally disagree with the last comment- Mr Arnold is a great teacher.  He is very helpful.  That comment was probably written by the guy who sat at the back of class and insulted other students.  This is a tough class, but you get a lot out of it.

Terrible Teacher, not helpful in any way (especially at office hours). Extrememly difficult and specific quizzes with vague questions. Bad grader on the three papers you have to write (I've gone to other PS teachers who say my writings would have netted A's in their classes but only got B's in his class). Don't take this class unless necessary.
Terrible Teacher.  Wants you to read 75 pages a class and then asks you quiz questions like "In what year..." Don't take this class...
Fantastic teacher and really good looking
Great teacher.  Impassioned about his subject and has easy quizzes (tells you the class before what you should look out for).  Easy to score an A.
Vague at times, but certainly not the worst teacher I've had.  Mostly easygoing.

Horrible teacher,  very boring, his quizzes ask question very specific to the text, he expects you to read more than 50 pages a night and remember a direct quote just for his class, Awful teacher do not take unless you HAVE to

Professor Langfield was great.  She strongly encouraged discussion and participation and never revealed a bias in either direction.  VERY fair grader and straightforward with the material without over-simplifying it.  She kept the topics interesting and took an interest in each student.  GREAT PROF.

This class would have been very interesting had she not taught it. All the readings were printed off carmen, so that was nice, but she didn't cover them well. Her lectures were horrible, 'group activities' were also terrible, and no one participated. We understand the material, but she tried to make it more complicated. terrible paper. AVOID

hard course.gives tons of reading.class quizes are easy if you read everything and make notes while reading.her paper grading is a little difficult.she explains stuff well. only problem is she is right-leaning/bias. does not give both sides of the picture and always supports western governments.book review not easy, has to be comprehensive.

I hated this class. It was way too hard. Quizes are easy. Just study definitions for each chapter. Tests are ridiculous and unfair. Don't take this class with this teacher if your trying to get an easy A.

Tests are very hard. You have to look for the most minute detail in the whole chapter to get his test questions right. His "review" sheets for the tests are couple sentences that are not helpful.  I recommend not taking his class.

This professor is awesome. He's super clear, very easy to follow, and makes lectures interesting and enlightening. He asks questions that get the class motivated. You should go to class, as exams are not exclusively from the book. Fortunately, the classes are not boring.

The class is awful.  I would never have signed up had known this.  Its powerpoint notes, and you sit in front of your computer and type verbatim what he has down.  the notes are not online, so you pretty much have to come.  He is a good prof, its just the material is dry as a dictionary.  Doesn't accept late work, and kind of a tough grader.

Great Professor!  Extremely knowledgeable, interesting, and challenging.  I would seek out to take a class that she teaches again because she is able to teach and engage the class in discussion.  I'm sorry to see her leave OSU :(
She is very nice and easy to understand. Always available when you need help. She is not partisan at all and that made it feel good to sit in her class.

Miss Hanada was easily understandable but lacked the clarity or the desire to truly want to teach. Subjects were interesting and no bias is evident but graded very closely and on items not even covered in reading or in notes. Does not link concepts well to real world.Overall, nice person to work with despite this.
Lots of interesting stories about her life in Japan.

She is a very cool teacher that has a great insight on the subject.  She involves the class in her lectures to get opinions on the curriculum as well as tell a lot of personal stories in her life that makes it seems like we are not in class.  She is funny and cool, and I would advise her to any other student.
